title: Wonderful service from Syeda!
text:
Today we checked in the Millennium hotel Time square. Lovely service from Syeda at the lobby, besides quick service we also felt super welcomed by her!

With a wonderful look from the inside of the hotel, im exited to stay in the Millennium hotel!!!

10/10

title: Sauna on the 27th floor
text: We had so many issues with this hotel. I'll start with the good. Staff and Location were excellent. Now the bad, toilet leaked horribly in both rooms. In one is soaked the carpet and we had to switch. In the other, engineering was able to repair mostly with minor leaks after. When you took hot showers the walls around the toilet and other areas 'sweat' and you couldn't touch any. We also had an unexplained leak in one of the window sills. Out TV stopped working and engineering had to come in for about an hour and fix. After that, my hubby would duplicate the process when it conched out. The AC stopped working at random times and the room became a sweat box. We adjusted temperature, settings etc but nothing worked. We got tired of calling engineering and had to open a window (27th floor) to let in the freezing 40 - 49 degree weather to survive.  We also were leaving a hot room sweaty to go into a freezing NYC temp. This made us sick and Im stilll nursing that cold a week later. I expected better from a 4star hotel. I could forgive it being outdated, limited (1) outlet, etc but this was a horrible experience. I think the location of this hotel is its saving grace.

title: Location!
text:
Brilliant location in the heart of Manhattan close to all the main tourist areas.

Room good size and well equipped. Excellent staff and all very friendly. Syeda went above and beyond on check in and started our trip off brilliantly.  Would recommend.

title: Excellent
text: Ms. Syeda’s customer service at check in and during our stay was 5 Stars every time we asked her for information and also with her assistance for an additional room.  Very professional, friendly and professional. We are looking forward to staying here again in the future.

title: Amazing
text: Syeda is absolutely fantastic. Friendly, generous, kind and informative. The check in process was easy and fast. Syeda’s hospitality was the best part of my stay. Please give her the highest praise for all her hard work and dedication to the job.

title: Syeda’s the best!
text: Syeda was truly amazing and a godsend! She happen to help out my sister and I smoothly transition into our room. Not only did she lend out a hand she also informed us of multiple useful tips when at the hotel. The view was absolutely amazing and couldn’t have had a better time anywhere else!

title: Felt Right at Home
text: After walking  from Grand Central into the thé Millenium Hôtel, we were at once greeted with a smile and felt instantly “at home”. Upon checking in, Syeda promptly welcomed us with the kindest grin and asked how she could help. She was extremely courteous and incredibly knowledgeable and detailed in explaining the property, I can’t express enough how rare it is these days to be addressed with graciousness. It should be a given, but, unfortunately, it’s less and less common. I’m writing this all to sing Syeda’s praises and to thank her for her elegant demeanor. Give that girl a raise! The Millenium Hotel is lucky to have her.

title: Great value
text: Terrific care on check in and for my stay. I’ve been staying here for more than 34 years and it’s always on point. Syeda got my room early and arranged for my late check out. Nice location with proximity to Times Square, theatre, and transportation

title: Great Experience Front Desk was Amazing
text: Daniel was great!  Beautiful hotel and friendly staff!  Very close to everything you need!  We walked from Gand Central, and were greeted warmly, the room was very nice.   We look forward to staying again the next time we come to the city for business or pleasure.

title: Improper billing!!!!
text:
Good morning!
I booked two rooms at this hotel to spend 10 days with my family from February 3, 2024 to February 13, 2024.
The accommodation was fully paid for at the beginning of the trip with DECOLAR, the travel operator. However, upon check-in, the hotel required a deposit as a guarantee, which would be refunded at the end of the stay. It turns out that this deposit amount, in the amount of U$346.30 for each room, was not refunded, having been debited from the card at the end of the stay. More than R$3000.00.. absurd!!!!

title: Great customer service
text: We had Syeda help us out at the front desk, even though we came a bit early and needed some help with a room change she was patient, knowledgeable and very helpful. She clearly explained all of our options and then gave us a very fair price. Good customer service is hard to come by these days, and I’ll def be coming back.

title: Worst hotel experience, dirty , old , no amenities which most hotel offer for free
text:
***DO NOT BOOK ROOMS UNTIL YOU READ REVIEWS***
I am currently staying in the hotel and there is nothing 4* about this hotel except location.
The outdated rooms are extremely dirty. Curtains have not been washed in years! Walls, carpet , furniture are all dirty and old. Even reception counter is broken and taped up, credit card readers are filthy and dusty. I have booked two rooms here and have to stay as I already paid for them , it’s a horror story. Checked in first night 1room we stepped in to see lots of hair on the floor, changed to another room, both bath tubs had issue one didn’t drain the other got flooded had to wait to fix and clean it after a long flight with kids after complaining to the hotel we got two boxes of chocolate left in our rooms to make us feel better!!no offer of changing rooms to a cleaner new room, no offer of discount or refund, only chocolate boxes to say thank you for spending around $4000 at our dirty hotel.
I will feel better if newer , cleaner rooms are offered not chocolate.
Did I mentioned broken curtain rail hanging from ceiling ?
4 days into our stay and still bath doesn’t drain so the hotel expects us to just stay in and report broke baths etc. instead of enjoying our holiday in New York. Worst hotel experience , there are thousands of hotels in this area don’t choose this one.

title: Good value for money in the heart of Time Square
text:
Hotel well located in the heart of Time Square.
Rooms dated but clean and sufficiently spacious.
Hotel overheated in winter, more than 25°C in some rooms and it is not possible to adjust the temperature.
We were changed rooms for a cooler one.
No breakfast in the hotel or room service, everything is nearby.

title: Business trip April.

title: 5 star

title: Unexpectedly memorable
text:
The only reason I booked this hotel was because we had spare credit card points, and this was the only hotel near our destination.    I hardly imagined the hotel itself would be a high point of our NYC visit!

Turns out, I, my mom and sister were assigned a room on the top floor.  The view was jaw-dropping!  We spent the first half hour just gaping out the window.  Then, it also turned out to be even closer to our various destinations than I had thought.  

The room was quiet.  The beds were comfortable.   

In the end, I learned that someone on staff had upgraded us to that top floor room.  We appreciated it immensely.  Thank you to Syeda, Kayla, and whoever checked us in.

title: New York State of Mind
text:
When we flew into New York ( first time being here in the city ) we arrived at the hotel via cab and were able to check in but had to leave luggage because the room was not ready.  That wasn’t bad because we went and grabbed some brunch down the street.  We got back and promptly were able to check in.
Now comes the fun part.  We were on the 50th floor with breathtaking views of the city ( my favorite part ).  The ac really did not work the whole time we were there and had to make do with having the window open but of course that made for a huge wind tunnel.  The pillows were quite lumpy but the bedding was quite perfect.  
When taking the elevator, sometimes they worked and other times they did not.  Half the time they never lit up so you could never know which floor you were on.
Also to note, the concierge desk closet to elevator, the Asian gentleman was quite rude to my husband.  My husband went to inquire about the gym and he was quick to cut him off with telling him he needed a key as if to presume we weren’t guests of the hotel when he could’ve found that out and provided the correct information.
The other thing that wasn’t great was the fact there was no restaurant on site at all.  A restaurant would definitely be beneficial to the hotel and bring in a lot of money.
In conclusion I’ve read past reviews with regard to the ac and then us having to deal with that is quite shocking to be honest with replies from the hotel saying the issues are being fixed when they are not.

title: Easy and fun!

title: Great location, shame about everything else
text: Overall I would not recommend this hotel. Check in is not until 4pm and they mean this - no chance of checking in any earlier which to me is a really late check in when check out is average at 11am. The room itself was old, dated and dirty. The shower had no power and would fill up with water and not drain properly, this meant I had to keep stopping and starting the shower. The hair dryer was full of dust and dirt, unusable. We stayed at the hotel for a week and not once did someone hoover the room or properly clean it - towels were replaced daily but that was it. I think a week stay would require at least a basic hoover of the room. I didn’t find the staff overly welcome - I asked about having a fridge in our room (there was a clear gap where the fridge should have been) and was told to contact maintenance myself who work normal working hours, this isn’t ideal as during these hours we would be out exploring the city so we just went without. The gift shop that sells snacks is overpriced - go to the shop across from the hotel for better value snacks. The only positives were the location and view. We had a nice view of neighbouring buildings from our room and the location couldn’t be better for Times Square and Broadway. However, I still would not recommend this hotel.

title: Hospitality Gold in Times Square
text:
What made The Millennium Times Square wonderful throughout our three-night stay was the fantastic team of associates who work there.

The moment our group of 78 high school students arrived, Lead Doorman, Marc, set the tone for our visit with his genuine welcome. Then he unloaded our two motor coaches - luggage and orchestra instruments - with humor, enthusiasm, and speed.

Even though we arrived at a peak check in time and we crowded the Lobby,  the entire staff treated our students like valued guests. The Front Desk team wowed by immediately having our 78 room keys ready. The Front Desk manager and Guest Service agents were always especially gracious.

Erika, the morning Concierge, and Marc, the Lead Doorman, were our super heroes. They are Hospitality GOLD. They extended many unexpected kindnesses. Ask Marc about his amazing Green Smoothie recipe! 

If you are looking for a perfect hotel, I suppose you can look in many places but if you’re seeking genuine hospitality and the kind of reassurance that only a staff made up of people who really  care can give, consider The Millennium Times Square. - MG/Tour Director

title: Avoid The Millennium Hotel at all Cost
text: I will never stay at the Millennium Hotel again. When I checked out this morning the bellman informed me about what has happened to this once wonderful hotel. Two years ago it came under new management. It’s in such a prime location and it advertises one of the best rates in the city but it’s simple not true. A $150 “facility fee” was tacked on each night AND only one elevator was working all weekend. The bellman said it’s the same scenario every weekend. There are Holes in the towels and washcloths. Tiny bottles of soap. The last elevator failed this morning. Thirty people waiting in line to check in with no idea what they were walking into. Hotel guests stuck in elevators. The Fire Department parked in front. Complete and utter DISASTER. The people working there are kind and thoughtful. The management company is thousands of miles away. They could care less. We check in. They take our hard earned money and tack on more. So much deception. Please pass the word.

title: Mediocre

title: VERY UNHAPPY
text:
We stayed at the Millennium Hotel Broadway Times Square and were very disappointed.
Very cold welcome and the first thing we are asked is to make 2 credit cards of $100 ($100/room) for the deposit which supposedly will not be debited.
When checking out, we ask the receptionist if there is anything to settle and she tells us that everything is good and that there is nothing more to pay.
BUT to my great surprise when I returned, I discovered that they debited 266 euros from my account which does not correspond to anything specific because I have no invoice corresponding to this amount. Neither by email nor during check out!!!!
It is SCANDALOUS to take advantage of the travelers credit card supposedly for an undebited deposit and take the opportunity to charge an unjustified amount and without an invoice!
I expect a quick response and refund from you

title: Great hotel reception

title: Although we had a great experience in New York, Millennium leaves much to be desired.
text: I regret to share that our stay at this hotel was far from satisfactory. the great location and hardworking maintenance and housekeeping staff were overshadowed by numerous issues. Although a refrigerator is not promised, we were under the impression that one would be provided upon request, however after several requests over our 4 day stay we did not receive one due to a short supply of refrigerators to accommodate all guests. There was also no microwave or coffee maker— neither were advertised but still inconvenient not to have. When checking in, we were told by the front desk we had to wait a little longer because they were “frantically cleaning rooms.” This is where our concerns began. When we entered the room, we found what seemed to be pubic hairs left in the shower and other hairs left in the bed sheets, which we called and had our sheets replaced by a very nice member of housekeeping. This housekeeper also informed us that there would only be heat, so it’s best to keep the windows open and turn off the thermostat. The tv in the room would freeze after a few minutes of playing, where youtube and other tv channels would not load. We called to report this and a maintenance man, Garry, was sent. He was super nice and helpful, he brought us a tv from another room, but it still didn’t load. It seemed to be a hotel wifi connection issue, not something he could fix but he still tried. The shower drain did not work properly, leaving us in a tub full of water by the end of our shower. It took about 15 minutes to drain after the water was off, but what appeared to be the moldy lining of the pipes came up out of the drain and left residue on the floor of the tub (photo attached). After being outside all day with no allergy issues, upon entering the room each night we quickly became severely congested and kept sneezing. We requested a hypoallergenic room, but we were informed they didnt have designated hypoallergenic rooms because they don’t use feathers or harsh fragrances. When checking out, we voiced our concerns to the rooms manager, Rackie, who was condescending and short with us. He informed us that if we were to have communicated with the front desk in person, then these issues would have been logged. We had made several calls via the room phone to report these issues to the front desk, but Rackie said these calls were not logged. After suggesting that we could provide the times that we called so he could backtrack the phone log, he quickly asserted that it was “common sense” for us to have come to the front desk to speak in person instead of calling. Although we had a great experience in New York, Millennium leaves much to be desired.

title: Weekend Getaway with my 6 y.o Daughter.
text:
Just got home to Boston from a weekend trip with my daughter. This was by far the best experience I have ever had at a hotel. We arrived Saturday morning earlier than expected (10:00am) since we had spent the previous night in New Jersey by American Dream. Upon arrival , my daughter and I were greeted by Jenny at the front desk. Jenny was inviting, had a smile and began interacting with my daughter who was extremely excited to be in NYC. We were there to explore Times Square the first day (Saturday) as well as some other places NYC city had to offer. Sunday we were seeing Harry Potter and the Cursed Child around the corner on 214 W 43rd street. I did not expect our room to be ready since I was so early and the plan was to leave our bags and go out and enjoy ourselves. As Jenny began my check in, my daughter was filling her in on all the fun stuff we were going to do together. Jenny was so patient and inviting to her the whole time. Not everyone is great with kids, but Jenny truly knocked it out the park. Jenny then looked at me and asked “Is it just you and your daughter” in which I replied “Yes. I don’t really get to spend as much time as I’d like with her since I work a lot. I wanted to treat her to some fun with her dad and figured this would be a special getaway for us both.” This was also my first time in NYC. I’m a firefighter so i tend to work many hours, sometimes gone for 3 days at a time, and don’t see my family nearly as much as I’d like to. Jenny was very taken by this I could tell. She verbalized how sweet that was, and how meaningful this must be for my daughter. As Jenny was checking me in, she confirmed I booked a double bed room for two nights. I confirmed that was correct. She then asked me to wait a moment and walked into the office. At this moment I took a second to look around the lobby. The hotel is very clean, has a nice gift shop and is decorated elegantly. It’s also in the heart of Times Square, less than a minute walk from the the main area. Jenny came back, and explained to me that she had just spoken with her manager Elli. She said “Elli and I were both very taken by your story and think it’s such a special occasion you are here and want to make this as special as we can for you and your daughter.” I responded “ I appreciate it, but just being here with her is special enough.” Jenny then said “We have a room ready for you (which as early as it was, I was very pleasantly surprised) but since it’s just the two of you, we’ve put you in a king bed instead of the double full. My manager Elli has also approved a complimentary upgrade for you. A king suite with an amazing view.” At this time I was completely shocked. I expressed my gratitude to Jenny. She again explained to me how nice it was to see me there with my daughter and they wanted the best experience for us. She said my story was very touching and they were more than happy to upgrade me. I was given my room keys for room 5201. I expressed my thanks again and headed to the elevator. To my surprise, there are 52 floors and it appeared our room was on the top floor. We headed up, got off the elevator and walked
To our room. When we opened up the door my mouth hit the floor. We had a full separate living room area, with two couches, a huge tv, a refrigerator, sink and microwave. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. A large full bathroom was just off the living room area. My daughter ran over to the window and screamed in joy “Daddy come look at this!” I went over and again JUST WOW! The view we had of Times Square was absolutely breathtaking. We then walked though a pair of double french doors which opened up to another full bathroom ahead of us. To the left of the bathroom was a beautiful king size bed, tv, arm chair and another amazing view. We were in a corner room so had two different views of Times Square. We could see the New Year’s Eve ball from the bedroom. It was just unreal. I never in my wildest dreams could have pictured myself in a suite like this. My daughter ran around for what seemed like an hour , just so excited , taking it all in. I told her how lucky we were to be in a room like this. She screamed “ OH THANK YOU EVERYONE!” Again, I want to add how clean the suite was all around. After a half hour of getting settled in, the phone rang and it was Jenny from the front desk, making sure we were satisfied and I once again expressed my upmost gratitude to her and Elli. She said it was there pleasure and to call if I needed anything for my stay. The cleaning staff was stellar, we’d come back to a tidy and organized room that was cleaned and smelled amazing! The next day, we passed Jenny in leaving and she had a teddy bear and a box of chocolates for my daughter. I mean, as if they couldn’t be any nicer! Overall, if you were to take out the upgrade, I’d still be giving the hotel 5 stars. I know this was an extremely long review but not enough compliments, gratitude and words can be said for the experience I had here with my daughter. Memories I will never forget and cherish forever. Thank you Jenny, Elli and the rest of the staff at Millennium Hotel. I am forever grateful and was blessed to have this amazing experience.l with my daughter. See you all again this Summer with the rest of the family who can’t wait to stay and meet you all! 

Forever grateful,
Bryan P

title: Millenium Broadway Fails Basic Hotel Requirements
text:
My adult daughter and I booked a five night stay at the beginning of December 2023 at the Millenium Broadway New York Times Square Hotel. At $600/day with tax ($3000 for five days), this was the most expensive hotel we have ever stayed in. Also one of the most disappointing. We arrived late at night and woke up early on our first day. We went to the front desk with a list of what we thought were simple requests.

1. We asked for outlets next to our double beds. The only place in our room where we could plug in our phones and other electronics was in the bathroom. 
2. We asked for a coffee maker. 
3. We asked for a second bedside lamp since we had two beds and one lamp to share between us (the hotel charged us an extra $50/night for twin beds). 
4. We also asked for help with turning on the TV. 

Then we went out for the day. We were gone for the entire day. We did not put a “Do Not Disturb” sign on our door. We came back in the evening to wet towels and unmade beds. No one had entered our room during the day to bring in any of the things we asked for and no one had cleaned our room.

The following day a staff member came in to set up the TV.  It took two more days to get a coffee maker and also two days to get an extension cord that one of the hotel service people plugged in behind one of our beds so we could get power in the bedroom for our phones. We never did get that extra lamp for the second bed. I do not blame most of this on the front desk staff. The concierge and front desk folks were nice and efficient. It's just a really badly run hotel. I do have a problem with a hotel that does not have outlets and bedside lamps and daily cleaning in their basic business model.

There were other issues with the hotel. 

The whole hotel – elevators and hallways – seemed a little run down. But not as scruffy as our room. Our room had ceiling stains, peeling wallpaper, a gouged desk, a badly cracked sink and tub, and a few other unidentifiable stains.

The hotel cafe was closed and there was no place in the hotel to sit. The hotel does have a lobby, but, except for two short backless benches facing the check in desk, there is no place on the property outside of the hotel room to sit. No place to wait. No place to go while other people may be trying to sleep while you are awake.

We had another day when the cleaning staff arrived just as we were changing for dinner. Maybe staff who work in the morning are hard to find in New York, but I’ve never stayed in a hotel that did this poor a job of meeting basic cleaning requirements.

I wrote all of this in the survey that the Millenium emailed me. I said that it would be nice to have some kind of refund for our pretty awful experience. They offered $5.

This is the hotel’s reply to my survey and negative review. It made me laugh:
" From all of us at the Millennium Broadway New York Times Square, thank you for completing our survey. We truly appreciate your feedback. It will help us improve.

As a token of our appreciation, get USD$5 off your next stay …

Thank you again, and we hope to see you soon!

Best regards,
Vikram Sardana
General Manager
Millennium Broadway New York Times Square "

title: Great Hotel In A Great Location
text:
I stayed at this hotel for five nights in March and would definitely come back. Not only was the hotel itself lovely in terms of the room being clean, the bed being nice and having a good amount of storage etc.

Surprisingly, even though this hotel is located in Times Square, once you are in your room it is very quiet - not even much noises coming from other rooms/guests! I also liked how you had the option to go down the street to TS itself or go the other direction and walk around TS if you aren't keen on how busy the area is.

I also wanted to mention how incredibly lovely the staff are, when checking in we came to some issues due to not being fully informed about some things by our travel agent - who I had asked many times for all the details we needed and was told whenever I called or text that we had everything set - and the staff went above and beyond to help us in the ways they could and took the weight off of our shoulders so we are incredibly grateful to the hotel manager and the people working at the front desk.

title: Find another hotel, forget the Millennium Broadway....
text: My stay was not enjoyable. I've stayed at the Millennium Hotel before and it is going downhill.  The bathroom had a broken toilet paper holder, so the rolls were on top of the toilet and they must have changed the actual toilet at some point because it was so big, you could not open the door all the way as it was hitting the toilet. Bad planning by someone, that's for sure.  When I checked into my room, I looked around for plugs so I could use my laptop and charge my mobile phone. No plugs available on any wall.  I had to pull out one of the night stands and luckily there was an extension cord for the bedside lamp and it had an available plug that I could use to charge my phone.  I first started staying at the Millennium when it first opened, the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Somewhere along the way, they changed the mattresses and pillows. If you like a bed that is hard as a rock, then you will enjoy the new mattresses. The pillows and pretty hard too, not soft and comfortable.  As far as I can tell, the room was lacking two lamps, one on the desk and a standing floor lamp. I base this on the fact that I went to the rooms of two different friends who were also staying there and their rooms both had desk lamps and floor lamps, plus the photos of the available rooms show the lamps as being in the room. I mentioned this to the front desk but they didn't seem to be concerned. They just mumbled some sort of sorry about that.  And since my last stay, they have instituted a daily "resort fee" of $42.00  I was only told about the resort fee when I arrived, it was not mentioned anywhere that I could find on the booking site.  I asked the front desk clerk what amenities were included in the resort fee and she informed me that it was WiFi and the workout room.  I was not happy about it as I never have time to use the workout facilities at any hotel I stay at. I think it's just a ripoff of their customers. I will never stay at the Millennium in the future.

Price is high, but it's New York, so it is how it is 🙃
Overall it was a pleasant stay! Also very convenient to have a big parking lot opposite

title: Bien
text:
Hôtel parfaitement situé en plein centre de New-York à quelques mètres de Time Square.
Les chambres sont fonctionnelles, bien que le mobilier et les moquettes soient vieillissants, l établissements est très agréable.
Un grand merci à Daniel (de la réception) pour ses précieux conseils, sa gentillesse et son amabilité.

title: Overall excellent!!
text: The view was great and the staff was super helpful. The location was espectacular and very close to all the broadway shows and great restaurants. Overall excellent Really adds to a great trip to New York.

title: Séjour nov 2023
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé à qq pas de Time square et près de la station de métro très pratique pour sillonner la ville. L’hôtel dispose d’une entrée sur la 45eme et la 44eme
Se qui est très pratique. Vous avez un dîner pas très loin le red flamme très sympa pour le petit déjeuner. Je reviendrais sûrement.

title: Altamente recomendado el hotel
text: Excelente servicio de llegada nos atendió Catherine, súper rápido, nos gustaría que le habitación la organizaran un poco más, solo cambian toallas y hacen la cama, nos gustaría que tuviese nevera y snacks para la noche

title: A Robbery has been committed on the face of it
text:
Looks like I’ve been scammed. I booked four rooms in mid September, but had to cancel one room a week later after my daughter couldn’t make it due to work commitments. I expected a full refund on that hotel room but nothing was forthcoming., A policy of radio silence has also been adopted by the hotel.  Last Minute.Com  Millennium have sought to blame each other on the one email they did bother to send each.

A fairly poor experience whatever way you look at it. 

My advice - avoid

title: Great choice in the Big Apple near Time Square.
text:
We got in after a 5-hour delay on the flight from Nashville to LGR. The hotel is located close to Times Square. It is a great location if you are not driving your car (or rental). 
The staff at the front desk was helpful and the check-in was quick (I did not come on a rush hour). hotel was clean. I got a room on the 27th floor and for that reason, I did not hear any noise that bothered me. The room was small but clean. It needs small maintenance but nothing that bothers me. 
The checkout was quick and the luggage storage was good. When I needed a ride to the airport the luggage guys found it easily and got a big car for the four of us and all our luggage.
I will definitely stay there again if I go to New York again soon.

title: Poor
text: Rooms not  recently refurbished like we told, bath still see marks from previous stayers, toilet to low and smells doors broken off. Booked room as 2 double superior room and got two queen beds for three adults

title: Hôtel très bien placé et personnel sympa
text:
Personnel sympa et à l'écoute, a règlé un petit oubli très rapidement (frigo pas installé malgré la demande lors de la réservation)
Chambre grande, pour NY, literie neuve, sdb et meubles un peu vieillots mais on y va que pour se laver et dormir.
Hôtel super bien placé à 30 secondes de TS.
On a pris une chambre avec vue sur l'Empire 👍🏻

title: Nice hotel
text: We were in town for a show at Radio City. Great location. Lots to see in the area. The views from our room were really nice. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was fine. Clean. No problem. Plenty of places to grab a drink or some dinner close by.

title: Good hotel, GREAT people!
text: Comfortable beds, clean rooms!  And Daniel at the front desk made us feel so welcomed right away.  He is kind, personable & fun to talk about great theatre with!  And his coordination of glasses & beard jewelry rocks!

title: - wonderful experience
text:
We stayed at the Millennium Times Square for 5 days and we absolutely enjoyed every minute of it.
The Hotel employees are very friendly - Jenny, the lady that checked us in and out was very kind and generous. Definitely to recommend. You can tell that she loves her job!

title: Really great location, but don't expect perfection. It did the job well enough.
text: I don't know if you could find a better located hotel at that price point and quality if you tried, if you're keen to be close to Times Square and various subway options. We had a billing issue that if I wasn't keeping an eye on my credit card account I wouldn't have noticed (charged twice for the accom.), the Wi-Fi was down for a whole day and the rooms weren't 100% perfect, but I'd still recommend the place for fellow travelers.

title: Fantastic situation. Comfortable beds. Terrific staff.
text:
We arrived after a transatlantic flight on eve of a Bank Holiday to find our booking had been cancelled by Expedia!!! The staff were absolutely amazing, gave us a similar room and even matched the price we were expecting to pay. The rooms were looking a bit dated and in need of a coat of paint. But the beds were fabulously comfortable and the views and situation are incredible. 
Unfortunately the bar and restaurant are closed at the moment. But step outside and you have your choice of restaurants and bars. Luggage storage was available on our last day.
This was our second stay at The Millennium, Broadway and Times Square, and we wouldn't hesitate to book there again.

title: Would go again
text: The hotel is 30 seconds from Times Square. Rooms were what you needed, beds were clean and comfy. Fridge and hair dryer in room with safe as well which you don’t need to pay for. Better location couldn’t be asked for. If you ask the staff a question they will answer. No problems with the lifts at all. Previous reviews leave you a bit dubious but at the end of the day in New York a good nights sleep is all that is needed. Rooms could do with more plugs but it is an older hotel so if there are 4 people in a room you need to share plugs. If anyone says anything about it being in a dodgy area it’s not. People on the streets are friendly if you treat them with respect. McDonalds 15secs away and plenty of food places to pick from. Would go again

title: I'd go here again just for Daniel!
text:
I really dont understand any of the negative reviews on this hotel. I am noticing that the complaints are because people arent simply READING when they book. No where does it guarantee a fridge (but you can absolutely request one) and most places in the city are going to have resort fees so I suggest people pay attention and budget accordingly before complaining and giving a lesser review then deserved because they couldnt be bothered to research their accommodation sufficiently.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel last week as a getaway for our 15th anniversary. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Daniel (aka Danny the Beard) at the front desk. Check in was simple and fast and Daniel was incredibly helpful. Anything that we needed for the stay, Daniel was our man and delivered every single time. While yes, the rooms are a little outdated and their were some carpet stains, it was clean and comfortable and the location, views and staff can't be beat. We had a small issue with access to our room, but someone came and had the battery in our key card changed within 10 minutes. 

Just outside the doors (without ever having to cross the street) is Hudson Theater, a 24 hour McDonald's, 24 hour Walgreens, Popeyes, gap, old navy and RiseNY. There is 24 hour security/concierge staff stationed right by the elevator entrance as well at front desk staff available for your needs any time of the day or night. 

Malik I believe his name was (the 3-11 door man) was very helpful and came through with some really solid information for us. Our housekeeper (didn't catch her name, but she services the 39th floor) was also wonderful. 

If you're considering a stay at this gem in the heart of Times Square, STOP and book it! Don't forget to stop by the front desk daily for the fabulous breath of fresh air that is Daniel and see his daily beard changes! Oh, did I mention that Daniel is amazing?!?!

title: Great location and comfortable place to rest up while in NYC
text: I’m not sure why I’ve seen so many 1 star reviews, this hotel is nice. The location is excellent, our bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. Sure, it could probably use some updating soon but it was fine, I don’t get the negative reviews making such a big deal out of that. The only thing is I would not consider this a 4-star hotel. There really were not any amenities that set it apart from most 3-or even some 2-star hotels. But again, it was great for a weekend stay. I’m almost never in my room when in NYC so what I really need is a clean room, decent shower, and comfortable bed and that’s exactly what I got. A refrigerator would have been nice, but I’ve learned that in NYC refrigerators are not at many of the hotels so it’s not a dealbreaker.

title: Amazing Location!
text: I couldnt fault this hotel in the slightest. We booked a queen room from my friends 50th birthday not really worrying about being in the room its New York of course!! Anyway upon arrival we were swiftly upgraded to a king room at no extra cost with the MOST incredible views! Staff were all super friendly and helpful. We went during a crazy heatwave so were super greatful for the aircon! Rooms were big and beds were comfy. Best thing was the location! You roll out of bed into times square and being on 41st floor absolutely no noise!! Will definitely return!!

title: Experiencia 5 estrellas
text:
Excelente servicio al cliente por parte de todos los empleados. Cómodo y espacioso cuarto, muy limpio todo! Lo
Recomendarè y repetirè. Lo único que nos hizo falta fue una nevera pequeña en el cuarto.

title: Abraten von  Hotel direkt am Times Square
text: Leider ein in die Jahre gekommenes Hotel. Einige Möbel im Zimmer waren kaputt und alles sehr hellhörig. Da wir das Zimmer direkt zum Times Square hatten, mussten wir die Vorhänge mit Kleiderbügel zuklemmen, da man ansonsten kaum schlafen konnte. Bett war ok, Kissenauswahl schlecht, wäre schön wenn man 3-4 zur Auswahl hätte. Preis-/Leistung ist ok, man darf aber nicht zuviel erwarten. Tipp: Kein Zimmer zum Times Square

title: Good place to stay with great location
text: Wonderfull stay! Good experience and location, the room was spacious and clean the only this was that there where a lot of ants in the room. the location is excellent and the place is very safe and good service

title: Pros and Cons
text:
POSITIVES: location, comfort of bed and varied pillows to suit both me and my partner, friendly and helpful room service staff, decent shower pressure, blinds and curtains were great. 
NEGATIVES: extremely outdated room furniture and fittings, poorly designed room with furniture taking up too much space and had to be rearranged to maximize space, unhelpful Concierge who could not answer our questions, poor drainage in the bathroom, no refrigerator, no space to air dry underwear (we were there for 12 nights), insufficient power outlets, no USB outlets at all, TV remote was not working and had to be attended to, inefficient staff on the front desk causing queues for check in/check out, they were also quite rude when we questioned how long the security deposit would take to be refunded.

title: Beautiful spacious rooms and comfortable beds. Steps from Times Square.
text:
Excellent location, steps to Time Square, tons of shops, eateries including McDonald's on corner of 45th & Broadway.
Rooms are very spacious, bed very comfortable, refrigerator available on request, nice views especially from 2611.
Staff very accommodating and helpful.
ONLY negative is the unfortunate resort fees, only thing you get are free wifi, calls & gym, but computer on 2nd floor you have to pay for internet/computer use plus 50cents per copy.  And 1 of their security personnel was extremely rude, when I was attempting to have a private conversation with the concierge (who was very nice, as rest of hotel personnel).

title: Basic hotel, great customer service
text: The hotel itself is pretty basic.  Our room did not have a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, nor a safe that worked which was a bummer.  But the room was very clean and housekeeping was very efficient.  I give props to all the people working in the hotel from the front desk, doormen, concierge, etc. Every single one of them was super friendly, great customer service, and made our stay really pleasant.  When they found out one member of our party was having a bday celebration, they even gave us a nice I heart NYC gift which was a sweet touch.  Also, location is superb!

title: Lua de mel perfeita em NY
text: Hotel super bem localizado, com profissionais capacitados e cordiais, seja dos ajudantes de mala, recepção, segurança ou limpeza, sempre dispostos a ajudar. Quarto muito confortável, chuveiro maravilhoso. Vista fantástica. Amamos

title: Jenny is the best, Thank you
text:
Jenny is the best, she was very kind and always pending if everything's fine.

This hotel is just a few steps from times Square, where al the action happens.

Rooms are nice, with all necessary.

Love to came back, Thank you!

title: Run down and poor experience
text:
I've always held a fondness for Times Square, but unfortunately, my recent stay at Millennium Times Square left me deeply disappointed. Over the course of a mere three-night stay, we were subjected to two fire alarm incidents. The first proved to be a false alarm, yet the disruption to our peace was significant. Just when we thought we could put that incident behind us, the alarm went off again due to an overheated HVAC unit. Upon inquiry, we learned that this was a result of the hotel's long-standing disrepair. Safety should always be paramount, but it's evident that this establishment hasn't been keeping up with essential maintenance.

Beyond the alarming safety concerns, the overall experience was underwhelming. Our room felt like a snapshot from decades ago – and not in a charming, vintage way. The wear and tear was unmistakable, with outdated furnishings and an air of neglect.

The breakfast, which many hotels consider a chance to shine and satisfy their guests, was a lackluster affair. The selection was limited, and the quality of the food was subpar at best.

Times Square deserves accommodations that live up to its vibrant reputation. Regrettably, Millennium Times Square falls far short of the mark. Would strongly recommend looking elsewhere for a more reliable, comfortable, and updated experience.

title: Like to Keep peoples deposit !11
text:
In your hotel policy it states that the deposit is released at time of check out and will be returned within 3-5 business days.
Nicholas King stayed in this hotel from July 27th to July 30th.
After numerous phone calls/emails the deposit has still not been returned, this seems to be a trend with this hotel.
Please arrange to have MY money returned NOW or I will take this matter further and keep up my reviews on Tripadvisor 1

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text: Very well placed Hotel with Time Square at the end of the block. We stayed on the 48th floor and they arranged for our travelling partners to be in the room next door. Our room was very clean although some furniture was a little knocked around it was a comfortable large room with good views of the city. I scored 4 out of 5 just because there is no restaurant option in the Hotel. All staff were helpful and polite. Would use this Hotel again on any future visits.

title: Great Location, Disgusting, Bug Ridden Rooms
text:
The only good thing about this place is the location. Right off of Times Square by the GMA building and a 5 minute walk to the subway? Couldn’t ask for anything better. Lots of restaurants nearby as well.

However, the rooms are nasty. We found multiple bugs in our room, see attached. Luckily, we were able to get a room change but the staff wasn’t apologetic about the situation at all. We were told “oh I get these bugs in my apartment all the time.” Like okay? I’m here visiting and your job is to have clean & hospitable rooms. The second room we got had no bugs but it was dirtier than the first. At that point, we gave up because we knew the staff wouldn’t help us anymore since they barely helped the first time.

title: Memorable service
text: I was very skeptical coming to this hotel as it has been years since the last time here.  The room was great,  spacious.  What made this trip memorable was Damiel's service.  Amazing personality, very helpful as I had a light issue in my room that was fixed within minutes.  And he has the most amazing beard style, different everyday.  Was fantastic.

title: Amazing !!!
text:
Located in the heart of the city. Taxi from JFK will cost approximately $70 upwards, a ten minute walk from Penn Station. 
We received a very warm welcome from the reception staff Erin and Daniel. Daniel was very pleasant, helpful and informative (loving the beard).
Our room was spacious and clean with facilities ie: coffee making machine, iron, hair dryer etc. We were high up and the views were fantastic. 
There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby, we found a couple of gems hidden away.
The ferry to Staton Island is free and worth doing to see the iconic statue of liberty and the New York skyline. Grand Central  station is also worth a visit.
The hotel is dated and needs some TLC but overall l couldn't fault it given it's location and wonderful staff.
We will definitely stay again...thank you.

title: ZONA TROPPO AFFOLLATA E POCA ATTENZIONE
text:
Letti abbastanza comodi.
Ci hanno fatto un upgrade per stanza più grande per 17 dollari a notte e per fortuna che abbiamo accettato perchè come noto le stanze a New York spesso sono molto piccole e nonostante questo si stava abbastanza stretti in 4.
Non c'è mini bar

Abbiamo soggiornato per 6 notti in 4 persone abbiamo dovuto chiedere gli asciugamani per 3 giorni perchè ne mettevano sempre di meno. 
Prestare attenzione al letto accertarsi che il piumino sia coperto da entrambre le parti con il lenzuolo, abbiamo riscontrato poca attenzione da parte di chi puliva la stanza su questa cosa.

Se si ama la confusione la posizione è ottima altrimenti meglio scegliere un'altra zona perchè a parte il continuo traffico, c'è sempre tantissima gente, quasi non si riesce a camminare sui marciapiedi. 
Non abbiamo fatto colazione in albergo perchè non compresa e non ce l'hanno nemmeno proposta.
Il personale alla reception, bagagli e fuori dall'albergo molto gentile.

Beds quite comfortable.
They gave us an upgrade to a larger room for 17 dollars a night and luckily we accepted because as we know the rooms in New York are often very small and despite this it was quite cramped in 4 of us.
No mini bar.

We stayed for 6 nights with 4 people and we had to ask for towels for 3 days because they kept providing less and less.
Pay attention to the bed, make sure that the duvet is covered on both sides with the sheet, we found little attention from those who cleaned the room on this matter.

If you love confusion, the location is excellent, otherwise it's better to choose another area because apart from the constant traffic, there are always so many people, you can almost barely walk on the sidewalks.
We didn't have breakfast in the hotel because it wasn't included and they didn't even offer it to us.
The staff at reception, luggage and outside the hotel were very kind

title: Not what you think
text: This hotel was very basic and not for what they charge you for no refrigerator or microwave very old and not maintained very well more like a motel 6 in a good location the location of time square was the only plus but old fixtures rusted the bathroom toilet wouldn’t even flush correctly had to keep the top off to flush I will never book this room ever again

title: Very happy
text:
After reading lots of negative reviews & comments on social media I was very surprised at how nice the hotel was 
staff were polite & happy to help 
The room on the 31st floor was very nice & clean 😊
just remember if you’re booking in the Time Square area it isn’t quiet

title: Vastly overpriced!
text: The room we paid for was advertised as a deluxe room but it was far from that! No coffee maker, no mini fridge, no closet doors, everything was very dated. No amenities: the restaurant/lounge has been closed for at least 3 years with no plans to reopen (according to the concierge). To get a coffee you have to go to the nearest Starbucks. Definitely not worth the money!

title: Luna di miele
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel per la nostra luna di miele …
L’accoglienza è stata magnifica, Daniel e il suo staff ci hanno accolti con sorrisi e offrendoci regali e dei buonissimi cioccolatini da gustare in camera!

Daniel ha accolto la nostra richiesta del piano alto dandoci il penultimo .
Consiglio l’hotel per l’ottima posizione.

title: We loved our stay :)
text:
We had a lovely experience with this hotel. The location is amazing and its a beautiful building. It is an old building so there were a few hiccups with plumbing, which were dealt with promptly and professionally.

We ended up getting married while we were there and we are soooo happy we choose this hotel. The staff are so lovely, kind and helpful- they made amazing efforts of balloons and chocolates in our room after we were married and staff couldn't be more lovely, congratulating us and asking to hear the stories and see photos , which was amazing as we didn't have family with us.

We have no words for how amazing the manager George is and how great he made our stay. Erica and Jenny were so kind and thoughtful and everyone staff member we saw always said hello. The staff really make this place and we definitely have lovely memories of our wedding.

We wouldn't hesitate to come back here the next time we are in New York - thank you all for making it such a memorable stay😊

title: Such a beautiful building  with huge rooms
text: Wow this building has so much character we will definitely be staying here again, it’s the heart of this magnificent city, the staff were super helpful and the cleaners couldn’t do enough! Thank you for making our stay so magical !! Already looking at when we can come back hopefully for a lot longer than 4 days

title: Overpriced, basic and wouldn’t recommend
text:
Stayed last week with my partner for his 30th birthday.

Upon arrival at around 1pm we were told our room was not ready but we could upgrade to a lm amazing city view room for 60 dollars extra per night or wait until around 4pm for our room. We took the upgrade as 1. We were shattered after travelling and 2. Thought it would be an extra treat for the 30th birthday we were celebrating.

The room was dirty - hairs on the bed, the bath was filthy, sides were sticky, stains on the desk and headboard. 

Our shower didn’t work which is just what you want after travelling, I called the concierge and reception on REPEAT for around 15 mins and no one was answering - bare in mind you have to pay a daily facility fee for this. I then had to go downstairs myself and ask reception for help. An operative turned up and whilst he was nice and polite you could tell he was obviously very burnt out and tired. He showed us a “trick” to get the shower fixed… a trick? For an upgraded room it’s not good enough. He couldn’t fix the lights in our room as he didn’t have the lamps or facilities so we had 1 table light in our our entire room. All but one socket and usb port worked as well but he also couldn’t repair that. Again, for an upgrade is this good enough? No.

The bath after I cleaned it myself!! Drained so so so slowly, I had a bet with my partner to see if would have drained by the time we returned in the evening. So if my partner had a shower I then had to stand in his shower water as I used it - again, not good enough for an upgraded room. 

The bath tap was also so wobbly and hanging off of the wall - I asked the operative about this and again he said he can’t fix and it should be fine. 

Wardrobes didn’t close properly as the doors were broken and the iron didn’t work! Again, what did we pay the facility fee for?

No fridge in the room which I thought was bizarre. When checking out, I asked the reception if I could have an invoice for our taxes and “upgrade” she said it gets emailed to me. Well 1 week later and still no invoice! I’d like to challenge our upgrade fee and facility fee as no one wanted to answer the phone to be (which was also FILTH) and the wifi is rubbish. Better off just using your 5G.

Also, so many other guests walking the floors and outside the lifts in their underwear, staff just seemed to ignore which was so weird. 

Air con in the room was poor, smelt bad and barely worked. Just what you want in 37 degree weather. 

For a city view upgrade (which by the way was just a view of an office block opposite) if I had chance of a preview I 100% wouldn’t of taken it nor would I recommend to anyone. 

I’ve never left a bad review before but this stay was just all round disappointing, especially for a 30th birthday and really basic without the basic price tag! 

The only good thing I have to say is that the location is good and the bed was surprisingly comfortable (minus the hairs that weren’t ours)

title: Best Experience ever!
text: Me and my family checked in this hotel for a few days for a quick getaway, it was such an amazing time we enjoyed every moment we had there. Our room was very clean. Irma Bazil was such an amazing caring person, she cleaned our room while we were there, anything help we needed she was there to help us. I would truly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Y’all need to clean your rooms
text:
I recently had a disappointing stay at this hotel. Upon checking in, I was dismayed to find my room in a dirty state, with trash scattered about. I promptly brought this to the attention of the manager, who was courteous and contacted housekeeping. However, despite being told to return in an hour, I returned an hour and thirty minutes later to discover that the room was still not cleaned. To make matters worse, there was a heated argument between the housecleaning manager and the front desk manager, with the former claiming the room was cleaned when it clearly wasn't.

In the end, the front desk manager provided us with another room. While this room was acceptable, it was clear that the hotel was in dire need of a renovation. Given the disappointing experience and the hotel's condition, I cannot recommend it, especially considering the price. It's best to look elsewhere for accommodations.

title: Besides been a sub standard, your credit card is not safe (attempted fraud) and the telephone staff is diabolical.
text:
There are no words to describe my experience . I did not book this hotel myself, I was there on business. Arrived at 8pm from London, very Tired. The lobby was acceptable, although the warning signs were there, I ignored them and proceeded. 

The company had already paid the bill and the hotel took my card for extras, they said. I Got up to the room with the company host representative, which was the UN. Soon as we worked in, she looked at me and said, you are not staying here. The carpet was filthy, The bed was dirty and the bed frame was chipping away and scratched. 
Oh The bathroom was indescribable. We Went back to the lobby and The rep told them I was not staying and to refund money. I walked across the road to the Hyatt for the night. Ended up at the Hard Rock for the rest of my stay,  which was beautiful. 

Next day I noticed they had taken the 5 days stay from my card at the Millennium, although they had already been paid by the UN. I hoped they would refund soonest . On the 4 to day the UN rep called in to the Millenium to enquire, they apologised again and refunded. Charging for the one night on the UN card. Upon arrival to London, my accountant noticed they had retaken the whole 5 night stay again. I called them hoping to resolve, I got a nasty manager on the phone called Mr George, who seemed to think he was entitled to my money and put the phone down on me. The rep in New York once again went into the hotel and resolved. Can you imagine if I did have anyone in New York to deal with them, Id be out of my money and dealing with credit card fraud. Besides been a sub standard, your credit card is not safe and the staff is diabolical. That particular one needs to be dismissed from his job. 

Be very very wary or avoid .

title: Daniel is GREAT
text:
We checked into The Millennium Hotel late last night and Daniel was our very friendly professional front desk person. Wow what a great guy and after a long drive it was so nice to see him and his super festive beard!! So far so great at The Millennium!!!! Cheers Daniel♥️ 
Also loved the view of Times Square from our window.  This location is perfect, right in the thick of Times Square!!!!

title: great
text: i had an awesome time very nice hotel i truly enjoyed it clean rooms great lobby nice gym everyone was nice big bathroom comfortable bed express checkout great view next to times square looking at time square

title: Average hotel in a great location
text:
Average hotel. Nothing more too special about the rooms. The carpet is a older and dusty and the rooms haven’t been renovated. 

It’s in a prime location and closed to everything and the views were great. If you want a little nicer room probably stick to a Normal chain .

title: Send the extra $100
text: If you're coming with kids, sure stay here but if you're coming to NYC for a good time with partner, friends.. do yourself a favor. Spend another $100-150 and find another hotel.  This place needs a major facelift and renovation. Lobby is dark. Furniture in the room is broken. Nothing fun or romantic about this hotel. No restaurant on property. It's been shut down since the pandemic. The concierge looked bored on the desk with out brochures about tours & places to visit. I will say the front desk staff was friendly.

title: Bad management
text: We stayed at the hotel 2 nights. Before we arrived we have ordered a package from Amazon and delivery notice came late to us. I have called reception and asked for my package, they said the post room is open certain hours and they can not help us. I have explained that we were going to leave eary next morning is there any thing that they can do, the night managere Ellie hang up the phone on my face, I was shocked. I went downstairs immediately but she didn’t come to see us. Someone else came and she offered to send the parcel to our next destination. I did not raise my voice or insolted her in any way but the way a managere treated a client was not acceptable. She should not be a manager this is for sure.

title: Great location but can get hot with the sun.
text: The location of this hotel is excellent. Especially if you are going to Broadway. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My Wife and I went and got a basic room but then did the update to a suite The suite had a great view and also 2  full bathrooms with a separate living room. The only downside is the room would get very hot because of the sun shining in and the AC unit could barely keep up. If it was not for the heat this would have been a 5-star visit. If you are a person who is always cold this would be a plus for you.

title: good location
text: The location of the hotel is in the middle of Times Square and has access from two streets, 44 and 45, The room is very old and tired, the carpet is very dirty, also the hotel charged me an additional amount after checkout I contacted them to understand why, and they didn't reply.

title: Buen servicio
text: Ya me he quedado en este hotel varias veces con un grupo y siempre el movimiento de maletas, bolsas etc, se pone complicado. Orlando V en todo momento que necesitamos de su ayuda estaba ahí a la disposición e hizo todo mas cómodo. Excelente empleado.

title: Positiva solo la location
text:
L’albergo appare sin dall’ingresso molto cupo, il che è brutto, ma probabilmente ha di positivo che non evidenza il livello di pulizia, che lascia a desiderare.
Camere vecchie , moquette rovinata, bagni molto vecchi.
Camere non rifatte fino a sera.
Unico aspetto positivo la posizione, ma sceglierei altro.

title: Excelente atención
text: Excelente atención de Catherine al momento del checkin, muy amable y educada. Mi esposa estaba de cumpleaños y le dio un obsequio de parte del hotel, muy bonito detalle. Instalaciones limpias, Habitacion amplia.

title: Excelente atención .
text: Todo excelente , cabe remarcar la suprema atención de Daniel Roberts en la recepción del hotel , cama y almohadas súper confortables , limpio y muy bien ubicado, vista espectacular , elevadores súper eficientes , me regalaron un estuche de chocolates por mi cumpleaños , maravillosa atención de DANIEL ROBERTS , volvería a hospedarme siempre !

title: A Must stay property
text:
We have stayed at the Millennium Broadway nextdoor and loved the property. Now that we've stayed at the Millennium Premier we will stay there every time we come to the city. The room was spacious, extremely clean and comfortable. The updated furnishing and bathroom were a nice touch...Monique at the Desk was such a joy and went above and beyond to make our stay spectacular.. She is amazing, super friendly and just lovely all around..She gets a double thumbs up...👍👍We look forward to seeing her on our next visit.

John and Luke

title: Awful
text: Well I'm here now, I was sent an upgrade request,  I took it. Got here it wasn't available...then why send it to me???  but the woman Margaret was going to give us a smaller upgrade for no cost. Wonderful woman!! Got there smelled like the sewer and we were chokingthe whole time we were waiting for someone to come. Came down since no one showed and we couldn't breathe.  got another room. Smelled better but view sucks even though I chose a city view and lo n behold no one remembers the slight upgrade.  I will never stay here again. It's too bad no one is out for the one paying!!!! Bet employees don't stay here either!! Trust me chose another hotel in times square...any hotel at all.

title: Excellent Hotel in NYC
text: Nice hotel with great location. The woman that did the check in was very professional and friendly. The room was big and clean, it was in Floor 20, and have excellent view. The Breakfast snacks and the coffee were very good. Orlando Velasco did a great job finding ice for our medication and take care of our needs. Also, the employee that take care of our luggage at check out was very friendly and called a Taxi for us to go to the airport. We really enjoyed our stay in The Millenium Premier.

title: Great hotel choice if you want to be in the heart of Times Square
text: The room was very spacious with a great view, and the location couldn't be more centrally located for exploring the Times Square area. We had an issue with the bill after our stay, and the staff were very responsive and helpful in getting it sorted out very quickly. Overall, a good value!

title: Exceptional !
text:
The staff was exceptional and go above and beyond to make your stay memorable. George, one of the hotel managers was so accommodating. My sister was in a wheelchair and the room was spacious and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Millennium on Broadway to any who is looking to have a great experience ! 

Cynthia

title: Daniel is amazing!
text:
Daniel made our experience a 10/10! He has amazing customer service skills and loves to engage in great conversation. My family and I request restaurant suggestions for dinner and he gave us a few good and close options, then a favorite spot with the locals. It was the food highlight of our trip. 
Daniel is a bright shining light of positivity and the millennium is lucky to have him working there!

title: Amazing
text: Great stay at the Millennium hotel. Right on Times Square which was amazing. The staff were so friendly and accommodating and the room was just what we needed for our stay. We would definitely come back to this hotel and recommend to people!

title: Great girls trip!
text: Orlando the front door man and the luggage guys were so helpful! Hotel was clean and was so close to everything. Starbucks right next door. There was not a bar or restaurant in the hotel. Time square was right around the corner!

title: Millennium Broadway Hotel
text: This hotel is great - located a block from Times Square, it is walking distance to the theatres and many great restaurants. Service was great , room was good , and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay . Great value for the money .

title: Sometimes reviews are misleading
text: Very nice hotel. Reviews make you worried. I tried finding a different location based off of reviews alone. Good thing I kept my reservations. Staff was VERY nice. Opened doors, said hi when they saw you. And the rooms were clean. Not what I was expecting.

title: Nice hotel.
text: Thank you for very warm welcome and friendly and helpful staffs! Nice and clean room. The area of the hotel is the best, we can walk around and find everything that we want or any kind of restaurant.

title: Excelente lugar
text:
Muy buen lugar excelente vista me encanto  el lugar tienen muy buen atención limpieza de cuarto muy buena 
Muy amable  el personal nos trataron muy bien la atención. El cuarto fue buena también 🙏♥️lo q más me gusto fue la vista y esta cerca de varios lugres

title: Great location and great service
text: The location was great. It was less than a 10 minute walk to all of the shows we saw. The room was clean, and the service was extremely helpful and friendly. There’s no room service, but with so many good food options around us, we weren’t looking for room service anyway. The room was one of the most affordable options in the area, and if you’re looking for convenient and affordable, this is a great option.

title: Excellent
text: Everything was fine, perfect service. The people in the entrance were nice to all of us, thanks to other app the price was really cheap and the rooms have everything you need. No problems with the bathrooms

title: Accommodations & Customer Service
text: I stayed at Millennium Premier last week, 8-August to 12-August 2023, and my husband and I both enjoyed our stay. We had to change room after staying overnight because the air conditioning was not working in the room. This issue was resolved swiftly by Monique. She was so accommodating and understanding. Thanks to Monique, our stay was wonderful.

title: Great location  and staff!
text: The front desk staff  esp Monquie were wonderful! Location is great ..right in the middle  of all the action! So close to everything you could need. The rooms  are a good size..bigger  than expected.  We will definitely  be back!

title: Amazing
text: The hotel is fantastic and the customer service is great! Daniel is the best, he helped us out every time we were here and it was wonderful! Location and rooms are also awesome! We stay here everytime and hope to do many times more!

title: Central location! Times Square!
text: Fantastic service from beginning to end, the housekeeper for my section of rooms was incredibly kind & skilled. Great views of Times Square & very central location (near the subway, lots of food). Thanks so much!

title: Great
text: Good stay. Wish there was a small space to sit and eat. Could use some breakfast. Great area for anyone trying to explore New York and all it has to offer. Will certainly be considering this location for my next stay.

title: Incredible rooms with views towards the Times Square with some of the most welcoming front desk staff
text: Visited NYC for about a week and stayed at the Millennium. Wonderful hotel with incredible rooms and views towards the Times Square. Daniel at the front desk was incredible with his amazing style and welcoming personality. Would definitely come back here again everytime I visit NYC. 10/10 would recommend.

title: I will give this hotel a 10 ⭐️ plus if I can
text: Great customer service, Hotel very clean , Everyone is very welcoming make you feel like your at home .. So nice and Relaxing . Love the housekeepers also , I will stay there when I come back to New York !!!!

title: BEWARE HOTEL MAKES UNAUTHORIZED CHARGES TO YOUR CREDIT CARD!
text:
The Millennium Hotel Tines Square tacked on additional charges to my credit card which was unauthorized. When I booked the hotel online directly through millennium, my receipt stated "INCLUDES ALL TAXES AND FEES".
 Upon checking into the hotel they tried to tack on an additional 'Resort Fee'. I showed them my email receipt which stated: "Includes all taxes and fees".  After showing her that email, the front desk manager assured me it wouldn't be charged, But upon returning home, and checking my credit card statement, not only did the Millennium Hotel charge the resort fee they promised wouldn't be charged, but they also without authorization, charged a 'charitable donation to my credit card'. 

Multiple attempts to reach Vikram Sardana, Hotel Manager by telephone & voicemail messages have gone unanswered. I will now contact the New York State's Attorney's office, BBB and NY Department of Consumer Affairs. 

This was once my family's favorite Hotel in New York for more than 20 years and used to have many fond memories. It's unfortunate that the hotel has taken such a turn for the worse. Very disappointing.

title: Awesome stay!
text: Had a wonderful time. We were greeted by the wonderful lady at the front desk. Her name is Monique. She made sure to go above and beyond and was very personable. Rooms were really clean and comfortable.

title: Great Service
text: It was an excellent stay. Reception was fantastic and so accommodating and welcoming, especially Monique. The hotel was easy to find and it was clean. If we are ever back in New York we would stay again.

title: Very great hotel in the heart of NYC
text: The rooms and hotels were Very clean. The Very friendly staff greeted us when coming in and leaving.  The rooms are very nice.  The lobby was clean and secure.  The air smells nice. Great location! Will be staying again!

title: New York, New York. A primeira vez é inesquecível.
text: A localização do Hotel é perfeita! Pertinho da Time Square, quase na esquina. Perto do Hard Rock Café. Perto da escadaria vermelha, onde embaixo compra-se as entradas da Broadway. Perto do Juniors Café. Chegamos no voo da manhã, então quando chegamos lá as 7:00 h nosso checkin seria somente à tarde, mas mesmo assim receberam nossa bagagem e guardaram até à tarde. Isso permitiu fazermos as programações da banha sem carregar malas. Acho q não tem café da manhã. O quarto é de bom tamanho, mas com carpete. Tem ferro elétrico. Ficamos em andar bem alto. Magnífica visão. Não tem frigobar.

title: Great
text: Orlando was a sweetheart. Great customer service. The hotel is nice as well. Easy access and minimal disturbances. Will definitely come back. Concierge team was nice as well. Location great walking distance to everything.

title: un peu vieillot
text:
ma fois, un bel hôtel.  si comme moi vous avez une chambre haute (46e étage) vous aurez une superbe vue.
dommage pour les prestations,  pas de petit déjeuner,  pas de frigo, pas de micro ondes, pas de lave et seche linge, pas de piscine,  pas de parking (parking en face à 50e les 24 heures)
pour des hôtels bien moins chers, toutes les prestations était la.

title: Great location and service (and view)
text: Great service! Staff was attentive and polite. Specially Simon at the FD. The location is just perfect if you want to be at the heart of time square.  The rooms are at 7 or 8. But location and service compensate this.

title: Dated Rooms, Great Location
text:
The hotel location is amazing. I was here at this hotel 10 years ago and coming back was something I was looking forward to. The desk staff was extremely nice. 

The room has seen better days. The furniture was chipped and scratched. There was a huge crack in the sink. The room just felt extremely dated. Otherwise, I found it comfortable and had lots of space for my needs. I couldn’t find a good temperature on the thermostat. It was either full blast cold or I had to turn it off. So if you like it cold, the ac certainly works. 

I made use of the desk and wifi to work. The wifi was fast enough for zoom calls.

title: Very comfortable  and pleasant
text:
I have to say our stay was great thanks to our maid Jackyln she was awesome at making sure we were comfortable and our room stayed clean. The beds were hard and very uncomfortable  but after we told her our issue, she personally went and changed our mattresses out to more comfortable mattresses which made all the difference in our sleep.
 Never asking for any tips just being the sweetest and kindest person she is. But We suprised her with a tipped at the end of our stay and she was very humble and grateful for it. Last but not least we met an awesome lady named trinita who was over guest serves I believe. She was extreamly pleasant and very helpful to us  our whole 5 day stay. Offering her time and help whenever we needed it and gave us late check out which also helped since we had such a late flight. She was always friendly and smiling every time we talked to her. People like these two staff made our trip worth staying at the millennium.

title: Clean, great location, needs better maintenance
text:
First,  the rooms were very clean and the beds and pillows very comfortable.  The hotel staff were all wonderful, professional people.  The location is great as it is near Bryant Park and Times Square.  The views from the hotels rooms were very nice.  If cleanliness and location are your top priority, this is a fine hotel.

The room maintenance is lacking and most of the issues could be easily fixed with proper attention.  Lamp shades were torn.  Some rooms had refrigerators, others did not. One room had two safes instead of a refrigerator.  One room had no lamps near the bed, another had two sets of lamps but no light bulbs in one set.  One room had a broken drawer handle.  The bathroom has no fan, so you do need to open the bathroom door to get the steam out.  

The lobby is clean but basic and has few areas to sit and wait for guests.

title: Perfect Location for time square/broadway shows
text: It’s all about the convenient location!  Two blocks from two different subway stations and right in Time Square/Theatre district.   This was our third stay.  We have also stayed in several other chain hotels within 5 blocks of this one but very glad we came back to Millimium.  We had room 5101 (deluxe) with an amazing  view of the city skyline and time square. The room was a generous size with huge windows. The bathroom is a bit dated but OK and the rest of the room was fine (had a mini fridge).  We could hear some faint noise from time square at night but that typically ended before midnight and was very quiet in the morning.  I don’t recall that from previous stays so it may depend on room location. The hotel doesn’t have a restaurant anymore but there is a deli across the street (cooks) that has breakfast so that was easy and inexpensive. The hotel does have a small gift/sundry shop with snacks/drinks. A nice feature is that the hotel has doors on 44th and 45th so it saves time depending which direction you need to go.  We love seeing shows so that is a huge draw for staying here and its a pleasant walk to Central Park along 6th/Avenue of the Americas or quick walk to subways to go to all the other NYC tourist areas. The room rate for this hotel is a good value. Daniel Roberts at the front desk was a wonderful welcoming presence each day and super helpful with information about shows and happenings.  We will be back.

title: Great staff!!!
text: Trinita and Tyree were great! They gave wonderful recommendations on what we could do in the city and directions on how to get around. They were the best thing about the hotel. They remembered each show we went to, and asked us how we liked each one the next day. The doorman,Mark, was awesome as well, with great recommendations for restaurants in the areas we were visiting.

title: Don't waist Your money, avoid!
text:
This letter was sent to management but no response. I would strongly advise everyone to check all reviews before booking. For the attention of management: London and Denver office will be informed about negligence of guests!                                  Hello,

We recently stayed at your hotel from July 2 - 5, 2023, booked through Expedia, confirmation number 296876561. The room did not meet basic standards of cleanliness, upkeep, or comfort.

The air vents slats were coated in fibrous, grimy dust. The cabinet doors were coming off their hinges. But worst was the water bloated ceiling in the bathroom (video attached). It was leaking onto the toilet so whoever used it practically needed an umbrella. 

I spoke to the receptionist in person on July 3rd, and she said a technician would be up to take a look, but no one showed up while we were there. If someone inspected the room, we weren't informed of their findings. Neither were we offered another room, one where we could use the toilet without getting wet.

I was travelling with family members from Europe, and had looked forward to showing them how wonderful New York City is. Your hotel room seriously compromised that. Our accommodations were an embarrassment.

The condition of the room is what I would expect from $75 at a seedy motel, not the $1,290 Canadian we paid you. Please look into this matter and respond with how we can be compensated for this terrible experience at your hotel.

title: Outstanding Professional
text: Monique is simply the best! She’s professional. Friendly, and very accommodating to guest. She’s the best part of the Millennium. As a result of her outstanding customer service, I told my entire staff about the Millennium Hotel. It’s has become our hotel of choice.

title: Love this hotel
text: The hotel is in the perfect spot, right in the heart of NYC. The room was always clean and nice hot water & water pressure. View of the Ball Drop room is incredible!!! The staff is all so kind & helpful. Daniel at the front desk is the best, he is wonderful♥️ I would recommend this place for a trip to NYC to everyone. You will not regret it.

title: Pleasant stay but breakfast disappointing.
