Overall a pleasant stay but nowhere for us to store out bikes.  Consequently our son had to store them in his room overnight.

title: The hotel is not the best.  The only good thing is that it is in the center and Daniel is from reception
text: The special guy at the reception, Daniel, helped us a lot and was kind and dedicated, and in my opinion he should be promoted because he is perfect, we love and recommend coming only because of him.

title: Excellent. Comfortable room. Very clean.
text: From the time we arrived at the Millennium Hotel on Broadway we were greeted by the staff. Jenny, who checked us in, was amazing. She was very professional and went above and beyond to make our trip fantastic. I would highly recommend the Millennium and look for Jenny when you check in.

title: Great experience for NYC first visit.
text:
Orlando V was amazing. He helped us get our luggage up to our room and made sure we were set with all the essentials.  The concierge staff were very helpful in directing us on transportation around the city. The cleaning staff was extremely helpful and told us that we could ask for a coffee maker for our room.
The hotel is close to the subway making  virtually every in close proximity.

title: Real bad value for money. Totally outdated hotel. Bad facility’s
text: Really outdated hotel. The have no restaurant. Most of the  staff is not friendly . The restrooms in the lobby are a total mess and stink like a pigsty. They charge you with a facility fee for 40$ a room per night, because you use their WiFi and sport facility. That gym is a total laugh almost no gym machine

The staff is rated 5+ but the hotel is a 2. A serious and major renovation of the entire hotel needs to be done immediately. The owners ate being very neglectful of not updating peeled wallpaper, chipped furniture, painting of walls, old stained carpet, and torn curtains and sheers. The staff did a great job in dealing with complaints  from  the majority of the guests while I was waiting to check in. The owners are taking money based on the location of the hotel, not the accommodations or maintenance. This hotel should not carry the Millennium brand name
 Really, it's a shame!

title: Great first time visit to NYC!

text: This hotel is a hygiene risk! This is the first time I couldn’t take a shower in a hotel — it was extremely dirty and clogged. There is mold in the ceiling and in the bathroom. There is torn carpet and flat pillows. They also don’t have basic amenities! They don’t have a coffee maker. The place needed serious remodeling, and the business owner pics is a scam. title: Centrale ma molto costoso
text: È un hotel elegante situato in un grattacielo a due passi da Times Square. Camera grande rispetto a tanti altri hotel che ho valutato prima di scegliere questo. Bagno ok tranne per la vasca che aveva il rubinetto un po’ difettoso. L’albergo andrebbe un po’ rinnovato soprattutto per i bagni che sono appunto davvero molto datati. Personale gentile e disponibile, vista ottima, hanno anche esaudito la nostra richiesta di stare a un piano alto… bisogna però considerare che i prezzi sono altissimi essendo un hotel centralissimo. C’è però il vantaggio di poter scendere anche la sera e avere tutto a disposizione, con Times Square sempre piena di gente e anche sorvegliata dagli agenti. La metro è a due passi. Insomma, in base alle proprie esigenze, può essere un ottimo hotel. Peraltro ha anche un teatro al suo interno.

title: Great experience and customer service, highly recommend!
text:
We stayed at the Millennium Broadway Times Square on our recent vacation to NYC and loved it. While researching hotel options, the Millennium seemed to have larger rooms than others we were looking at for NYC, and with a family of 4, that was important to us.  We stayed in the "Deluxe City View 2 Doubles" room.

This property is close to all the action. You walk out the doors and there are several Broadway theaters right there.   Go around the corner and there is Times Square and easy subway access! The staff were friendly and helpful. The doorman gave us useful advice for navigating NYC, and he even helped us secure transportation when our previously hired car company fell through.

Housekeeping was quick to deliver additional towels when we needed them, and the maintenance team was fast to respond when we needed help fixing a toilet issue. We did have a leak in our bathroom ceiling the day before we ended our trip, and the staff quickly assessed the situation and moved us to a different room that had an even nicer view! They moved our luggage for us, so it didn’t “dampen” our vacation.

If you are looking for a place to stay in NYC, we recommend you book here!

title: Great view, great times!
text: We had an excellent stay at Millenium! The room we got had an excellent view and everything was in order. Jenny at the check in counter made our stay extra memorable, she is amazing! Thank you for making my girlfriends birthday so special. 😁

title: WARNING...Do NOT Stay Here!!
text:
I don't think there is enough room here to describe the absolute disgust and utter filth of this hotel. The attached pictures will speak for themselves, but I would like to relay my story so that I may, hopefully, save the hard-earned dollars of other travelers from this dump of a hotel. 

We arrived with excitement on a Thursday only to be met with extreme disappointment by our accommodations. There was lint, dust and stains on the walls that appeared to have been there for a very long time. In the bathroom, from ceiling to floor there was some form of mold, grime, dirt, stains, crud, you name it, it was there. We found a dirty towel hanging in the closet, along with someone's chewing tobacco; trash and a dirty sock behind the desk (which we wouldn't normally inspect, but somehow felt compelled to do so after seeing the rest of the room), stained and worn-out furniture, a broken lampshade on a flickering light, I mean, the list goes on and on. My son took a shower that night and he said the tub - which wouldn't drain - filled with yellowish water...ew!

We called the front desk and the night manager said there were no other rooms available that evening but, they would move us to another room on Friday. We asked to speak to the director, but she wasn't available so we requested for her to call us. She never did, even after following up with the manager the next night, again asking to speak with the hotel director.

The second room was equally disgusting, as you will see by the attached photos. The tub did not drain in this room either and the toilet took almost 10 minutes to refill its tank. By the way, the beds in both room were horribly uncomfortable (very, very hard) with pillows that felt more like stacks of cardboard than pillow material.

Do not be fooled by the photos on the website either. Even the "My Millennium" app states this location serves a breakfast on the weekends, but be warned, there is NO restaurant, NO lounge, NO bar, NOTHING. They have a fitness room, but none of the other amenities advertised exist here. They closed during COVID and never reopened, as the story goes. However, the hotel will charge you "facility fee" (aka, "resort fee") of $34/day for the use of the wifi, fitness room and their "business center." Who needs a business center nowadays?

Upon checkout, the front desk noticed there was a credit to our bill and apologized for any inconvenience. (We were given a pittance of a credit for our troubles.) I relayed to her all the items we encountered, and she put me in touch with the Assistant Director who stated, "I wish you would have told me and I could have made it right." Really? We reported the conditions, asked to speak to the hotel director (twice), and they put us in an equally disgusting room and I'm supposed to: 1. Spend my vacation chasing down the director and 2. Expect the hotel would do any better when they replaced one repulsive room for another? Also, I overheard another guest two windows over from me while I was checking out, tell the front desk that while he was showering, dirty water came out of the shower and filled the tub with brown water. He showed her pictures he had taken.

The neglect extends beyond the rooms, as well. The hallway fixtures are cracked in similar fashion to the lampshade in our room, the wallpaper is peeling in various places, the elevator mirrors have graffiti scratched into them, the carpets are stained throughout many corridors.

For what this hotel is supposed to be, it is rundown, shabby and in dire need of repair, renovation and updating. Spare yourself the trouble and avoid this hotel at all costs.

title: Bad experience
text: The bed so strong , in the bath we can’t use the tub because was in bad condition. The bath did not to have extractor , so the humity in the bedroom after take a shower was insoportable. Too expensive this hotel for the service that you could receive in the bedrooms.

title: DON’T TRUST THE DOORMEN IN THIS  HOTEL
text:
The hotel is nice but quite dated, The room was a good size and was clean. The A/C worked well and the check in staff and staff beside the lift at the desk were nice. The same can’t be said for the giftshop staff and the doorstaff. The prices in the giftshop change depending on the guys mood and the time of day.

Now onto the doorstaff (Orlando C) 
He saw us booking our ride to the airport through Lyft and told us it was cheaper and quicker to get a yellow taxi because he could get us a flat rate from the driver of $95 (Our lyft would have been $95) so we decided to just take his recommendation and get in the yellow taxi. When we got into the taxi the driver gave the bellman a $10 bill for what i assume was getting us into his taxi and i asked the driver to confirm if the flat rate was $95 to witch he said no its $100 plus tolls but it was too late for us to get out of the taxi . The fair ended up costing us $130 all because this greedy bellman wanted his dropsy from the taxi driver. DON’T TRUST THE DOORMEN IN THIS HOTEL

title: OVERWHELMINGLY DISAPPOINTING
text:
I organised a 'trip of a lifetime' to NY to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday with our 3 teenage children.  I booked 2 rooms for a 7 night stay at the Millenium Hotel.
We arrived late in the evening to be informed of an unexpectedly large 'facility fee' of $482.02 for the two rooms for they gym and international phone calls.  We never saw the gym and made no calls.  There is no bar or restaurant and there was no fridge in one of our rooms.  This does not represent good value.  When I complained I was told to take it up with my booking agent, which I have done.
When we got to our rooms we were overwhelmingly disappointed.  
The rooms are TIRED, SCRUFFY, STAINED, SCRATCHED AND HAVE BROKEN AND DANGEROUS LIGHT FITTINGS AND FURNITURE.   This was extremely upsetting as we had spent an absolute fortune and had high expectations.  One of our rooms had two double beds which was supposed to sleep 4 adults.  However the DOUBLE BEDS ARE VERY SMALL DOUBLES and not large enough for my two teenage sons to share comfortably.
I asked the hotel to address the issues with the rooms and the beds but they could not offer a satisfactory solution.  

There were at least 3 occasions when we didn't have any towels in our room, although housekeeping rectified this reasonably promptly.

The positives I can offer are:
- The location which is very central
- Our bed was very comfortable with good linen.  This was the saving grace - I think we might have exited the building otherwise.
- The concierge was helpful

I have complained via my booking agent but have not received a response or any offer of compensation.

title: Not Safe
text:
Someone opened my door whilst i was inside, thank God the security latch was on so they could not get inside. 
I reported this to management security came to check and told me someone will get back to me. No one got back to me with any feedback regarding my concern I had to go downstairs to follow up and the manager on duty that time said he Ddnt know anything about it because he was on afternoon shift. Then security was called and he said it shows no one had access to my room only at 2pm when security had come to check, which was not true because i had gone out earlier around 8am to get breakfast because they don’t have room service another minus. I don’t feel safe at all at this hotel. They are taking this issue very lightly what was going to happen if whoever that was had gained access to my room I am a lady 1st time in this city what if I was not in the room when this happened someone could have came in and stolen my stuff. 
I am not happy at all safety and security should be number 1 priority but it seems not at this hotel

title: Totally Outdated
text: Really bad pillows. The bathroom was not clean when we arrived.  Toilet not working well, totally outdated place... It does not get close to the pictures on the website. They left only a quarter of the toilet paper. The elevators weren't working and we had to take the service elevator for two days in a row

title: Lovely Staff and Location
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful, the location was perfect for activities around Times Square. There was one concern about charring around an outlet in our room, the TV didn’t work and two of the four days we were there, the elevators were not working properly with a wait of 45 minutes.

title: 5 STARS FOR DANNY!
text: Wow! Where do we even begin? The service was beyond amazing! Juan welcomed us with open arms and was extremely accommodating making sure we had everything we needed. The real star of the show was Danny! He made us feel right at home and had the best recommendation for places to eat, things to do, and shows to see. His hospitably exceeds 5 stars! I guarantee there is not a hotel staff that will treat you better than this one.

title: New York at its finest
text: The view was great. Pilllows we’re great and the pull out bed was a plus. The only thing I didn’t like about it was the elevator. So many people were coming in. Trying to fit no matter how many people were in it.

title: Nice hotel but need to fix multiple non working elevators
text:
Everything was nice besides the fact that they were only three working elevators and sometimes it was a 20 minute wait to catch the elevator which was not good if you were trying to get to a play or musical. 

Nice rooms with plenty of space.

title: Dark and Dated Dump!
text: Stay Away!!! You have been warned! We booked a 4 star hotel thru Hotwire and we got this dump. Never again. Dark, dated and dingy. Plus, only 2 semi-working elevators for 52 floors. Took us 45 minutes with housekeeping helping us taking us in a packed service elevator to get down. Hotel isn’t answering phone calls. Asked the concierge to talk to Hotwire to confirm the issues we were having to get some money back and he lied to the agent. A-Hole!! Only helpful staff was housekeeping and maintenance and they know this place is a dump! This hotel hasn’t been updated in 30 yrs. Carpet stain, counters cracked, furniture is damaged and dated.

title: Look into your priority amenities
text:
The standard room was a nice size with a great view. The building could use some maintenance (fine detail sprucing). Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful (concierge and housekeeping). I was only disappointed to discover there was no fridge or microwave. The ice machine on our floor was not working. This caused far more spending on food than expected. 
Location was fantastic, right where everything is and close to the subway.

title: Stay away!
text: Stay away. I repeat: stay away. I unfortunately stayed the week of May 1 through May 5. During this time, the plumbing stopped working. People could not flush the toilet. People could not take showers. One family I spoke with used the Starbucks public toilets for two days. During this time, they were still continuing to check in customers! At 3 AM, a plumbing crew finally arrived and banged and drilled all night long. On top of this, only two elevators were working for a 52 floor hotel. It took me 30 minutes and a long line to get to my room. My friend stayed in a separate room, and the curtains had burn spots. My room’s TV screen dimmed and flickered, the table had scratches, and the water pressure was extremely low. the walls and elevators have scratches and look rundown. Also, this hotel has no air conditioning, so be aware of this if you’re coming in the humid summertime. They also charge a Hidden facilities fee of about $30 per day. For all this trouble, they offered a measly 10% off plus compensation of the facilities fee. Pretty shady, especially since the facilities are so rundown. This hotel need a complete overhaul and I’m not sure why they’re still allowed to stay in business. Do not come here.

title: Localização privilegiada!
text: Me hospedei por 5 dias nesse hotel, juntamente com minha esposa e dois filhos (06 e 01 anos). Quartos confortaveis, chuveiro quente, vista maravilhosa. Destaque para a localização; perfeita! Unica coisa que ficou a desejar , era não ter frigobar no quarto. Precisavamos para armazenar a mamadeira do bebe. Volataria a me hospedar com certeza!

title: 5 stars!!!
text: Perfect location, affordable, and accommodating. Danny is wonderful, extremely helpful getting us set up and on our way around the city! He went above and beyond to make this a memorable experience for all of us.

title: Great places! Great staff!
text: The customer service from Danny at the front desk was amazing! He’s so insightful and gave recommendations that were so helpful. Water pressure was good and comfy beds with clean linens. Great location.

title: Daniel is AMAZING!!!!!
text: The hotel is in terrible condition, I was here for a week for work my carpet was all moldy and there were other issues as well BUT Daniel made me feel so much better when I went downstairs to see if I could switch rooms. I was unable to switch but he had me leaving with a smile. Whatever they’re paying that man, it is not enough!! Daniel is the heart of this hotel!!!!

title: Downtown NYC
text: Excellent location right in the middle of all the action. Older hotel but we’ll maintained. No restaurant and no coffee machine in the room. No fridge. Would have been nice to have coffee available in the lobby. Employees were friendly and helpful.

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text: We stayed here over Valentine’s Day and had 5 nights in New York. Hotel is a great location, very central to Times Square and very easy to find. Check in was super fast and easy and our room was great, really nice view and was kept very clean and tidy throughout our stay. Staff were super friendly and very knowledgeable. All who worked there were very approachable for questions and suggestions of restaurants and bars as we liked to go to less touristy places and they were great for that! Nothing was too much of an ask and great place to stay in NYC.

title: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL
text:
Yes, the location and views are good, I am not a picky person but I have no idea how health and safety regulations allow this hotel to run. The hotel is in urgent need of repair and update. The cables were exposed, molded walls, tv did not work (we did not care much tbh) but the problem was the no running water situation... I did not book and would not book this hotel but we were moved there by our operator.

On our next to last night the hotel run out of water around 7:00 pm, we went out for dinner told it should be fixed on our return, as it was just a broken pipe. We came back around midnight and still no water. The next morning when we woke up still no water, at 1 pm the next day I requested to be moved to the sister hotel next door, which was denied by the manager. After a lot of deliberation, and arguing with reception and the manager they agreed to move up to another floor/room with running water. 
I work in travel and this is not a professional way to handle this situation.  No compensation, no apology, no bottled water, or nothing was offered in return due to the incident. I hope to never ever go back to this hotel again and I do not recommend it either.

title: We love the Millennium and Daniel!
text: We loved the hotel and the location! And most especially we loved getting to know Daniel! He is such an asset to the hotel, giving us tips on restaurants, shows to go see, and we will definitely come back here because of his guidance!

title: Worst Hotel In The Best Location
text:
Without Doubt The Worst Hotel We Have Stayed In For Our United States Trip. Great Location and Water Pressure is the ONLY thing going for it. Everything else is just horrible.
Take a look at the pictures attached. Rooms are filthy. Dust everywhere. Stained Carpets. Walls have dirty marks everywhere on them. Electrical LIVE wires hanging out of lights which is a real concern. Television hasn't worked for the whole time we have stayed here (5 nights). Service Staff came to repair it but was too STONED on weed , didn't care and gave up and Literally went home! Every day House Keeping would come and the only thing they did was make the bed and remove the towels. They never cleaned, they never replaced the towels! Every day we had to call house keeping to request for towels.
Wifi was slow and kept dropping out in the room. Take a look at the pictures of the TV and WIFI Router! Look at the picture of the taps in the bathroom. Dirt, hair shavings etc. It hasn't been cleaned in months! Paint and wall paper pealing from nearly every wall. Skirtings have about 3mm of dust on them. Mould Mould and More Mould in the shower! Furniture is old and chipped.

Seriously...... for the $$ you pay for this room per night with the taxes then added on top, it is an absolute rip off.
Like I said in the headline, great location..... couldn't ask for a better spot.

Would I stay here again?..... Certainly NOT.....

Note: I am NOT a picky person when it comes to hotels, resorts etc...... I'm far from it. However, this was just so exceptionally BAD!

Do yourself a favour and avoid this place until it has a major makeover!

title: 4 Nights in the Big Apple
text:
My mom, daughter and I stayed here for four night.   The only complaint I had was the room was equipped with two double beds instead of two queens, this made it a tight squeeze for two grown adults to share.  

We thought the staff were friendly and helpful.  The location was perfect, view was amazing, and rate was better than many other hotels we researched in the same area.  We would return.

title: Would stay here again!
text: Big clean room and bathroom. Friendly staff. Awesome location in the heart of Times Square. Steps away from broadway theaters and tons of restaurants. Great value for the price. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect Location.
text:
Couldn’t be in a better location, about 100 feet away from Times Square. Good rooms, may be worth paying the extra for a “City View” or the “Ball Drop” view for a really cool room and experience. Air con was a little iffy in the room but it’s a minor issue. 

Would absolutely stay again.

title: Pleasant stay
text: Very friendly, helpful staff. The check-in process was quick and easy and staff were knowledgeable when answering questions. The room was pretty clean. Slow water drainage in the shower. Would stay again.

title: Awesome Location to stay at
text: While there are things to repair, update, & clean our overall stay was good! This hotel had friendly helpful staff and u cannot beat its awesome location! The way I look at it we barely spent time in the room during the day so all the small imperfections didn’t bother me too much. Thanks for a great New York experience.

title: Terrible experience
text:
This was the worst experience of my life. If you want to hear doors slamming all night and if you want to hear everything happening in Time Square - stay here. Sleep is almost impossible with the very loud noise coming from all angles. Almost everything in the room is ancient and broken - not to mention filthy. The cleaning staff banged on my door every early morning asking “when are you leaving” even though I had the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door and spoke to the front desk about it numerous times so I wouldn’t keep getting woken up. No apologies by the way. The phone in my room didn’t work so being on floor 25, I had to go all the way downstairs whenever there was a problem - and there were many problems. The drain in my shower was pulled out when I arrived. When I showered, I had to stand in my own filth since nothing would drain. I had to wash my feet/legs in the sink as the water didn’t drain until the next morning. My towels, cups, etc were never replaced. They made my bed and that’s all. The elevators weren’t working because the light to go down was out so I always had to go up before going down and with 50 floors, this took a lot of waiting time. Once I checked out, I left my bags for a few hours and came back in the afternoon needing to use the washroom. The Manager on duty was useless. Thank goodness Trinity the concierge was there to attempt to fix the problem. The main floor women’s washroom was flooded so the only option was the men’s washroom. As I entered, the toilet was covered in feces. The manager couldn’t have been older than 25 years old and he wasn’t only not helpful, but he didn’t care at all about my seeking help. I will say that the door man Mark and the concierge Trinity (just hired a week ago) were fantastic. They’re the only ones who stopped me from completely losing my mind. I cannot say enough about Mark. He did the work of the entire staff, running everywhere to make sure every guest was taken care of yo the highest caliber. Give this man a raise!!!  The group of men who would regularly assemble near the concierge area were rude and useless. I believe they were security but hard to tell given they were in suits like all other staff.  Whenever I asked a question, I was told to ask Trinity as they then turned their back and continued socially talking among themselves. These were not hard questions (e.g., what street is that road outside the door). 
I’ve left a message for the General Manager with no response. It was very difficult getting his name since the young and inexperienced Manager on duty wouldn’t give it to me. I hope the GM will soon contact me for a full refund and compensation of some sort because this trip was 5 years in the making and was supposed to be my first break in a very long time. I’m told the Premium Millenium hotel next door is much better BUT I will be the judge of that shortly if the GM rights this wrong.

title: Excellent all around
text: Simon is a great asset to the hotel and overall our stay was a Great experience, the hotel is in the heart of of the action you are close to everything, I highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for the new york experience.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
This Hotel has an entrance on both 44th and 45th Streets. It is less than a minute from Times Square. And 5 minutes from the TKTS booth. So if your plan is to see as many Broadway shows as you can during your visit, then this is a perfect choice. 

Our group had 4 adults and we stayed in room 5207. The room is a junior suite,  has a separate bedroom with a living room area (“LRA”). The bedroom has a king size bed and an ensuite, while the LRA has a queen size sofa bed and a half bath. 

The Hotel generously provided us with a roll away single bed in the LRA.

The view from the windows was of course spectacular.

Room was cleaned and towels were changed everyday.

The service was great.

title: Amazing Concierge and Service!
text: Trinita at the concierge desk was super helpful and friendly during our stay. She gave great food and drink recommendations and made us feel right at home in the Millenium. 5 stars for her awesome service!

title: Sin consideración por problema de salud , botandome a primera hora del hotel no creo que regrese
text: La limpieza no es muy buena en la habitacion, estubimos 1 semana entera y pedimos un dia mas y no nos dieron informacion suficiente para reservar nuestra ultima noche por lo tanto tuvimos q irnos a otro hotel el ultimo dia , se que el check out es a las 11 pero me encontraba mal de salud y la señorita sahli creo no recuerdo el nombre 05/26 en la mañana nos trato muy mal diciendole q mi esposo que nos cargaban $100 a la habitacion por la tardanza que en realidad era por problemas d salud , llevamos 1 semana entera y no hubo concideracion por parte de esa recepcionista , en cambio bajamos y hablamos con catherine y nos trato super bien incluso nos pudo haber hecho la reservacion del ultimo dia pero ya era tarde le agradezco a ella ya que la otra señorita no tuvo tacto al tratarnos como huespedes de hace 1 semana y ademas tengo problemas d salud pidiendo un poco mas de tiempo en general , no hay microondas en la habit ni nevera ni restaurante y es bastante cara para lo poco que tiene para mi es un 3*  ademas del trato de la señorita

title: cautions prélévées sur carte bancaire toujours pas remboursées, conditions de réservations non respectées.
text:
Expérience mitigée...

A notre arrivée, on nous a dit qu'il y avait un problème avec notre réservation, il n'y avait qu'une seule chambre réservée à notre nom.

Un très gentil réceptionniste nous a proposé, comme solution, une chambre dans l'hôtel millenium broadway NY Times square et une autre dans le millinium premium (juste à côté).
Il nous a dit que si la chambre nous plaisait, nous pouvions la garder pour tout le séjour, sans supplément, dans les mêmes conditions de notre réservation.
Le lendemain, on nous a dit que nous n'étions pas autorisés à prendre le petit déjeuner si nous restions dans le bâtiment principal. Pourtant on nous avez assuré la veille que les conditions de réservation seraient inchangées. 
Consciliants, nous avons donc convenu de ne pas prendre le petit déjeuner, de rester dans la chambre.

Nous avons rendu nos clés le lundi à 20h30, alors que les chambres étaient réservées jusqu'au mardi 25/04.
Lorsque nous avons rendu les clés, on nous a dit que tout était ok et que nous pouvions partir.

2 jours après notre retour en France, j'ai vu sur notre compte bancaire que l'hôtel avait prélévé de l'argent pour nos deux chambres.
J'ai appelé pour en connaître la rasion, et on m'a dit  que c'était les cautions  pour les chambres, et que je serai remboursée dans 5 jours.

Cela fait maintenant plus de trois semaines que j'ai appelé et je n'ai toujours pas été recréditée des cautions...

J'ai envoyé trois emails sans réponse...
Je vais donc certainement devoir rappeler l'hôtel, ce qui va encore me coûtait de l'argent sachant que je n'ai pas de forfait international...

title: Dated rooms but great location
text: We stayed here in May for 3 nights. First of all hotel was middle of times square and a amazing location! The rooms and hotel itself was pretty dated if honest and could definitely do with a move to 2023! Having said that we only used the rooms to sleep and get ready and spent little time here as we wanted to explore also the tvs had Netflix the rooms were clean spacious and housekeeped every day.

title: You need to meet Daniel, he is the best!
text:
One thing is to say the rooms are outdated, but our room was dusty and had the following issues:

1. Wall paper was peeling and looked dirty.
2. Carpet was stained.
3. Toilet takes over a minute to flush and you have to hold the handle the whole time.
4. Bathtub took 30 min. to drain.
5. And, the lamp on the headboard fell on my head as I was watching TV.

I talked to the manager Ellie who said she would refund $35.00 dollars, for the inconveniences, but I told her that was an insult and an unfair compensation. She told me she would call me back to figure something out, but I was not contacted.
6. They are missing concierge service.  

However, the two things that made up for the cons about this place: 

1. Daniel at the front desk provided such a pleasant, friendly, and stellar experience. You can tell Daniel loves his job. He is the most professional person I have encountered even at other big name hotels.  I will say that Daniel gets it, and does his best to make this a great experience. Also, Daniel has the coolest look and awesome beard which he decorates.
2. The last redeeming factor about this place is the location, and the of times square.
The reason I am giving this hotel five stars is due to Daniel and the great location.

title: Great front desk staff!!
text: My cousin and I stayed the weekend of May 5-May 9,2023.We were celebrating her milestone birthday of 60! She had never been to NYC,She grew up in the midwest and has lived in New England for many years.The hotel was an excellent location to explore the city on foot. The front desk was very helpful,A HUGE shout out to Daniel, He is simply the BEST,He is well suited for the job!! Now lets talk about the room,For starters no alarm clock in the room,Shower had really good water pressure but shower curtain didn't hold in place,thus water on the floor. Overall the room was comfortable just a bit dated. Plenty of restaurants near by as well.I would consider staying again.

title: Best in NY
text: absolutely amazing. the location and the prices are just the best. you really gotta give it a shot. this is one of a few millennium hotels in the country and its on time square. in the most visited city

title: Fantastic staff
text:
Spent two nights here and not only is it in a great location but the staff couldn't have been more helpful.
Upon checking in we were met by Syeda at the reception. A lovely person who couldn't do enough for us and went to great lengths to ensure we enjoyed our stay and her thoughtfulness really made the difference.

title: Very close to Time square
text:
The place does have a wow factor when you walk in, I was slightly disappointed in the room though. Broken drawers, rip in the net curtain - the place felt like it needed an update badly. That is pretty much the downside.... upside was its clean, the beds were extremley comfortable. Its right near to Times square which is both great and not so great - thanks to the noise. 
The staff are very helpful - but if I was going to New york again - I would stay nearer Central park - mostly in the hope of less noise.

title: Overall good location however very poor cleanliness
text:
Very poor cleanliness!! The made came and “clean “ the room every day , however to a very poor standard. There was urine stains on side of the toilet which were there upon our arrival. Old hairs stuck on the taps , shower vent full of dust . Massive amounts of dust and dirty on the back of the bed /headboard. 
If you have ocd avoid!!🤢

title: Not perfect but very well located and cheap (for New York)
text:
It’s important to take all factors into account when writing a review: When I read previous reviews complaining about this hotel I’m just asking myself if those clients has considered the price per night in their review? 

Yes, the hotel is not very new and yes the rooms are quite old, antiquated and not very very clean. But that’s not the price you paid for: you want to be in a 5 star? Go the Plaza and pay the price. 

The Millenium is far from being perfect but 1) It’s perfectly located: it’s literally 1 minute walking distance from Times Square! 2) It’s cheap (for New York) 3) Their staff is very nice: Special thanks to Catherine who made two little girls happy offering them a welcome gift

title: Daniel is the best tour guide
text: By far the absolute best time ever. I have never written a review for anything before but I feel I need to. I'm here in NYC for the very first time from NH to celebrate my 60th birthday.  I've always been too nervous to come thinking I'd be overwhelmed but it all. But this has been a lifelong dream of mine to visit. Daniel at the front desk was extremely accommodating and giving us directions to everywhere to go visit and eat. I love it here like visiting friends or family. I'll be sure to stay again because I plan to visit during the holidays.  can't wait.

title: 5 night stay
text: My partner and I spent 5 nights at this hotel. The hotel rooms are quite basic, but fit for purpose, possibly just well used. Overall, we were happy with our stay, but it did take the staff almost half the time we were there fix the TV. The location is good for those interested in broadway because you step out practically into Times Square.

title: Great location means this hotel will always be popular
text:
The hotel location is the best thing it has to offer. On this basis alone I would rebook. It’s in need of a little TLC in some areas but only due to age, She was clearly magnificent in her day. The beds were comfortable. There are many many floors and our room was on floor 35. When we were at Summit 1 we found the hotel by aerial view. Check in customer service and luggage collection service were great, top notch. Service slid during a maintenance issue with water which although understandable, the staff were under pressure, did drop considerably on politeness. You can see however, a score of 4 indicates nothing that would stop me recommending and returning overall. 

The things that would benefit from improvement were 

A) air con. Although the room had air con we seemed to be limited on how much adjustment we could make. It was truly boiling every morning. 
B) there was a water pipe issue during our stay. Whilst I understand these things are unpredictable the hotel needs to plan better around communication to its guests. At the least, a letter under the door during the night to explain and apologise.

title: Good Customer service over the Phone
text: I have not checked in just yet, but I will this weekend :)  but I would like to  appreciate Robert for helping me make a reservation. It has been two days since I been looking for a Hotel till I called and I spoke to him he gave me very helpful information and I saved a couple bucks. I will be writing a review after my stay but so far so good.

title: Mükemmel Konum
text: Konumu mükemmel, odaları konforlu, yatakları geniş ve rahattı. Temizlikle ilgili bir sorun yaşamadık. Asansörleri çok hızlı olmasına rağmen zaman zaman bekleme süresi artıyordu. Memnun kaldık bir sonraki Nyc seyahatimizde memnuniyetle tercih ederiz.

title: Great
text:
Perfect balance of price and quality. 
Daniel at the front desk is the best ❤️
He made our stay wven more pleasant 
Overall cleanliness good, services good. 
Staff generally helpful,  always ready to assist

title: Pas de confort mais top proximité
text:
Chambre 3209 du 27.04 au 02.05.23
Meuble vieillot pas très propre 
Pas de cafetière, bouilloire, frigo dans la chambre.
Le petit déjeuner à l'extérieur

Un hall de gare, beaucoup de passage.
Horrible les oreillers

title: Horrible. Disaster.
text:
This place is a dump. Don’t even consider it. Pitch a tent, sleep on the street, sleep in your car. This place sucks. 

No restaurant. No bar. No fridge in the room. No pen or paper to write a note to leave the housekeeper a tip. 

The elevators only work half the time. 

To boot the main water line burst and I don’t have water. 

DO NOT BOOK. Run don’t walk away from this disaster.

title: Great place for a Broadway Adventure
text: We just spent several wonderful days at the Millennium Hotel Broadway Times Square. Our rooms was a beautiful suite on the 50th floor with amazing views of the ball on Times Square. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the local area. Julien Pierlas was especially helpful.  He was very hospitable, making sure our every need was met. Additionally he helped direct us to some of the best restaurants, most unforgettable activities of the trip. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. We took our daughters to see the Lion King only a few steps from the hotels front door.  Highly Recommended!

title: Great location, great service
text:
My husband and I have stayed at Millennium Broadway 4 or 5 different times (most recently 4/20-25) ... A lot of people do not recommend staying in Times Square - but it's so convenient to all the subway lines.  It's easy to get anywhere from there!

The staff is excellent, always kind and accommodating.  The rooms are a good size by NYC standards.  The decor is dated and the bed is a bit firm, but we enjoyed our stay. We were on the 40th floor this past week and while you could hear some sirens at that height, it wasn't bad at all and didn't affect our sleep.

The elevators work well and are secure - you have to use a room key to go up. We rarely have to wait very long on one (other than right after the Thanksgiving Day Parade-side note- it's a great location if you go to the parade - just walk out to the street corner on 6th Avenue and you'll have a great view of the parade). We feel the price is reasonable for NYC.

title: Shout out to Juan Pablo and Kayla for their warm welcome!
text:
Hotel Staff can make your experience a pleasant one or an unpleasant one.   I love staying at this hotel.  During my last stay, Juan Pablo and Kayla were absolutely amazing.  They were patience, friendly and most of all professional.  That is all I ask, when I stay at any hotel.   I strongly recommend that on your next visit try to ask for Juan Pablo and Kayla.  They will make  you feel warm and welcomed in the busy and buzzing heart of Time Square. 

Brooksie*

title: Big rooms in  Times Square ; Fab front desk service
text: Great business hotel in Times Square with rooms bigger than your unusual shoe box size in NY and more quiet than other hotels in the area. Service at the front desk was super nice and Catherine was absolutely fabulous. I will be coming back .

title: Hôtel avec une très bonne situation et personnels très sympathiques la vue de notre chambre était magnifique

Le personnel de chambre était vraiment très bien

. Les chambres sont un peu vieillottes mais la literie est très confortable. La situation de l hôtel est top

title: One Night at the Times Square
text:
Bis auf die Lobby sieht das ganze Hotel sehr runtergekommen aus.

title: Good location but rooms need renovation
text: David at  the Reception was a lovely surprise! Thank you for the warm welcome. Hotel’s location is great but the Rooms need Renovation….fridge was removed from the room and there was no Kettle for coffee or tea…

title: Poor basic service.
text: Terrible service and poor infrastructure.  After more than one hour waiting for maintenance or housekeeping to fix the curtains, I gave up.  Front desk was not proactive and the night manager never showed up.  Picture below of the light coming in at 11:00pm.

title: Loved it.
text: The room was amazing ! They gave us an upgrade at check out, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. THE VIEW WAS SPECTACULAR! The location was perfect, walking distance to everything and just steps from Times Square . Syeda was a sweet heart and had the patience of an angel . We will definitely  be  back soon.

title: Excellent stay in Midtown!
text: The hotel had amazing views and a wonderful central location. We could walk to lots of attractions and the subway was very close. The staff was helpful and courteous, particularly Julien Pierlas. He made our stay incredible.

title: Great location, rude staff, expensive extras
text:
The location is great. Hotel is ideally situated for all attractions.
The guy with the decorated beard was rude when I went to enquire about a message I’d received from the hotel about the possibility of an upgrade and we had no hot water for many hours on one day with no offers of compensation.

Be aware that if you want a late check out (our flight home was a night one) they expect you to pay $50 per hour after 12:00 which is extortionate - most places do a deal of some sort where you pay £20 for a late check out at around 16:00.

This meant we had to leave the hotel ready for our 22:00 flight at 08:00 as we had an excursion planned and were unable to freshen up ahead of our departure.

We stayed in room 4501. The view of Times Square was amazing and the room was large. 
If we were to stay again we’d pick a cheaper room as we didn’t spend more than an hour a day in the room to shower and head out again.

title: Outstanding stay! Daniel is the best!
text:

title: Fantastic stay
text: Fantastic hotel with an excellent location! Staff were friendly and helpful. I had the pleasure of dealing with Simon at the reception desk who went above and beyond to ensure I had a an enjoyable stay.. a brilliant asset to the hotel!

title: Location
text: Location is great. However, the hotel is too old, jam traffic at the elevator during check out time. Bathtub clog, cabinet handle missing, no fridge. The price is not reasonable though, so you pay for location at the high price.

title: Excellent location; great rooms - great value for the money.
text: Stayed in the Millennium Premier: clean quiet hotel; excellent mid-town location. Lovely rooms with tasteful touches. Stand up stall shower a great convenience. A special shoutout to Monique at the front desk _ pleasant, helpful with a cheerful and professional personality.

title: Trip to NYC
text: It was a good eoom with a good view. We had a fun time innnyc as it was my buddies first time here and he enjoyed the view of the ball and times square. The hotel itself could have some updated ammenities but for location it worked

title: Just okay.
text: There were 8 in our girl party. We requested roo.s on the same floor. We were all on different floors. Arrived at 3:40 and could not check in.  There's no place to sit in the lobby except for a few benches. Bar is closed so we had no where to gather to plan our day. Constant hammering on the wall startingat 7 everymorning. . Complained to a clerk at front desk,but nothing was done. No coffee maker or refrigerator in room. Rooms needed updating. Carpet is worn out.  Great location.

title: Great location, but just ok….
text: Hotel is greatly situated with amazing views, but for the rates, it’s just an average hotel. The room was just ok. Water in the tub kept switching from cool to scorching hot on its own. The toilet kept making noises, the room as well. We were on a 45th floor. At times only 1 elevator working. Elevators need a little TLC. Overall a nice stay but nothing spectacular about the hotel itself.

title: Better options for the price
text: I’ve stayed at this hotel many times and it is rapidly declining. While the location is fantastic - and they charge accordingly- everything else is shabby at best. We came to see Sweeney Todd and the questionable stains on the bathroom floor in our room made us feel awkwardly part of the show. The rooms haven’t been updated in years, yet their price keeps climbing. For a better experience, stay a couple of blocks further away and pocket the $200 a night difference for other excursions.

title: Bem localizado na Times Square
text: Viajei com a família, Hotel bem organizado, rápido atendimento dos funcionários, bem localizado na Times Square, fica na 44th Street, quartos confortáveis, não tem barulho mesmo com a Times Square cheia à noite, pois os vidros das janelas são espessos.

title: Perfect position right next to Times Square.
text: Perfectly located hotel, all staff were very helpful and informative. Room was clean and tidy, it was good to see my room cleaned daily with fresh toiletries and towels as needed along with bottled water as required. Reason I have said 4 star over 5 is that it’s need a bit of work to keep it up to date, dated room attire and hall carpets. I understood they are working towards and I am sure it will be updated in due course. Remember you are paying for the location.

title: Loved check in very fun personal and welcoming !
text:
Easy access to check in, fun at the front, everyone is very helpful and kind as you walk through the doors. Very kind to offer shows and mention places to see and visit ! 
Thank you for the stay!!!!!

title: Perfect central location!
text: The room was good, staff was very helpful friendly and accommodating!! The location is perfect for all you want to do. Walking from a central location!! Absolutely recommend and will be returning on the near future!! Syeda at the front was super helpful at check out!! Cheers!!

title: 80 cumpleaños en NYC
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado en pleno Times Square aunque le hace falta una remodelación porque el inmobiliario es antiguo y está dañado y el sistema de acondicionamiento no funciona correctamente, además de producir mucho ruido. Lo mejor de nuestra estancia fue conocer a Catherin de recepción ya que nos hizo nuestra estadía maravillosa con muchos detalles y atenciones. Muchas gracias de nuevo Catherin por tu gran ayuda. Orlando, el maletero, también muy agradable y servicial.

title: NY quick visit
text: Booked two rooms. Catherine was very helpful. Wonderful customer service. Upgraded our one room to king size. When we came up to one of the rooms it wasnt cleaned yet but Catherine was able to move us to a new room seamlessly. Will book  again next time.

title: Average hotel
text: Hotel was very basic. Cleanish ish. Shower wasn’t working but we figured it out. Air con wasn’t working but got told by reception it was because it was winter. Not idea.  Not much communication from the hotel, I emailed about 4 times and I’m still waiting for a response. Doorman was very friendly and organised a taxi to airport for us. Great service by the doorman

title: Fabulous hotel and staff!
text: I love this hotel, it was fantastic! The receptionist were great. The rooms were a little tired looking but we were there to see New York! We were only in the room to shower and sleep so it didn't worry us. The cleaning staff were fabulous,  very friendly. I'd stay there anytime. The one downfall is resort fees, we wasn't told until the last minute by our travel agent, it would have been nice to know previously.

title: Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location, very close to Times Square and Broadway
text:
Excellent hotel, great location (steps away from the centre of Times Square).
Large clean bedrooms with gigantic beds. Large bathroom with bath and a great shower. Staff were very friendly and helpful. 
Can wait to go back, would definitely recommend.

title: Great location and reasonable price!
text: Excellent location and reasonable price! Rooms were decent size with great views on the 46th floor. Staff was excellent! If you needed anything, it was there within 15 minutes. Syed at the front desk was awesome! Will definitely go back!

title: Perfect location!!
text:
I have just returned home after a 4 night stay at this hotel. Myself and my friend decided to upgrade on arrival to a twin room at an extra charge of $45 per night - this was worth every penny, we stayed on the 33rd floor, which looked onto the H&M building .The room was spacious with a double bed each and plenty of room - the rooms are a little tired and could do with updating but overall we were happy. The room had a fridge and hair dryer and a kettle could be requested from house keeping if required. There was miniature shower gels/shampoo/ conditioner provided in the bathroom. The bins were emptied each day and fresh towels provided. The hotel is in an excellent position for Times Square. We did not find it to noisy at night and the beds were comfortable. Never had any issues with the lifts, all were very quick and efficient. 
We requested a late check out and we able to keep the room until 12pm free of charge. On checkout there is a storage room to leave luggage if required. Deposit of $40 taken on arrival which has already been returned to my account - staff were helpful and arranged a cab to the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Really Nice Hotel
text: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It's in the heart of Timesquare, and my room had an amazing view. I had friends over who were impressed with the size of the room for a New York hotel, as it was quite spacious. I also loved the gym, which had much better equipment than more prominent hotels. Catherine and Sue, who helped with my check-in and check-out, were super helpful and provided an amazing service. I would have loved it if there was a mini fridge in the room, but NY is still cold, so that wasn't an issue for me. I'll visit again.

title: Nice hotel with nice staff
text: This is mh 2nd visit to this hotel. The staff Syeda was very nice when serve me. She try the best for her customer satisfying. It was meaningfull. I would like to recommend to stay at this hotel. You will never get complain. The room is so cozy and quite wide with best view to times square. I will comeback to this hotel for sure...

title: NYC trip
text: We arrived on 21/03/2023 late in the evening and Jenny on the front desk was the friendly face that we needed to see after a long flight. She and Shally upgraded our room to overlook the ball drop, free of charge. All the staff were super friendly and extremely helpful. The room itself was spacious and the bed was comfortable. It’s situated just off Time Square so ideal location for tourism! Will absolutely stay again when we come back.

title: Don't Stay - Needs Refurbishment
text:
We had booked via a travel agent The Row but it had been changed to the Millennium last minute. 
Upon arrival to the hotel, there was no hotel lobby, it just felt like a cut through via 2 streets. 
After realising where the reception was it was in dire need of a refurbishment, with broken tiles behind the desk and Christmas decoration still up in March. 

We arrived at the hotel between 7 - 8pm, the 2 rooms we had booked and requested being adjoined weren’t available. We were told it would be a few hours until this is ready, not ideal after 14 hours of travel. We accepted not to have adjoining rooms, but at least have it on the same floors. The process of checking in took 30 minutes. 

When we were going to the room, the outdated décor flowed through this hotel. The hallways were stained and scratches down the walls and all over the doors. It did not look appealing or safe. 

Upon  entering the room, I was met by a 28 degree blast of heat coming out the air conditioning, which Is awful. I would later find out that the aircon would randomly turn on during the night and heat the room.

The 1970’s décor had unfortunately followed me into this room, with big clunky broken furniture with missing handles and scratches all over them. The only remaining piece of the wardrobe was a shelf and 4 different colours of white walls in its place. 
The bed had no duvet, just an old, tired beige blanket. 
The bathroom was mouldy on several tiles, with damage to the bathtub or shower basin – couldn’t tell which it was. The wall surrounding the mirror was baked in dust and was frankly horrid. 
The rooms didn’t have any basic facilities or amenities, such as a coffee machine, kettle, fridge, pen paper, and information about the hotel etc. 

When I departed the hotel, a charge of $120 dollars had been placed on my card. After contacting the hotel the informed me it was a facilities fee. I expressed my dissatisfaction at not being informed of this at either arrival or departure. 
I would like to know what the facilities fee include, because there is no bar, no restaurant, no gym no room service. 

To sum up this hotel shouldn’t be a 4 star, it is in need of a serious refurbishment and modernization with the basic facilities reopening. I would not stay here again. The only positive is the location, which can be a little noisy when the aircon starts and the window needs opening.

title: 50 th birthday trip
text: We arrived late at 2 am and got into our room.A little bit on the small size but it was somewhere to lay down and sleep.The next morning I went down to the front desk and spoke to an awesome front desk person who’s name is Syed.I explained my situation to him and he was very helpful and accommodating to my needs and gave me another room with a bigger bed and room.He went above his duties to fix my issues.I couldn’t be more pleased with what he did for us.

title: NHSMUN NYC 2023 School Trip
text:
I traveled with a group of 24 students and teachers from Mexico, everything went well.
Great location 
Clean and comfy rooms
Amazing Staff, especially SYED and ORLANDO.

I will come back with my next group.

title: Absolutely fine hotel. Don't be put off by bad reviews.
text:
We stopped here at the end of February.  We were originally due to stop at The Row but got moved due to The Row closing for the time being. We were offered The Millenium at no extra cost. We were abit dubious and worried due to the negative reviews but I have to say, i was pleasantly surprised.

Firstly the staff were amazing, they couldn't do enough for us. They held our bags as we arrived 2 hours early (Check in is at 4pm) and didn't leave for the airport until late. (5pm) They were all extremely friendly and courteous and the bellhops were great, they sorted us an SUV to get us to JFK instead of us trying to get a big enough uber or yellow cab.

The hotel is in a prime location, although it can be noisy at night but we didn't notice it to be too bad as we were on the 44th floor. It has an entrance at either side so you can enter both streets. It has a Duane Reade next door for snacks/drinks etc. And an Irish Pub near both entrances. Highly recommend O'Connolly's!

Our Safe wouldn't open and they came and fixed it within 10 minutes. We also had a fridge and we asked for a kettle which they provided us with straight away.

The room, whilst it could have done with a spruce up, was not dirty by any means. The beds were clean, and comfy. The floor was clean and the bathroom was immaculate. Even though some of the grouting on the tiles were discoloured, it should by no means be enough to put you off. My cousin and her husband upgraded their room to one on the 47th floor before we arrived and they're room was fantastic with a great View of Times Square.

I've been to New York 4 times, I've stopped at The Row, The Roosevelt and The Lexington and this hotel was just as good. Is it perfect? No. But no hotel is. I wouldn't hesitate to stop here again as it's an affordable option in the centre of Times Square. And let's be honest, how long do you actually stay in the hotel for?

title: Not bad just needs minor changes everything else was great.
text: Rooms a little dirty needs to be updated. Friendly staff. Pictures are deceiving on booking.com. Wouldn’t mind staying again just needs minor changes. Location is great not too far from everything walking distance to a lot.

title: No thanks
text:
The staff at this hotel were extremely lovely and very accommodating. I was able to pre-check in for my room & able to store by luggage until I could officially check in. That’s about where it ends for this hotel.

I couldn’t check in until after 4:00pm which is extremely late.I stayed in a room that left me wanting more. I walked into my room at the heater was on 28 degrees & my room was like a sauna.  I had to crack some windows. 

The venue is 50m from Times Square which means it’s loud, bright and it’s noisy. The blockout blinds weren’t very block out, no earplugs to block out the noise either.  I wanted to put a bottle of water in the fridge and realised the room had no mini fridge. 

Some small changes could make this location more appealing, like
- complimentary earplugs
- mini bar fridges
- split systems in a normal setting.

title: Feeling welcome in the city that never sleeps
text:
We were welcome by Erin who has been a Fantastic host. Always helpful and ready to support us with any question. 
What struck us the most was the kindness and the helpfulness of Erin. She helped us navigate through all the questions we had. 
We had a spacious room with a great view which Allowed us to enjoy our stay even more!

title: Below average option in Times Square.
text: The 3/5 was given for the positive customer service as well as location. Overall the hotel is dirty, uncomfortable and without any typical amenities, i.e water in the room, comfortable beds, and coffee/tea. Do your research at this price point to find a different accommodation.

title: Birthday Trip to NYC
text: We stayed 4 nights and had a wonderful time. It was my birthday the 2nd day and we got chocolates in our room which was a lovely touch. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was large with an amazing view over Times Square. The bed was enormous and extremely comfortable. We slept so well. We stayed on the 31st floor and elevators were never an issue. The room was clean and comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Thank you.

title: Perfect Location, but nothing extraordinary!
text: Staff very friendly. Additional fee added to reservation due to being booked on a travel site that I was not aware of. Hotel in heart of time square. Very recommended for location. Hotel exactly like pictures. Not updated. Otherwise, it was an okay stay. Nothing extraordinary.

title: Worst experience - DO NOT STAY HERE
text: Worst hotel to stay in for the price. We are so disappointed by the service. The pictures are deceiving the rooms are so out dated and old. title: Jenny
text: I have been coming to the Millenium for many years.  Jenny was very welcoming.  Coming in at such a late hour, it was such a pleasure to be welcomed by someone with such a friendly and outgoing demeanor.  Made the check-in process amusing and stress free!  Great hire.

title: Home away from home
text: Millennium premium hotel in Times Square was my home away from home. I had a minor surgery. Also, my apartment was getting renovated Monique Viviana, and Hector made my stay amazing I cannot wait to go back and stay the view was amazing

title: Juan amazing front desk manager
text: I had a great experience at this hotel purely as a result of the service Juan from the front desk provided. He was very accommodating and a really nice person. Location is great for this hotel, you are literally around the corner from Times Square and the Broadway shows.

title: Great Service by Jenny at the front desk
text:
I have often stayed at this hotel, and the front desk customer service is excellent,
 especially Jenny.  The rooms were ok, the lobby was good, and the location was great. The maid service was good. No restaurant, the one they had closed.

title: Run Down and over priced
text: Probably the most run down place I’ve ever stayed-and I’ve traveled across the country, twice. Floors were gross, the pillows were so thin and the blankets needed to be replaced 5 years ago. Only redemption is the location but I will sacrifice that next time to sleep somewhere clean.

title: It Started With Jenny’s Welcome
text: Jenny at front desk welcomed me and worked my issue of a double booking quickly. Room was nice and view is magnificent! Everything is super clean. Room is perfect of a business trip! Location is fabulous and is walking distance to great restaurants and other entertainment.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Honest review… I was quite worried about how the hotel would be from the mixed reviews but just landed home from a 6 night stay here and staying here went beyond my expectations! It’s such a good location, literally a 1 min walk to Times Square! Staff were lovely and polite! Our room had an amazing view of times square which I wasn’t expecting an amazing view but we got one! Our room was really clean and we got our room cleaned regularly whilst being there and they did a really good job👌🏼 check in and out was really quick, we went during off peak season so the hotel was quiet and didn’t have to wait for elevators to and from lobby. They held our bags on last day as we wanted a few hours to explore before flying home and they were kept in a locked room with staff member at desk nearby. We booked through third party and our trip couldn’t have gone more smoothly. Would stay here again 100%!

title: Best location!
text: Great place! Excellent location, right in the middle of everything. The hotel seems to need some kind of renovations but the personal is amazing. Front desk were extremely nice, syed was great! Security also was amazing, Jorge was awesome, helpful and informative on the areas around. Will definitly come again, thank you!

title: "CoVid is over"
text:
We were coming from another hotel but my wife got a high fever and was unable to move.  When I called management and explained, they basically said didn't care about fever, even CoVid and just pay the cancellation fee, CoVid is over".  Of course, the fee was paid as it wqs guaranteed to my card.  

My friends said it was OK, not an accolade.  Given the two, I could only say check around.

title: Vacation in New York
text: Arrived at the Millennium Hotel on Broadway after a good flight from Amsterdam. Receptionist Simon made everything easy and allocated a fabulous room on the 51st floor with an excellent view of the Chrysler Building and New York skyline. The room was large and we were lucky to get a bath and a shower. The house keeping team kept our room looking good throughout our stay. Catherine at reception helped us to print off our boarding passes for our return flight to Amsterdam,  We crammed in a lot of sightseeing on foot and found a fabulous little eatery in a church next to the Guggenheim gallery. Take the free ferry to Staten if you want a good view of the Statue of Liberty, the boat to Ellis Island takes too big a chunk of time out of a busy schedule. Paul Boswell.

title: Great Location but tired hotel
text:
My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We were originally booked into a different hotel but it was changed last minute . 
We didn’t spend much time at the hotel. It is a great location for Time Square and local amenities. The hotel staff were all helpful and polite . The hotel is very tired and needs updating. It is clean but feels a little grubby due to everything being so old and worn out. The bed was comfy

It´s VERY EXPENSIVE just because of the location.

title: Major reno required…
text: Hotel is in a desperate need of a refurbishment. Wallpaper in room was peeling, mold in showers, stains on walls, and carpets were worn. There is no duvet/comforter on the bed only a top sheet. Lobby smelled of weed. Rated two stars not one because it’s a great location and the staff are excellent.

title: A stay made special by Orlando
text: My stay at Millenium Times Square was the best stay I’ve ever had. Orlando Velasco in specific made it an amazing stay. He was helpful, energetic and very courteous. He helped us with directions and recommended great spots around the city. Hang on to this one, he’s an amazing employee and more importantly, an amazing person.

title: Orlando is the best
text: Orlando was so nice and helpful!! Would be happy to have him at every hotel I stay at! Lol he brought my bags up to my room and got me settled quickly with a smile on his face! 10 out of 10 service for sure!

title: Great experience, nice hotel with a great location, near all the important subway lines that can get you anywhere
text:
Orlando velajl was very helpful and nice! 
He helped me with my bags and with my Uber.
Super nice and kind felt very welcomed and comfortable.
The doorbell named Marcus was also very nice and helpful, we had a great time.
Definitely would recommend the stay because of his service and the rest of the staff kindness.

title: Great…BUT…
text: Great location and friendly staff… BUT… a few electrical outlets didn’t work, the TV did not work (said low or no signal).  Also, the bathroom sink was very slow in draining.  Luckily, I didn’t spend lots of time in the room or have kids.

title: Customer
text: Worst experience in my life , dirty room , bathroom , shower doesn’t run water and they told me to they are can not change my room all employees were rude and unrespectful don not waste your time and money RN 2915

title: Birthday Celebration
text: Booked millennium for my husbands special birthday. Arrived at the hotel, was greeted by syeda. She gave us a nice room with a great view and some chocolates. Amazing hospitality. Thank you syeda for making our stay memorable.

title: 1 year anniversary with my wife
text: Great experience! Would do it again! The staff were friendly and courteous. Location of the room was great, we stood on the 49th floor. My wife and I got to enjoy all the attractions close by. I would say make sure your reservation is for the view of the city.

title: Jacob is the MVP, greatest hotel employee ever encountered
text:
Left our coats in the hotel closet, and called multiple times to no avail, trying to find out if they were even at the hotel anymore.  Finally, we got Jacob who:

Called housekeeping to see if they had found any coats in the room
Contacted the new guests in the room twice to see if the coats were still in the closet
Called the individual housekeeper who clean our specific room to see if she had found any left coats
Checked electronic catalogs to track if it was picked up at any point
Retraced the lost and found system since the coats had apparently been miscataloged
And then finally, MANUALLY searched through every item of lost and found.  They were black and very plain, so definitely not an easy task

And that's only a fraction of what he had to do.  Since the entire call was over an hour and he made so many attempts, called so many services, and tried various options, I can only remember and write half of what he did for us.

Every time we were placed on hold, he frequently updated us on his efforts, made sure we hadn't disconnected, and informed us of his next attempt to locate them.  In case we did disconnect, he gave us his direct line to bypass going through the front desk.

He then made every effort to ensure that the coats were easily labeled and recognized by security so we could pick them up after the weekend

Absolutely showed us the epitome of what hotel hospitality can be.  The definition of above-and-beyond and by far the greatest hotel employee experience I have ever received in my years of extensive traveling and hotel stays.  I would stay at the Millenium Hotel in Times Square again solely from my experience with Jacob.  

Thank you

title: Another great stay….
text: Another fantastic stay at the Millennium Broadway. I have been staying at the Millennium for almost 20 years now for multiple annual trips both solo and with family and it never disappoints. The location is perfeosuited for both tourists and professionals and the hotel lobby is classic NYC. Spacious rooms, great views and wonderful service from the front desk to the maid service and all in between. Highly recommended and will continue to be my only port of call in New York City.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Crazy last min trip to NYC turned out super amazing. All thanks to syeda for checking us in early and giving us an amazing view. We also had a show to catch so worked out perfectly. Thank you Syeda! We will be back very soon with our whole family.

title: Very filthy hotel

title: Great hotel in Times Square!
text: Reception staff is amazing, specially syeda. She was so patient and knowledgeable. We arrived after a long flight we were given a upgrade so we can do early checkin. Wow that type of service in NYC is beyond amazing! Thank you again.

title: Best Holiday I've Had In Years
text:
We have just come home after 7 nights in the Millennium Broadway Times Square Hotel.  Literally a 2 minute walk into time square and central for all attractions.
Reception staff - excellent
Concierge - excellent
Cleaning For Our Room - excellent

We stayed in 3116 - everyone at the hotel was extremely pleasant and helpful and nothing was too much trouble to help.

From other reviews the hotel decor is dated but this did not affect our visit as we also know its in the process of being updated.  Bed was huge.

title: In gratitude. Love this hotel and staff.
text:
My husband and I were back in the city a few weeks ago for a little business and Broadway. 
We keep booking our visits at the Millennium Broadway on 44th because it is so conveniently located to our fabric resources and the theater district. 
In particular, we appreciate the friendly service we have come to expect from the Millennium staff each time we visit. 

The morning after we arrived, our business and Broadway plans fell apart when my husband wasn’t feeling well…then tested positive for COVID. 
Fortunately, I tested negative and was able to go on with our business plans while David quarantined in the room. 

I called down to the front desk to alert the staff about David needing to quarantine and asked to please alert the staff that there was no need to clean our room.

My point of this note is to bring attention and thanks for a generous act of kindness by your front desk staff member Daniel Roberts. 

Daniel knew I was going out of the hotel to attend to business and went out of his way to take the time…on his break, to cross the street to the deli to purchase homemade chicken soup and bread for David 

He then called up to the room to alert my husband that he had placed the soup outside the door of our room 
I was beyond grateful to him for making such a meaningful gesture and just wanted to put that out there. 

So THANK YOU Millennium Broadway!!

Daniel J Forrester. 
David Josef

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
text:
If I could give it 0 stars, I would.

We arrived to our door being wide open and discovered that the latch only worked if the door was slammed closed, and even then it was hit or miss - we found our door standing wide open multiple times during our 3 night stay.
We had 4 people in our burning hot room, so we had a fair amount of half-drank sodas, iced coffees, and water bottles all sitting neatly on the desk, waiting to be dumped and thrown away the morning of our check out. However, due to our car arriving half an hour early, we didn’t have time to take care of the drinks before we left, so they stayed on the desk.

When I arrived back in Texas, I had an email from the hotel claiming that we had taken every one of those drinks, poured them onto both beds, and left the cups on top of the beds, which they claimed ruined the mattresses, so they charged $800 to my card without even speaking to me about their preposterous claims.

I had to get both my credit card company and my attorney involved in order to get my money back. They blatantly lied and attempted to scam me out of $800 and I will tell everyone I know to avoid all Millenium hotels at all costs.

title: Get The New York experience
