title: A good base, clean rooms. Friendly staff but could do with some improvement.
text:
The hotel is a little bit dated. I imagine this hotel was modern and amazing in the 90’s/ 2000’s. That being said, in New York a hotel is purely a base for sleeping and showering. Although it is dated, we found it very clean (I’d rather a clean old hotel than a dirty new/ modern one).  The views from the room we had (50th floor) were amazing, the staff at reception, security, the little gift shop that sells sweets and drinks & the cleaners were all very friendly. The location is ideal for tourists as your 30 second walk from the steps in Times Square & we walked to the empire state building in about 10 minutes (obviously stopping to get pictures along the way as tourists do). 

Pros:

-close to Times Square and other tourists attractions 

-clean/ smells nice.

- a shop inside the hotel that sells snacks and drinks so you don’t need to leave the hotel.

- friendly staff 

- comfy beds & a TV that has Netflix.

- views from the rooms.

Cons:

- as mentioned above a little dated.

- we had a crack on the marble next to the sink & some of the wall paper was peeling off in the bathroom. Which if you didn’t see it or had children who didn’t know that catching your hand in something like this could hurt you , then I imagine this would be an issue for you. 

- the room was very warm and “stuffy” the air con wasn’t great. Which wasn’t too big of an issue for us, with it being January. however be warned if you visit in July. 

- when we arrived there was only one big towel and one towel for hair (for 2 people) This issue wasn’t sorted until 8am the next day. However I consider myself a forgiving person and wouldn’t hold this against the hotel and would still stay at this hotel again.

Feedback for the hotel:

There is a bar/ restaurant that advertises a mix of Thai/ Chinese/ Japanese food in the hotel? Why was this not open/ in use? It would have been great for us when we landed to grab a bite to eat and a beer or it would have come in use for us on our last day as we checked out at 11:00am and pick up wasn’t until 2pm. If this was open we would have happily eat there, drinked there etc, until our pick up. and we wasn’t the only ones on our last day that were just sat around waiting doing nothing etc waiting to the pick up. there is obviously a need for it and a way to make money in future.

I’d also recommend they review the marble in the bathrooms etc to make sure there are no cracks as it could potentially cause an injury. 

Again as mentioned above I would happily stay here again when we revisit New York. Yes there are nicer hotels out there, but if your on a budget and get a good deal then by all means go for it.

title: Amazing hotel in the thick of Times Square!
text:
Pros
- THE VIEW- couldn’t have asked for a better view! Had a view of the Chrysler Building from our room on 50th floor!
- The area was brilliant. Literally a 30 second walk to Times Square. McDonald’s on the corner, Starbucks next to 45 St exit. Couldn’t ask for any more. Short walk to 5th Av etc. 
- Staff were very friendly from the maids to the staff on reception 
- The hotel is clean (most important of all)!
- Beds are huge! Didn’t hear my fiancé snore once 😂
- The rooms have a joint shower/bath, bath isn’t very deep but enough to be able to have a soak after walking around all day!
- Lots of subway stations close by.

Cons
- Hotel was a little dated, but we didn’t really spend much time in the hotel. Literally just a base for sleep 
- Air con in room could be better! We stayed in January and the room was still very hot. We kept the windows open and air con off as the settings just weren’t cool enough. We’re from the UK and NYC did have a warm(ish) January but I imagine that if you’re from a warmer part of the world that you may appreciate the air con not being cold!
- After check out we had to wait a few hours for our transfer to airport. Left our cases at the hotel storage room to get breakfast but couldn’t go far incase we got stuck somewhere and didn’t arrive back. Everyone had the same idea as us, around 25 people waiting in the lobby for transfers, taxis etc. I think the hotel would make a lot of money if the bar were open rather than people sitting on the floor.

Tips
- Ask for room on a high floor
- TIP! We don’t have tipping culture in the UK but it’s essential for workers in the US especially in the hospitality sector
- Get a weekly metro card (think it was around $30). Can get subways to literally everywhere. A 1 mile taxi ride cost us $25 so we’ll worth the money. If you have an iPhone you can use maps which will tell you where/when to get off if you put in your location. Didn’t feel unsafe on the subway once, lots of police around 
- If you do get a taxi use the Curb app! Better than Uber with price increase when it’s busy. 

Excursions
- Buy the sightseeing pass via the app! So many attractions you can get into using this pass including all the main tourist attractions (Rockerfeller, Empire State, Tour Buses, Sightseeing cruises etc.) 
- If you miss out on seeing the Statue of Liberty use the Statten Island Ferry, it’s free and they’re every 30 mins! It goes right past Lady Liberty
- We went to a Knicks game at Maddison Square Garden which was an amazing experience! Foam fingers the lot! 
- The Deli across the road (44 St exit) is brilliant. Don’t go to Virgil’s, I have another review why!

title: ABCD = Above Beyond the Call of Duty

title: DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL
text:
Do not book this hotel. Please please do not book this hotel.
It's fifty dirty, with staff who just don't want to listen to your complaint.
I booked a deluxe room with views of Times Square for 3 ppl (2 adults 1 teen)
The hotel at first seems to have a nice lobby but really it's just walk through from 44th St to 45th St.  There are no other amenities other than your room . 
We were checked into room 4409. The first thing that we noticed was the dirt of the hallways, the marks on the doors. Paint peeling etx. 
The smell in our room was an old musty mouldy smell. The room was covered in dust, the furniture was in a bad state with paint/varnish peeling off every piece. Door to the fridge broken, drawers dirty and dusty inside, crumbs on the small table, dirt on the window sills, dust all over the bed spread. There was a fridge and coffee maker in this room with 2 bottles of water. 
The bathroom was worse, black mould on the walls, dirt, soap scum and rust around the sink, hairs in the sink and bath, paint peeling off the ceiling. 
We went down to the front desk and complained. The staff had little to no interest. They seemed annoyed that we were complaining. They told us they had no rooms with views of Time Square. I booked the room through a booking agent. We all know the rooms they sell are what the hotel tells them they have to sell. I saw photos of these views... who manufactured these photos?
The staff blamed my booking agent for this. 
They changed us to room 4305.
This room certainly smelled better, the furniture was still damaged and broken. There was dust and dirt in the corners of everywhere. There was no coffee maker, no fridge, no water, toiletries had not been replenished, not enough towels for 3 ppl. Only a sheet and very thin beige blanket on the bed with 3 pillows. No extra bedding. The beds were not double beds, smaller, to small for 2 ppl. 
In all neither room was set for 3 guests.
The bathroom was dirty, red stains on the floor,  dirt and grime on the sockets which were also cracked. 
Mould on the walls that had been painted over, mould was coming back through and the wall was peeling aswell as the ceilings. 

Please please do not book this hotel. It is nothing near a 4 star hotel. 
It has no amenities, no information in the room, not even a pen and paper, the simplest things you expect when booking any hotel never mind a 4 star!!
Just a filty dirty hotel with no customer service.

title: Fabulous view + location + accommodating staff, but tired decor and no catering
text:
Totally wowed by the view from my room — having read the reviews I emailed asking if I could possibly have a corner room, which they kindly gave me, and it was well worth it! I had no problem with noise either (though I am used to city sounds at night). The room was a decent size and I could just sit by the window and people-watch for hours. Bed was comfy and large, the decor was a little tired but that doesn't matter all that much to me. Excellent water pressure in the shower, though the bathroom wasn't the cleanest I've been in. A hinge on a cupboard was broken when I arrived, which didn't leave a particularly good impression, though I was pleased to have a fridge, as some reviewers apparently did not.

Check-in and check-out were easy, the staff were very friendly. Lobby a little dark, the elevators quite tired and creaky — the place just needs a bit of an update. A bit disappointed by the lack of catering, with the restaurant closed, no room service, and not even tea or coffee in the rooms, but then again in NYC you don't need it (but would expect it from a 4 star). 

All in all: for my purposes (a solo research/sightseeing trip) its location was absolutely perfect, as was the view, and I'd happily stay here again, but other visitors who are looking for something chic/modern/with more catering options might be less keen.

title: We had the best hotel stay experience in NYC!

title: Awesome staff and location
text:
Stayed at the hotel in December 2022 as it was perfectly located for the majority of Christmas decorations we came to see. Upon arrival the staff was friendly and accommodating…even upon departure at 4 am, they helped me get a cab in Times Square. It scores very high for location and staff friendliness. Safety and cleanliness also score high.
But this hotel needs major renovations and updates. The majority of room was old and worn. Nothing was broken but not what i wanted for the price I paid and the online pictures on the website. In the lobby there is no place to sit down and wait for someone or wait for the rain to stop as was my situation one day. Only two benches. The restaurant in the lobby seemed to be closed. Thank God for Starbucks two doors down and opened at 5:30 am. The hallways too have seen better days. title: Bad start but Happily ever after
text:
This was my third time staying at the Millennium Time Square, but sadly it could have been the last if not for one kind employee, Christopher Allen. 
My husband and I came to New York for a get away trip for the holidays. We booked 3 nights  4 days at the Millennium hotel. The first night we arrived the TV did not work and we notified the Front desk. We called multiple times to the Front desk and they sent several people to look at the one tv. Not one person followed up to see if our tv had been fixed. On the third day, I finally went to the Front desk very upset and received a lovely welcome and apology from Chris, who also had the manager to get involved.   The TV was fixed with in an hour.   
I really appreciate Chris taking time to understand my frustration and take the proper steps to correct the issue. The rest of my time in New York was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel if Chris is at the Front desk or promoted to manager.

title: Déception
text: this is my fourth time staying at the hotel, my experience has always been very good but the last day of my stay was the worst experience because of the porter. it was November 19, a certain Orlando porter had to book a taxi for me, arriving at 4 p.m. no taxi was waiting for me, no note was given. I ask the porter who succeeded him (November 19 at 4 p.m.) he tells me that he has nothing to do for me, that I just have to go out and call a taxi outside on a Saturday in the middle of rush hour!! ! I ask him to help me carry my 5 luggages since I am alone, he refuses and lets me go back and forth outside so as not to help me. between stress and fatigue and the porter who refuses to help me and passes other people well after me, I was very disappointed with the service of this hotel that I really liked. never rely on them for taxis or help !!! I won't be back. this is not the service of a 4 stars Hotel.

title: Nice hotel, Amazing city view.
text: Very nice hotel, cozy room, and amazing city view. Friendly employees and front desk. It’s located in a perfect place, Times Square & Broadway. Walking distance of hundreds of restaurants, theaters, stores, and entertainment. I surely recommend. Two thumbs up.

title: Great location but the room doesn’t match the price tag.
text:
Location was great. Right by time square we could see a little from our window. 

We paid a resort fees when we checked in but no extra amenities. No coffee machine or mini fridge in the room just an ice bucket. Mold in the bathroom and the tube took forever to drain. Beds were rock hard. They have 5 elevators for floors 16-52 but only 3 seemed to be working most of the time so there were long lines to get to your room when others were checking in around 4pm.

title: My Manhattan go to!
text: Amazing last minute stay, so have always counted on the Millennium! The rooms are awesome, specially if you get one of the 6 big suites.  Highly recommend for Manhattan getaway. Daniel and all the staff are always amazing! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Trip advisor
text: This hotel was one of the best hotels I went I could give it a five star the workers were very cind and helpful and the breakfast buffet has lots of verity and everything is perfect and the pool is perfect I had a wonderful time.

title: Terrible- Would NOT recommend. Too Expensive for what you receive! Almost $1400 for 3 nights.
text: The rooms cleanliness was pathetic. Lets start in the bathroom, floor tile and tub tile grout very dirty. Tub floor yellowed. Faucet dirty, safety bar eschucheon not attached to wall. The furniture in the room very old and chipped and scratched, the desk pad had deep grooves in it like something hot might have been laid down on it. Few wallpaper seams coming apart, drapes in the room very hard to close, would bunch up behind the tv. Carpet dirty. Then to top it all off when I went to the front desk to speak with a manager, after ten minutes, the desk clerk came over and told me the manager was too busy right now but if i wanted he could call my room when he had time. To me UNSATISFACTORY! Especially when the manager never calls. When I am paying almost $1400 for 3 nights my Expectations were much higher than what I received. I know you pay for location but come on at least have an acceptable room.

title: Excellent location
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel. The location of the hotel is fabulous; just a few steps away from Times Square, which is exactly what we wanted. It is fair to say that the hotel is dated and the decor is in desperate need of updating; particularly true of our room and the peeling wallpaper near the lifts on the 33rd floor. However the room was comfortable and clean; the bed was lovely. Staff were friendly and helpful, although I did have to ask three times for an extra blanket, which did arrive eventually! If you prefer location over decor then this is the hotel for you.

title: Poor hotel
text: The hotel is very dated and shabby, there was numerous complaints around facilities not working or breaking in the hotel. The location is superb as your a mere 200 steps from the heart of Times Square but that’s the only good point. We also found the reception staff quite rude and abrupt.

title: Millennium hotel Times Square is gross!
text: For location, this hotel is amazing….but, there are other hotels in the locale.  Thats about as much positive I can say.  The hotel front desk was less than charming, the bag drop and claim were slow.  Cleanliness?  Nope!  Out of date and gross!  The bathrooms were disgusting, the rooms dirty, to the point it appears that nothing is cleaned other than the bed made, sink wiped, new towels and that’s about it.  Finger prints all over the walls near switches, gross showers not updated, cracked and dirty tiles around the boarder of the floors, cakes in god knows what.  Would never stay  here again.  So many other options to choose from.  My best advice is ask how old the hotel is and or when they last did renovations.  Oh I’m addition, one hotel bar/restaurant and closed for no reason!

title: The best ever
text: If I could give this hotel more than 5 stars I would. The location was fantastic, the hotel rooms were so comfortable and the staff there were second to none. I have just come home from having the best 5 days I could have wished for. Millennium Broadway Time Square Hotel, YOU ROCK 🤗🤗

title: Best Service
text: This hotel gives the best service in times square. The whole front desk team was very pleasant specially Syeda. She made sure we were able to check in before our show at 2 pm. We will be back soon! Thank you for the hospitality.

title: Staff
text: The staff of this hotel is beyond amazing. They make sure your happy. Hotel is old but staff make it worth every penny. We checked in with syeda and she went above and beyond to make sure we got what we were looking for. Thank you again for making this trip special Syeda.

title: Friendly hotel
text: Check in was a breeze.. thank you Syeda for all your help. We are here for my daughters birthday and we have a great view of Times Square, room is clean and comfortable. Christmas tree is the foyer is gorgeous.

title: Perfect stay on time square
text: Everything was great. Easy in and out stay. Patrick the bellman is wonderful with luggage. Room was clean and an excellent corner view of time square. Will stay here again. Everything is super close to hotel.

title: Needed air conditioning!!
text:
I am in my room sweating as I write this. I cannot sleep when I am hot!  I was told ,after trying to lower the thermostat all night, that the 2 pipe heat/air system had been changed to heat only. It was  suggested I open the window. Since I am on the 41st floor the windows open about 3”.  Well now I am hot and listening to the sound of car horns and sirens all night. I also have to leave the curtains open in order to get the cool air. 
Our room is ok size wise but probably has not  been updated since the 80’s. Neither has the lobby or the hallways. The location is great. The lighting sucks. The people have been responsive and friendly. I guess that should be expected for $2200 for 4 nights.

title: Daniel
text: I would like to say that you are very lucky to have Daniel as employee. He is very professional and cheerful, always spreading postive vibes. Good luck Daniel, hope to see you soon and Happy Holidays!  🗽🤶🎄

title: Hotel centrale ma ……
text: Hotel ha una posizione fantastica ma è vecchio; molto sporco; le stanze sono vecchie i mobili rotti senza maniglie con le cerniere rotte, mobili rotti con porte che si aprono con difficoltà; cassaforte posizionata troppo in alto per verificare cosa posizioni all’interno; il bagno è sporco  la doccia vecchio modello con vasca, non scarica ci sono crepe sulle pareti, finiture inesistenti; il personale praticamente inesistente soprattutto non vede cose che un 5 stelle non dovrebbe nemmeno minimamente trascurare. In Italia sicuramente questo non avviene, se hai 5 stelle rispetti le linee dettate per averle e per giustificare minimamente il prezzo

title: A great time in a great location
text:
We had a great vacation at the Millennium. After reading reviews I was a little concerned and we were pleasantly surprised that it exceeded our expectations. 

We want for my son's golden birthday trip which includes Broadway plays and the Macy's Day Parade. 

The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas. We had read about Daniel and he was fun and went above and beyond - even giving my son a birthday gift. 

Then elevators were super quick and we never waited long. We loved the fact that you needed a key card to access. 

Our room was clean and comfortable. The desk drawer needed a minor repair as well as a broken threshold to the bathroom but we considered that very minor. The bathroom was large and had a ton of counter space. 

Our room was on the 43rd floor and had unbelievable views - we could see the Times Square Ball, Chrysler building etc.

Then location was perfect!! Right at Times Square. We walked out the 45th street exit to the Museum of Broadway across the street, Starbucks and McDonalds. Put them 44th St entrance was O'Donoghues and Vigils restaurants which we enjoyed. Two blocks from Bryant Park and the Winter Village. A few blocks the other ways to Rockefeller Center. 

Our room was a little hot but not so much that we even called the front desk. 

The staff was wonderful. They checked our bags on arrival until our room was ready and held them the day of departure until time for us to leave for the airport. 

The half block off Times Square was super convenient. And half block from the Macy's parade route was wonderful!

A fridge or coffee maker would be nice but even so, we would absolutely stay again.

title: Great  customer service
text:
We arrived Monday 28th November, quick efficient check in.Unfortunately I left my phone in the taxi,Orlando the door man was fantastic  not only did he contact  the taxi company  for me on his own phone he gave me it so I could  speak to them while he helped other guests. Nothing  was too much trouble  for him he us a credit to your hotel.P.S. the taxi driver returned  my phone the next morning .Thank you so much made a very stressful  day so much easier. 

Jon Smith 

Taunton 
Somerset 
England

title: Super clean
text: The room was great! Super great access to Times Square and everything around! Phenomenal service and easy access to plenty of restaurants and things to do, great view and they supplied 2 bottles of water.

title: Great experience
text: Great room with a great view! Super nice staff. Very friendly and super easy check in. This was my first time in New York and this place definitely made my stay easy and enjoyable. Would definitely recommend!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: I had a wonderful stay at the Millennium. All the staff were kind and helpful with suggestions of where to eat and great attractions within walking distance. Several theatres were a short walk away. The location was great. The room was clean and spacious. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Tres Bonne surprise
text:
Erreutr lors de la reservation . Je me suis trompé entre M social times square et Millenium Hotel Broadway qui font parti de la meme chaine. Habitue du premier depuis longtemsn, quand c'etait encore un Novotel, le Millenium hotel Broadway Times Square a uen lmocalisation averc une  vue sur times square exceptionnelle. 
Il merite effectivement d'etre remis à niveau, mais l'accueil est tres agreable que ce soit pour le check in, ou pour les bagages, ce qui  change du Msocial (pour les bagages)
Chambre correct avec une bonne literie. 
Magnifique vue sur l'horloge du Times .
Une petite renovation et ce sera  parfait.

title: Daniel and and his butterflies 🦋
text: Daniel at the front desk is the absolute BOMB—so friendly and welcoming….thank you Daniel and your beautiful butterflies! Room is good location as well. What a great way to celebrate our cousin’s special birthday💖

title: Dated and noisy room needing a refurb
text:
One thing is certain - the location of this hotel is brilliant. Just a stones throw from Times Square and surrounded by bars and restaurants it’s certainly in the thick of the action! No doubt that’s some cause of the high nightly rates when I stayed but it’s a shame the rooms didn’t match the same great aspects.

Checking in late one evening had a little wait but the single member of staff working was friendly enough and the actual process fairly slick. It’s a large lobby area for an imposing first impression and there’s a number of fast lifts serving each of the floors. My room was a standard affair on the 36th floor.

It certainly struck as feeling pretty dated. The lighting was really dim, relying on only a desk and floor lamp and none of these, including the bathroom lights could be controlled from the bed, so navigating at night was interesting. There was a charging socket on the bedside lamp, but other than that no obvious electric sockets in convenient places throughout the room. There was no mini bar nor kettle / drink facilities, and the doors to a lot of the cupboards were broken, which just added to the tatty and dated feel.

The bathroom was pretty spacious and had loads of storage space around the sink. Again it felt in desperate need of a refurb and the bath was pretty dirty. The shower was powerful but took some time to get the temperature as needed and the towels were adequate.

A couple of very good things were the air-conditioning, which worked well without being overly noisy, and the iron which was a delight to use. Perhaps the biggest negative with the room though - the noise from outside! Throughout the night the wail of sirens, car horns, people etc was so loud in the room it made for a very poor nights sleep. When making a phone call the other person commented they thought I was actually outside given the sirens, and this was 36 floors up.

If you’re wanting to stay in such a prime location then it should be on a shortlist, but the quality of the room didn’t justify the price being charged and I didn’t leave wanting to return again.

title: Double charged
text: Upon arrival, I checked in and they swiped my card. Then told me to come back in an hour for access to the room. My luggage was put in storage. When I returned they said my booking was canceled and had to reswipe my card and they confirmed it's not duplicated. I returned home only to find a double charge which they refused to re credit. ... been over 2 months

title: Daniel is the best!
text: Daniel, who checked us in at the front desk, was particularly helpful and delightful. He gave us an excellent restaurant recommendation and was so kind and funny. His expertise and easy manner were appreciated.

title: If you are into dumps, this place is for you.
text: The rooms (and I was in two) are nothing like is shown on the internet.  They are very old, and not updated.  The rooms are sub-standard.  Actually, falling apart.  There is no restaurant to even grab a quick cup of coffee.  Do not fall for the Covid excuse either.  Drapes falling off the rod, mold in the bathroom, cuts on the carpets, lights that do not work on and on.  On a positive note, if any, the staff is very nice, and they all know they are working in a dump, but they need an income.  The other positive note is that the location to Broadway is very good.  Even their upgrade on the 51st floor is deplorable.

title: Desilusion!
text:
Fue mi segunda estadia en el hotel y pude corroborar que todo esta bien hasta que tenes algun problema. En esta segunda estadia, surgieron varios.
En primer lugar la bañadera tapada, tardaron dos dias en arreglarlo, lo mismo que la caja fuerte.
Luego llegamos una noche y la bateria de la cerradura de la puerta no funcionaba. La cambiaron y cuando entramos el cuarto no estaba hecho... despues de todo un dia afuera no teniamos las camas hechas ni el baño limpio ni toallas.
Al otro dia tuvimos que pedir que nos aspiraran la alfombra, porque se ve que no es un punto en la limpieza diaria
Luego nos volvimos a quedar encerrados por la bateria de la erradura, esta vez tuvimos que cambiar de habitacion. 
Por todo esto no nos hicieron ninguna atencion
El dia del check out exigi aunque sea un descuento. Me dijeron que iban a ser 103 dolares, pero a mi tarjeta solo llegaron 60.
Fui con mi hija de 13 y mis padres de 69 y 78 años. El hotel es comodo por la ubicacion y el tamaño de las habitaciones, pero esta viejito y le falta atencion al cliente.

title: Discreto
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 5 notti. Ha una posizione geografica perfetta. Dalla nostra camera c'era un'incredibile visuale su Time Square. Ascensori rapidissimi. Purtroppo la nostra stanza aveva qualcosa di rotto, dovuto all'usura del tempo. Pulizia nella media. Personale gentile e disponibile.

title: Grym utsikt från rummet!
text:
Trevligt och fräscht hotell några meter från Times Square. Vi bodde på våning 45 men det fanns många hissar så blev aldrig någon lång väntan. Rummet hade fönster från golv till tak och vi såg både Chrysler building och Times squares klocka från rummet. 
Litet gym men med allt man behövde fanns att nyttja utan extra kostnad. 
Ganska dyrt, men en upplevelse att ha så fin utsikt.

title: Renavationsbedürftig und SEHR ringhörig
text:
Wir sind grosse Fans der Millenium Kette, waren aber von diesem Hotel SEHR enttäuscht, da dieses Hotel in keinem Vergleich zu anderen Hotel dieser Kette steht. Unser Zimmer lag direkt neben dem Aufzug und wir hörten die ganze Nacht die Bewegungen der Kabel und des Aufzugs an sich,  jede Bewegung auf dem Gang und dem Nachbarzimmer. Die Teppiche sind schmutzig und haben Flecken, im Badezimmer ist teilweise Schimmel vorhanden. Die Armaturen im Badezimmer sind wackelig, Wasser aus der Dusche kommt schon fast keins mehr. Fenster waren ebenfalls sehr dreckig.
Schlimmer war dann die Abrechnung, trotz Vorauszahlung fand sich auf meiner Kreditkarte am Ende eine Belastung fast 500 USD (zusätzlich zur Facility Fee von USD 34 pro Nacht). Trotz mehrerer Mails mit Bitte um Receipt und Erklärung bisher keine Reaktion vom Hotel, sowas finde ich absolut traurig für so ein Hotel!

title: Perfect Location and Great Hotel Team
text: The Millennium is perfectly located midway along W46th St at Broadway, literally a few minutes walk from Times Square and in the heart of New York. Our room on arrival fell a little short of expectations in terms of cleanliness and decor but upon broaching this at reception we were quickly relocated to a much better suite with incredible views of Times Square and the Chrysler Building. Full marks to the excellent, helpful and professional reception and door team here, with particular praise to the outstanding Daniel who was a great character - larger than life and went out of his way to ensure we had the best possible experience.  Our 11 year old son took great delight in Daniel’s various illuminated beard decorations and we felt very much like valued guests. Highly recommend.

title: Love NYC
text: Just returned from 4 nites on millenium broadway.yes hotel bit dated n run down but couldnt fault our stay here.travelled as a group of ten friends in three rooms.check in quick.had room 2117 on 21st floor.5 lifts.all quick.needed room key to go up.two double beds tv iron ironing board safe and hairdryer.rooms cleaned everyday and fresh towels.no fridge or tea n coffee making.staff friendly pleasant and helpful.no restaurant.we arent complainers and it was more than adequate for us.near to times square and other attractions.tip get the subway to ferry terminal six dollars there and back.get free statten island ferry to pass statue of liberty.also though we enjoyed bike ride in central park with great guide.make sure u haggle on price as we were charged $300 dollars for 4 of us.friends charged $240 for six.Times square much better first thing in morn when quieter

title: New york city
text: Amazing experience! Love it clean and in a very convenient location, totally will recommend it to anyone, great experience with family and friends, hope you like it as much as I do. Times Square near by

title: Great Location! Great Staff! Great hotel for traveling with a wheelchair!
text: I was travelling with my son who uses a power wheelchair to get around. The staff was kind, courteous and very helpful! The accessible room was perfect for a wheelchair. The bathroom was a great size! The elevators were also a great size! The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. We were a super short walk away from everything and I never felt unsafe. Great hotel with a great location and a wonderful staff! A special shout out to Erin for her kindness and for the man with the beard for running after us to tell us we were walking the wrong way! Thank you!!!

title: Très bien!
text:
Très bon hôtel, notre chambre était spacieuse, la literie confortable. Ménage bien fait tout les jours. De plus, l'hôtel est bien situé, tout près de time square.
Nous avions la chance d'avoir vue sur la ville au 43 ème étage, super belle vue!

title: Good hotel for city break - recommended
text:
Stayed for 4 nights - 24th floor room clean and fairly standard - maybe the bathroom could do with a decorative freshen up otherwise all good. Maid cleaned to a good standard daily so thank you ! Front desk helpful and security in hotel by lifts which is key card access to use - concierge polite and helpful too. Top view sightseeing tickets worth a visit they will give u 3 days for the price of two if u ask and loads of use inc a harbour sunset trip around Manhattan and Statue of Liberty it’s included and goes from Pier 36 downtown and you book a time after you have bought your tickets.

Opposite hotel is a great Irish bar with friendly service and good food called O’Donoghues and the other side of hotel 43rd or 45th street a fab Italian called Tony’s ! Read online reviews - don’t order starters as the mains are ordered only for 2 people but you could feed 8 with the portion but delicious !! 

Would recommend hotel although like everywhere when in Time Square keep your wits about you as gets very very busy especially evenings !

title: Dirtiest hotel I have ever visited
text:
How this hotel operates is beyond me 
We checked 8 rooms and all were filthy, dated and many with broken furniture
Picture frames all coated in dust
Lampshades with stains on
Drawers with hairs in
One smelt fishy 
Two smelt musty
Cracked vanity around the sink 
Wardrobe doors missing
Carpet ages that look
Like they have not seen a hoover in years

title: Took my 2023 senior daughter to see a couple musicals and expierence the sights
text: Great hotel… responsive and helpful staff! I won’t stay anywhere else! It’s right off Times Square, so for first time NYC visitors it’s perfect - you’re a 30 second walk from all the action. Right in the theater district… CLEAN!!!

title: Stayed on 10/25/22
text: Please go see Daniel the Beard Guy at the front desk. He decorates his beard, matches his eyeglasses to the decor color(s) and for Halloween, he was truly a vision! At the concierge desk, there were three assistants who also were full of smiles and help. Gregory's coffee house one block away has lots of good options if you want to work from a cafe setting.  The hotel is in a great location! Jack's Wife Freda restaurant in West Village was delicious and the servers could not have been more kind and helpful- highly recommend it!

title: First trip to NY
text:
Hotel in great area but let down by rooms ! Bathrooms need updating carpets warn. Unfortunately we could hear the elevator noise up and down .would not use this hotel again. Staff at check in desk unprofessional and unpleasant!

Try somewhere else

title: Friends visit to NYC
text: Daniel at check is amazing after a long flight we were informed by our agent we were being moved from ROW to the Millennium. Daniel was lovely and made the whole check in a pleasure he did his best to get us two rooms close to each other even though the hotel was full. We were placed on the 34th floor with a view of Times Square, thought it might be noisy but was fine. Room was clean and comfortable, just what we needed to relax in after long days of sight seeing. Would recommend they have either kettle or coffee machine in the rooms but would definitely return.

title: runned down
text: good location, clean soft bedding, big bed, big room, lovely pictures on your site, however nothing to to with reality, carpet in the room seen better days, smells, dirty with tons of questionable stains, very runned down everything,,in a desperate need of update especially fot kind of money u charge,

title: Never Again
text:
I just finished a 5 night stay at this hotel and it is in the right place but It's time has past. 
The lobby looks good but the room was very dated to the point it made the stay uncomfortable but my biggest complaint is the hotel has not reopened the bar of restaurant and there is not even any form of coffee service. None in the room and none at any location in the hotel and the staff directs you to Starbucks down the street. They charge a daily faciity fee but there is not service associated and I found the entire stay a rip off.

title:
Millennium Hotel Times Square  New York 
Don't have a restaurant/bar they closed them down 2 years ago
text:
I booked here for my friend  and I to celebrate  her 60th birthday. We arrived Saturday 15th October to Wednesday 19th October .The hotel had a fabulous restaurant and bar area on line but when we arrived we were Informed  that the bar and restaurant  have been closed for 2 years so there's no facilities on site the receptionist started to laugh when she informed us of this as i had asked about booking in for dinner . Even our travel agent didn't  know they had closed their restaurant  etc as its still advertised  on their website. 
We were 30 floors up and the rooms phones didn't  work there was no tea / coffee making facilities in the room .
For a 4 star hotel this is very disappointing. 
We went back to reception to inform them their phones don't work and could we please  have a kettle for the room .
We got a kettle and paper cups but our phones never got fixed . You couldn't  use the paper cups twice as they leaked .we ended up buying proper cups from a local shop .
Due to areas being closed up there is only two seats to sit on in their lobby area people had to stand about when waiting on their taxis. 
There is one person who was amazing  and that was the door man Mark he was very helpful  he went over and above his role. 
Our private  taxi had not turned up and they wouldn't  answer  my phone call but Mark phoned them from his phone and they answered thankyou to Mark we got to the airport .
But please  before you book The Millennium Hotel Times Square  New York be warned there is no restaurant on site but they still advertise it on line .
I will not be booking in here again the RIU PLAZA Hotel Times Square New York is amazing I wish I had booked there again 😫 😢 😩

title: 3 stelle solo per la posizione
text:
Ho soggiornato presso questo hotel 11 notti insieme alla mia famiglia nel mese di settembre.

Dò 3 stelle solo ed esclusivamente per la posizione.
Si raggiunge infatti da qui Time Square in 30 secondi a piedi😃

Ma per il resto….
Camere vecchissime che vengono „pulite“ tutti i giorni ma trovi poi nel bagno ancora i capelli per terra del giorno prima.
Il pavimento del bagno in 11 giorni non é mai stato lavato!!!
E dubito che i servizi igienici venissero davvero puliti.

Per quel che ho pagato é assurdo!!!
É vero che siamo a Manhattan, con una posizione spettacolare…. ma non per questo bisogna accettare che un albergo di 4 stelle non sia in grado di fornire camere pulite tutti i giorni

title: Miss Domenica Bastidas
text: It was a good experience, with good location and gentle staff. We had some troubles when we arrived because the hotel gave us the wrong room, but they gave us a solution, although it took them a lot of time. That was the only inconvenient that we had, after that, everything was good.

title: Excellent location, great staff
text: The location is excellent. Less than 1/2 a block from 7th/Broadway in Times Square. Walking distance to theaters, comedy clubs, Rockefeller Center, etc. Erica, the concierge, was excellent and so was the rest of the staff. The rooms were clean. No mini-fridges. They safely stored our luggage before check-in and after check out. The restaurant in the hotel is closed at this time. Erica recommended the Big Bus tour which was a great suggestion for a way to get around the city and see all of the sites. I would stay again.

title: Plein Centre
text: Un tres bon hotel aux chambres propres et salle de bain confortables .Extrememnt bien situé a moins de 2 mn de TIMES SQUARE  .  Un seul bemol  le pt dej est servi le matin dans un sac papier à consommer dans sa chambre avec des produits sous vide ou emballés . Dommage .

title: THE PICTURES LOOK NOTHING LIKE THE ROOMS
text: Absolutely the worst hotel experience we have ever had.  The hotel was old, with threadbare carpet in places, small rooms, cheap sheets and uncomfortable pillows.  Very noisy.  Couldn't control the temperature in the room.  And, to add insult to injury, they added a charge onto our credit card of $241 US for the "use of wi fi, the phone, and the fitness room".  Are you kidding me????

title: Disappointed
text:
We’ve stayed at the Millenium in the past.  The location can’t be beat, and although the rooms were small, they were clean, staff was great.   This time was different.

Rooms are shabby, no amenities in the room, staff didn’t seem to care.  The restaurant was not open and when we asked for recommendations, they pointed out the door and said there’s all kinds.  

We won’t be back.

title: Fantastic customer service
text: I travel a lot, and enjoy an efficient, smooth check in, a clean spacious room with comfortable bed, and decent amenities. I also like to meet the front desk team, but often it is an impersonal or formal interaction. This had all of the standards of a good hotel, but what truly stood out was the friendliness, professionalism and kindness of the staff. In particular, Hector and Monique made my short stay so enjoyable. I witnessed their treatment of all guests with the same pleasant, helpful and authentically caring manner. They recommended places to eat, ways to save on transport, and more. The day I left, Bunny and Kush were introduced to me, and were just as kind and polite. Testament to a great team, I do hope to return soon and this hotel will be my first choice.

title: Regular visitor
text: I stay in this hotel several times a month for work. Daniel, at the front desk, has always been an amazing face of the business and a big part of the reason I continue to come back to this specific hotel.

title: Friendly but lacking
text: The staff was Friendly and helpful especially the bellman.parking garage across tee street very convenient. Tha rooms were dated lacking  fridge few outlets bathroom exhaust fan.view was excellent  we were on the 51 floor would  consider staying there again

title: Facility fee £105.12 for 3 nights
text:
Absolutely disgusted to see this charge on my credit card after spending 3 nights here with my partner.  Nobody at the hotel mentioned this charge to me - in fact when they requested a credit card at check in for a room which had already been paid for, they advised the credit card was in case we used the restaurant or bar facilities.  

If this is an ethical, standard charge being made by the hotel why are they not prepared to mention it to you or provide an invoice for it at check out.  Email address was provided to them so surely it should be standard practice to immediately email a receipt after you check out covering these charges.

title: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!
text: This place looked nothing like it does in photos. Worst room I’ve ever stayed. We asked for a different room and one that possibly has a fridge since NY is so expensive, the guy told us to come down and he will get us another room.. we load all of our stuff, go down 34 flights for them to tell us this is all they had. Not friendly, and dirty. Save your money honestly.

title: Amazing Location
text: Have been staying here for many years. Monique greeted us so warmly after a 3 year absence. You can’t beat the location, it’s convenient to everything we come to NYC for. The staff are top notch, friendly and helpful. For me and my orthopedic issues- I really, really appreciate how easy it is to come in the door. Go directly to the elevator and right to the room! It really couldn’t be easier. Also there is always a staff person in the lobby, so We feel very safe!! Honestly I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel!!

title: Great Place
text: Once we discovered the Millennium Premier, we were hooked! We are repeat guests. It is very clean and the location is perfect. Everyone from the front desk, bell staff, housekeeping and dining staff is always warm and welcoming. It is a special feeling to be remembered at checkin. Thanks to Monique for all of her assistance and kindness to make our stay a pleasant experience from the start. Highly recommended.

title: Erica was fantastic
text:
We stayed at the Millenium Hotel for ten days to mark my 30th Birthday. We found the hotel to be very busy at check in time. When we got to our room we found it to be dated, but clean with fresh bedding and hot water coming out the shower. Although we didnt get quite a view from our window of Times Square, I do think that the hotel location is incredible and you really do feel like a tourist here. 

We found Erica at concierge to be exceptionally helpful she made our stay very enjoyable. She was friendly, helpful and gave us the best advice. We trusted her completely with organising our day trip to Washington. She really made our stay enjoyable. 

One thing that I will say is that the hotel offers complementary bottles of water, and you can request a fridge in your room. Make sure you do this- water is expensive in Times Square. The hotel were happy to hand any additional shampoos and conditioners as and when needed. The down side of this hotel is that you need your hotel key to operate the lifts, which is a little annoying. 

All in all, a good stay, and Erica was fantastic!!!

title: What a Refreshing Start to our Vacation - You Have to Meet Daniel at the Front Desk!
text: After a long day of travel to New York City, we were completely exhausted as we arrived at our hotel, the Millennium Hotel Broadway Times Square.  We were completely revived when we met Daniel, the person at the front desk who checked us into our hotel accommodations.  Daniel was dressed very professionally, but had accents in bright colors and had his beard decorated with adorable butterfly clips to add to his festive attire.  We couldn't help but smile and feel very welcome by this individual.  Not only was he fun and festive, he was also very friendly and welcoming.  We actually looked forward to seeing him each day we were there because he had a new "theme" each day.  I applaud the Millennium Hotel Broadway Times Square for allowing their employees to express themselves and be who they truly are!  You can tell he loves his job, and that the hotel respects their employees.  We will definitely stay at the Millennium on all future stays to NYC!

title: Maravillosa Experiencia
text:
Fui con mi esposo y mis 2 niños de 11 y 13 años nos quedamos en una habitación con vista a la ciudad espectacular, la habitación es amplia, nos hicieron la limpieza diaria y nos cambiaron las toallas todos los días, las camas son cómodas, el baño amplio y todo funcionaba perfectamente 
La ubicación del hotel es perfecta, estás en el centro de todo y de las estaciones del metro 
La atención del personal es muy buena,
Solo agregaría q colocaran neveritas en las habitaciones 
Me quedaría mil veces en este hotel se los recomiendo

title: Wonder employees.  Filthy dirty worn out hotel.
text:
The staff is excellent.  Front desk folks are friendly and helpful.  My housekeeper was a seriously a delight.  Very cheerful and kind.  The shower water pressure is awesome.  My room did not smell musty. (Which is huge for an NYC hotel)   My shower was free of mold.  
Everything else about this hotel is horrible.  It is nasty dirty.  Old and worn out  like 1982.  I am sure back 40 years ago this place was nice.  But it is now dirty and worn out like a old used up truck stop.  Maybe worse.  I was here for business and had no choice.  I will never stay there again.  Who ever owns that place should be ashamed to run such a filthy nasty hotel and take peoples hard earned money. Go elsewhere.  

All my compliments about the staff are genuine.  They are very kind and helpful people.

title: Stay away from this hotel!!!!
text:
este hotel no respeta las reservaciones, mejor busquen otro hotel, el pasado 09 de septiembre tenía una reservación qu habia hecho hace 6 meses en ete hotel y de la nada cuando llegue la reservación habia sido cancelada por el hotel, sin darme una explicación lógica o mandarme un correo antes cancelaron la reservación y no 
hicieron nada para ayudarme, el gerente y el personal se portaron muy mal eduacados y no les importo que me quedara sin hotel aún cuando tenia una reservación.

ya no había disponibilidad en ese hotel, ni en 
ninguno que estuviera cerca a este y obviamente las tarifas habían aumentando, 
 tuve que hablar a expedia y gracias a ellos después de 3 horas pudieron conseguirme otro hotel.

this hotel does not respect reservations, better look for another hotel, last september 09 i had a reservation that i had made 6 months ago in this hotel and out of nothing when i arrived the reservation had been canceled by the hotel, without giving me a logical or explanation send me an email before they canceled the reservation and they did nothing to help me, the manager and the staff behaved very badly and they did not care that i stayed without a hotel even though i had a reservation.

there was no longer availability in that hotel, nor in any that was close to this hotel and obviously the rates had increased,

 i had to talk to expedia and thanks to them after 3 hours they could get me another hotel.

title: Gross
text: They are totally living when they say it a 4 star hotel it’s like more like 2 star. The hotel room was beyond nasty I had to change rooms 3 time it was beyond. Find another hotel to stay at and save your money. The into thing I would say they did clean the room everyday and brought fresh towels but that dose not make up for the grooms tub and the burn marks on the furniture looked like crack den.

title: Bogus Upgrades and Believe the Bad Reviews
text: We received an offer to upgrade to a king suite with 580 sq ft.  Looked at their website and found their king suite with 580 sq ft has a sleeper sofa in the living room. Since we are traveling with kids this was perfect.  Paid the extra for the upgrade for both rooms and when we checked in no sleeper sofas.  Andrew the night manager said they haven’t updated their website and there are no rooms with sleeper sofas.  Manager doesn’t want to give us a refund for the bogus upgrade and said he won’t give us a refund if we change hotels. We checked in at midnight and couldn’t make a change tonight.  Manager said if we waited until tomorrow morning to check out he’d charge us for another night. What??????!!  Keep your money and go to a hotel that values their guests and doesn’t offer bogus upgrades and unprofessional managers.

title: Good stay thanks!!
text: Had a nice comfy one day stay. good location. helpful staff! it was fun thank you so much for great experience love the view and service.. i will definately come back again may be next year  tha k yoi so much

title: Dated hotel rooms in need of update. Nice location and staff.
text:
Great location but hotel rooms are definitely weathered and in need of some maintenance. 

The wallpaper was stained with something unrecognizable in the bedroom, peeling in the bathroom, and the bathroom tile grout was moldy. The carpet was very dated and unappealing, and the water pressure in the bathroom sink and shower were excessively high and the tub filled up while showering. 

The staff was very nice and the AC in the room worked well to keep the temp comfortable.

title: Great location but not a great room
text: We stayed two nights and the rooms look nothing like the pictures on the website.  At least ours didn't.  Very small, very outdated.  We had a view (a tiny one) of the ball drop but other than that nothing great at all.  The only good thing is the location, which is I guess what you pay for.

title: Excellent hôtel
text:
Séjour de 5 nuits dans cet hôtel. 
Hall grandiose, Magnifique, propre, bonne literie malgré la taille 120 cm
Personnel très sympathique, accueillant. Très bien situé à Times Square, pas bruyant.
Nous reviendrons.

title: Filthy Hotel
text:
Pros: Friendly doormen. Decent city views. 

Cons: Everything else about this hotel. 

Our stay at Millennium Hotel Broadway Times Square hit way below expectations. The pictures do not capture just how run down this property is. Our first room smelled horrible and the bathroom had not been clean. There were multiple dirt stains around  and in the bath tub. We called the front desk and they swiftly offered to do a complimentary upgrade to a larger room they had available. We retrieved our new keys and arrive to the second room (Room 4804). While this room was larger, it was just as filthy and putrid. Multiple carpet stains, mildew on the bathroom floor and walls, a peeling toilet seat, and random ants on the desk and chair,  We unfortunately decided to make due since we had driven over 10 hours and it was too late to cancel without penalty. 

Despite paying for the stay at the time of booking, upon arrival we were told we needed to pay an addition $70 for "hotel amenities and fees." We paid. However, at check-out, we were hit with THE SAME $70 charge for "hotel amenities and fees." Despite being confused, we paid the charge and left. At that point, we just wanted to be done with the hotel. 

We enjoyed our trip to NY, but WlLL NEVER stay here again.

title: horrible
text: Our bathroom was completely nasty, we paid almost 400 and it look as if we were in a fancy motel 6…. The bed was HARD HARD. I will never stay here again. The floor had stains and I had to call down for a comforter because the bed only had sheets….

title: Vintage ma efficiente e personale eccezionale
text: Sicuramente vintage. Struttura anni 80, ma pulita camere spaziose ottimo letto , cuscineria e bagno. La posizione è eccezionale a due passi da Broadway e Time Square, nonché alla Fifthy Avenue, Rockfeller Center, Gran Central . Personale meraviglioso reception attivissima con uno speciale ringraziamento alla cortesissima Erin e allo speciale receptionista più simpatico di New York. Perfetta l’organizzazione e gli ascensori all’avanguardia . Consigliatissimo

title: Mitigée
text:
L'hotel est vraiment bien situé + nettoyage quotidien
Mais l'intérieur des chambres est vétuste et sombre, il faut refaire la déco, ajouter une salle de restauration pour le petit déjeuner.
Je recommande pour un séjour court

title: E213
text:
Md samsuddin khan and Kiran was very helpful and polite and was doing his job at the highest level 
I'm very happy with his service 
He was very polite and respectful and responsible for his job,and he is great in what he is doing

title: Excellent Stay! Daniel was AWESOME!
text: I have stayed at many hotels in New York, and I am extremely picky. I have to say our stay at the millennium was nothing short of amazing. Daniel checked us in and he was extremely attentive and so helpful! When finding out it was my boys first time in NYC he got us the best room possible. He went above and beyond on everything. The concierge was also very helpful every time I had a question on where to go they exceeded expectations on help. Yes if you do not appreciate history of a hotel this one is not for you, especially if you want brand new things! The hotel itself is due for a renovation next year I was told but is very nice given the age. Our room was extremely comfortable and great view ! 5201 was our room number.

title: Cozy and central location
text: The hotel is a great deal for its prices and is walking distance to all of the main sights except for maybe the Statue of Liberty. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly. Thanks Syed for taking care of my boyfriend and I while we’re here celebrating our 3 year anniversary, cheers

title: Daniel
text: He's a very funny and kind gentleman who offered us an upgrade to a suite without us even asking! The hotel itself is at a prime location and the amenities were great. I'm even considering extending our stay since the location is pretty close to food, shows and everything else New York

title: Staff are the stars!
text:
After a long trip from Australia, we arrived at the hotel in the middle of the night and were greeted by very welcoming staff who quickly got us to our room. Unfortunately our toilet was running non stop but after a call to front desk and a prompt visit from maintenance, we happily crawled into our comfy bed.
For the next four days we were extremely well looked after, especially by Thomas and Gloria who were amazing, giving us some great tips on where to shop, eat and drink, as well as info on all the best sights to see in NYC. 
The room was a little tired (although the bed was comfy which is super important), but the location is superb with the proximity to Times Square and Broadway!

title: Great place
text: Hotel was great. Syed was the best front desk host I’ve ever had. Great guy!  Room was perfect. Clean, quiet and comfy. Price was right too. If you get a chance to stay here I would most definitely recommend and will be back the next time I am in New York.

title: Lack of room ammenities
text: Location is right near Times Square and close to necessities, hotel is clean and welcoming, however the room lacked a refrigerator, lamps did not work and there were no working plugs for the bath tub or the bathroom sink.

title: Not Worth the money
text: The staff was friendly but the hotel is in dire need of renovations.  Carpet in room was old and dirty, rust on sink/taps, wallpaper fraying, dust caked on vents, no fridge in room etc… not worth the money.  Stay in Brooklyn or Financial district and take the subway.

title: Worst experience ever
text:
I check in at 8pm in the hotel. They allocate me room around 10pm. I booked for Superior 2 Doubles room. They allotted me with deluxe double bed  room.

They gave me other option to cancel the booking without any patently. This is the worst option ever. I traveled more than 6 hours and reach at the hotel. They took another 2 hours to allot me a room.

They allotted me totally different room which i booked online. They said they dont have any room which called Superior 2 Doubles room. Which surprised me. I showed them everything my booking confirmation, their website room pictures etc.

They said they are happy to cancel the booking without any penalty if i dont like hotel.

This was one of the worst experience i ever had.

title: Great location with a view of the Times Square
text: The rooms are spacious. Rooms on the higher floor provide great views of the Times Square. Saeeda at the front desk was very amiable and assisted us very nicely. This was my 2nd visit here and I always choose this hotel because of its location.

title: Worst hotel experience ive ever had!!!
text: I would give this a 0 star if i could! I could not sleep at all during my 4 day visit, as the AC was broken during a heat wave! Made 4 phone calls to the front desk, and nothing was done to rectify it

title: Total Dump
text: This place was 1200 dollars for 3 nights. It was so gross I could not wait to get out every day I was there.  The hotel down graded my king suite on check in .  My last day I ask for the room I had paid for.  They switched me and it was dirtier.  Such a nasty  hotel.  Avoid at all costs.  Tines square is nothing but  an over priced tourist trap.  The hotel is beyond filthy.

title: great location
text:
You get what you pay for here . The hotel needs a refurb nut the rooms are adequate and clean. The position is perfect for theatreland .
Daniel at the front desk is a star .He made our trip memorable by his efficiency and sense of fun

title: Careful while booking specially via Expedia
text:
Overall: Avoid the hotel if you can. 

Good Highlights:
- Location is good
- Upgrades available if you ask.

The bad:
- AC does not work on higher floors and they will tell you it is what it is
- You will be stuck if you booked via Expedia as they don't stand behind the booking.

Brief:
Hotel is in it's end days as their legacy based AC system does not work on higher floors. If you are ok with that then sure it is a great location in heart of Manhattan. We got a room on 20 ish floor and the room reminded me of a asylum setup with a spooky crib and walls with water marks. I immediately asked for an upgrade which they provided and was a much better room but had ac problems. We reported it 3 times and they couldnt fix it. Their service guy told us it is what it is. Ended up with a tower fan and 75 plus temperature during day time with 2 kids. Kids will wake up in the middle of the night crying because they are sweaty. Took it up with Expedia and all they could do is provide a refund for the remainder nights and leave us in the middle of our trip with no accomodation. It was even horrible to hear how front desk lied to Expedia that they did not receive any ticket from us to fix the issue. They had the audacity to charge reset fee as well. Their representative called us and threw a horrible attitude. Told me they can refund the resort fee is that makes me feel better. Her Attitude sucked. She was talking as if she is doing me a favor. 
Hotel probably would have earned 5 stars from me but this ordeal was a different level. Maybe because of pandemic hotel staff forgot how to treat customers and be a good host. 

Avoid them if you can. You have better choices like Westin or Marriott right around the corner if you can afford it.

Expedia is another clown company. Avoid them like a plague. You will be out of luck if you run into these issues. Manager mentioned to Expedia that they could have changed the room if I would have asked. Well we did and no one bothered to respond on the ask. And they lied to expedia that I did not reach out.

title: Needs Reno and service upgrade
text: This hotel was my go-to for New York trips for the last decade. Sadly, no more. The rooms are dingy and in sore need of redecoration; carpets soiled, wallpaper peeling off at seams; the one blanket was paper thin (no bedspread) and very old. There were hairs in the bathtub  and on the wall behind the bathroom door(not cleaned by staff until I complained after day 2). There were no glasses in the room - not even plastic; I asked for some to be delivered, and asked the staff member if this was normal - he said that sometimes there are glasses in the rooms and sometimes not, whatever that means. The front desk and lobby staff were very nice and helpful, and the location is great, but once you leave the lobby it’s dingy and worn. I asked a worker if the hotel was under new management, and indeed it is. For what they are charging, they need to renovate the hotel and improve guest service; in the meantime, I will be staying elsewhere.

title: Rudeness at all forms
text:
I have stayed in this hotel as part of a work trip, unfortunately it wasnt my choice.
first, to reach to the reception it took me 20 minutes calling constantly with no response. and then they transfer my call to housekeeping without even letting me finish talking.
my room has no fridge and i had some items that needs to be refrigerated or else they will get spoiled. so i asked if they can keep them somewhere or get me a mini fridge or something. the housekeeping staff that answered in all rudeness told me that there were no fridges available and she cant do anything for me.
i have been working in the customer service industry and in all honesty im blown away by the rudeness of everyone in this hotel. 
the least they could have done is to offer to refrigerate my things until a fridge becomes available or something but no.
anyways i flushed my money down the drain basically as all the stuff that needed to be chilled got spoiled so thank you very much.

title: Check In after waiting
text:
Daniel was the host who helped me check in.
Daniel is the epitome of customer service and was magnificent. He was able to assist me in all my needs for my stay at the Millennium which I am very appreciative of.

title: Daniel and Juan at the front desk were amazing!
text: My roommate and I are staying here for a week to participate in a theatre intensive, and we needed to print some sheet music. We wanted to use the hotel printer (which charges a fee) on the 2nd floor but it  had broken down. So we talked to Daniel at the front desk and he went the extra mile to print my friend's sheet music for free! Two copies! All the while we had a lovely conversation. He was extremely friendly and personable!

title: Holiday
text: It's a great hotel in a excellent location just off time Square. The staff we're fantastic and could not do enough to make us feel welcome. Upon leaving the bell boys took care of our luggage why we explore the city some more.

title: Very Friendly Staff!!!!
text: Ms Syeda checked us in and she made my wife's 40th birthday a very memorable one. Thank you so much for chocolates and amazing view of times square. She loved it. Room was spacious and clean what else can you ask for. Please ask for syeda at the reception for all your needs and you wont be disappointed!

title: Great helpful front desk. Perfect to stay on Time Square
text: Syeda from the front desk was very helpful to find the perfect room  for my husband‘s 50 b‘day. Thank you so much for the help. Jacuzzi with overlooking the city was unforgettable. The hotel is perfect if you want to stay on TS. The hotel is very clean even it is not the newest.

title: Mr . Syed at front desk is a great guy. Hotel is awesome.
text: Completely blown away by the courteous staff, nice clean rooms, and the best location+cleanliness the hotel had to offer. Plz ignore bad reviews if you find any. My family visited from India and enjoyed the stay very much. Will 100% book it again

title: Location, location, location
text:
This hotel strong point is for sure its location, what can be better than being literally on Time Square? One could imagine that the management rely only on it and disregard the rest. But it's far from the truth.

The staff is well trained, efficient, polite and extremely knowledgeable.

My room was a bit out of date and a refurbishment would be a sure plus. But nevertheless the room was comfortable, practical, really clean and well laid out. I especially appreciated the choice of pillows, flat or fluffy. And the little upgrade of the night table with extra sockets and USB port (This little extra is one of the most important and sadly highly disregard by many hotels around the world, so kudos for this👍). What also really surprised me and please me was the quietness and soundproofing of the room not to mention the possibility to have total darkness.

To sum up, I went there for the location not expecting too much and have been pleasantly surprised.

title: Very Nice Hotel with a great staff!
text: We just had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for our anniversary weekend.  From start to finish, we had a great experience.   First of all,the location is perfect . It's central to everything . The hotel in general  was  very clean  and  our room was nicely decorated.  The staff was  very professional.  A special thank you to Syed for the excellent service and  very warm welcome he provided  at check-in.  We felt right at home, and he encouraged us to contact him if we needed anything.    When we were checking out, Syeda was quick to call us over and she did the check-out right away with a wonderful smile. This hotel is highly recommended!

title: Midwest girls in NYC
text: Syed At the front desk literally turned our day around as soon as we arrived. I had been ripped off by a pirate taxi And I was quite shaken. Syed gave my daughter and I very good advice about what to do in such a situation and told us to only use the yellow taxis. He also gave us a nice reassurances about the quality of our room. We have a great view and we are looking forward to the rest of our trip in spite of a scary beginning

title: Great!
text: Really enjoyed our stay here! Room was clean and tidy and quite spacious. The staff were very welcoming and friendly. Special shout out to Daniel at the front desk, who spoke with us a couple of times in the evenings - this made our experience even more positive. Would definitely recommend staying here and if I’m ever back in the city would not hesitate to return. Thank you to everyone at the Millennium, it was a great stay for our first time in New York!

title: Hotel Awesome. Parking Not.
text: Daniel was awesome at check in. Accommodating, helpful, entertaining. No better way to begin a stay in New York City. His engaging style set the stage for a Very comfortable 2 night stay at the Millineum. Though I will say the adjoining parking across the street we found to be rude, unhelpful, and very much the characterization on why people don’t like New York.

title: Very Nice Staff and Excellent Location!
text:
My experience has been positive throughout the trip. Staff is so nice and kind, they go out of their way to accommodate guests. The rooms were clean and spotless but the bedsheets were quite thin. Overall, it was a excellent experience if you don't mind the lack of a microwave or refrigerator.

Pros: 
Location is excellent, everything is close by.
Staff are friendly and will go out of their way to accommodate you.
Rooms were clean and tidy.

Cons: 
Lack of a refrigerator and microwave
Thin bed sheets. 

Overall, this experience has been excellent and highly recommend if you don't mind the lack of refrigerators.

title: Millennium Hotel
text: Our check in time was 4pm. Arrived at 12pm to see if we can drop off luggage until 4pm. Syed served me and was able to get me a room right away! He was nice and kind and had great jokes. Thanks! Much appreciated!

title: Henderson
text: Mr. Chris Allen was a great help during my visit and stay. He went above and beyond to make sure we had the room and view we were looking for. Mr. Allen used very good customer service skills as well as great assistance in choosing a room. Thank you Mr. Allen for your perfessional skills,greeting me with a smile and your willingness to help.

title: tired, Dated and unorganised
text:
We had 2 rooms, one was suppose to have 2 beds and 1 with 1 bed. When we arrived at 2am one room we were checked into was filthy, Beds not made, towels on the floors, it had not been properly checked over and not cleaned before we checked in.  at 2am this was not ideal or a good start to the holiday

When we finally were put into the correct room it was extremely tired and dated and just felt fairly dirty 

Only reason for 2 stars is that the doorman is extremely helpful and the receptionists were very friendly

title: unbeatable price and location
text: you can’t beat the location and the price. it is literally a 30 second walk to times square. staff was very friendly, nice and accommodating. the rooms are a little bit outdated but they were clean. there’s no fridge or coffee machine in the rooms, but it wasn’t something that really bothered me. ended up staying for 2 days and had no problems.

title: Door opened unexpectedly at 3:30 AM
text:
I am a frequent traveler with countless hotel experiences, and this is my worst experience at a hotel.

Room had an old carpet smell, witnessed small round bugs at the bathtub (1 time) and sink (2 times) and bed (1 time), disposable cups were not restocked 7 days out of 9, bed and pillow sheets were not changed, towels restocked were random (sometimes only body towels, sometimes mixed).

But this was nothing compared to the experience I had on the 5th night.

Staying with my child on the 24th floor, 2 men opens the door by force at 3:30 in the MORNING!
It was fortunate that I had the door stopper (the thing on top of the lock), or they would have probably attacked me while I was in bed.
One man yells and demands my name (which I did give as I was frightened).
I also asked for his name, but he does not answer.  Instead, he plays with his phone for a minute and walks away with the other man.
Again, this was after 3:30 in the morning without any warning or notice.
My child and I were asleep.

After gaining composure, I immediately called the front desk and asked for the supervisor.
Andrew was the supervisor at the time, and he says that housekeeping was asked to clean the room and no one was supposed to be in the room.
So security was sent.
Now, house cleaning at 3:30 in morning?
Security without any calls or notices before opening the door?
The room was booked and prepaid (this was a 9 night stay).

During my +5 minute conversation, I did not feel any signs of remorse from the supervisor.
Instead, it seems as if he was just waiting for me to stop talking so that he can hang up the phone.
He did say that some facility charges can be dropped as an apology (there are no "facilities" here.  Are we expected to pay for the use of elevators and hallways?).
This daily facility charge of +$30 was discovered at time of checkin, so beware of the prices.

During the rest of my stay, I only wanted to leave the hotel.
I could not sleep as I was afraid for my child.
I was not offered another room to move (it is very uncomfortable to stay in the same room), no apologies by the security, no letters, etc.
Nothing.

At checkout, I received a bill fully showing the facility charges.
Over $300 for a 9 night stay.

If you have a family and/or small ones, I definitely recommend elsewhere.

title: Amazing Hotel!!
text: I loved everything about this hotel!! The location, staff, clean room, and services! Wow!!! I can’t believe not leaving.a great review. We got chocolates for a special occasion and even a fridge in the room. Elevator worked perfectly! Everything was so clean and luxurious. Free storage of bags before check in! Love this place! Yes, I would come back!

title: Great Customer Service
text: Booked Millennium For our first visit to NY after covid. Arrived at the hotel after a long day of flight delays. Was greeted by syeda. She was very welcoming and after hearing the horror story of our trip coming in she upgraded us to the next category complimentary. We are very grateful to her as we were able to get settled and get some rest before we started our first day in NY. Rooms are a bit old but they are big compared to other hotels in NYC. Will def come back.

title: “Great Location and even better Front Desk Staff”
text: You can not beat the location of this hotel! I stayed at this hotel (for business) because I was working in the Times Square area. When I checked in, I was exhausted from working a long day! The sweet Front Desk agent, Daniel, had an endearing smile and infectious laugh. He upgraded my room to a better view! Wow! He made checking in so easy. He also gave me a restaurant recommendation which proved to be excellent!

title: Rude and confrontational staff and manager! Stay elsewhere!
text: Upon arriving at the Hotel after a very early flight I politely asked about early check-in, to which I was told I could have the room early for an extra fee. Being a well seasoned traveller, it is my experience that Hotels are happy to offer their guests the room if it is available. To this, I immediately got the eye rolling and very mocking attitude which certainly put a very sour taste since I haven't even fully checked-in yet! When I asked to speak with the manager, it only got worse. Curt, frustrated and confrontational, the manager escalated the situation a lot further which could have  easily been resolved with some sincerely and respect.I would caution a stay at this Hotel unless you are looking for aggravation and sub-par service. And to be honest, I am actually being quite polite in my review...

title: A high-priced dump
text: In such a great location I was so surprised that when I opened the door to my room I saw such a dump. The furniture was broken and there were no outlets for me to work. After several calls to the front desk no one ever came to provide an extension cord. Also there was no coffee maker in the room and after repeated calls housekeeping came by at 11:30 PM to give me a coffee maker, which in the morning did not work. The room felt so much like a prison cell that I checked out early to avoid staying a second night.

title: Great Location but Awful Accommodation
text:
We took our 15 year-old-daughter to NYC for the first time, so we wanted to stay around Times Square. The location of the hotel was spectacular because it was within walking distance of stores, shops, restaurant, and had a Walgreens next door for any miscellaneous items. HOWEVER, the rooms were terrible and several employees on separate occasions were not pleasant (see attached pics). The gym had a large jug of water one day, and then nothing the next couple days. When we asked housekeeping to replace the water, they told us to speak to the front desk. When we spoke to the front desk, they told us to speak to housekeeping. We never got any water, and the jug stayed empty for the remainder of our 4 day stay. They also don’t answer the phones when you call down, so you have to physically go down to the lobby to physically talk to the rude front desk employees.

The bedding was disgusting. I’m glad they wash the comforters, however, they look like they’ve seen a dryer 1,000x too many. The bathrooms were decent but needed attention. It was an okay stay for the high pricing in NYC, but there are too many other options to ever go back to this hotel. We were disappointed!!!

title: Awful
text: We booked this hotel for 4 nights and didn't stay a single one. Our room was so run down it was pathetic, stains all over the carpet, furniture had seen better days, and there was a smell to the room that made us both sick. There was mold and mildew in the room which I'm highly allergic to, within a few minutes of being in the room I started having a reaction.  We only booked this hotel for a different view of the city than the one we were in a few days before. Needless to say we immediately checked out and went back to our original hotel. The view was great, the room was horrible.

title: millennium eccellente
text:
We stayed for 4 nights at the Millennium Hotel. Perfect location, practically in Times Square and very close to the subways to reach any place in New York. Also convenient for Hudson Yards, Empire state Building, St. Patrick Cathedrale, 5th Avenue and Central Park on foot.
Beautiful view, even from the bedroom, you already feel perfectly immersed in New York life.
Excellent organization for breakfast in the room and perfect welcome.
A special thanks to a receptionist whose name unfortunately I do not remember, but who welcomed us on arrival and departure and will soon be on vacation in Italy. We talked a lot about holidays with him and we hope to be as welcoming as he is.
New York is simply fabulous and on our return, we will certainly stay at this Hotel.
Thanks for everything
Concetta and Angelo

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: From the moment we walked into the Millennium, we were treated with service that was above and beyond.  Daniel was incredible during our check-in and made our stay memorable.   This hotel was nice and the location was close to all the theaters and Times Square.  The room was HUGE compared to all other hotels we’ve stayed in Manhattan.   We will definitely be back again.

title: Very good
text: Lucky enough to be upgraded to 52nd (and top) floor, had a super stay and the staff was nice. Obviously the price goes with it as you are litteraly 50m away from Times Square. Would repeat the experience undoubtly.
