title: Razoável
text: A localização é muito boa, na esquina da Times. O banheiro é bom, com uma ducha muito boa e limpo, porém o quarto bem velho, sem frigobar, escuro. Os atendentes de pouca conversa e o serviço de quarto um pouco demorado, travesseiro e cobertas ruim.

title: Great customer service
text: Monique at the Millennium Times Square check in registration desk was wonderful! Personal service and charming personality. Warm welcome for us to New York! Thank you ms Monique! Central location and easy access

title: Don’t Waste Your Money
text:
1. Bad check in experience. 2. Unmade bed.  3. Dirty ice bucket.  4.  Other than fitness center, zero amenities such as room service, restaurant or bar.  5. Terrible lobby (which is important when half the family sleeps in).  6.  Generally dirty and in need of a renovation. 

Just don’t waste your money. Oh, and the ball drop view, which I’m sure is great for New Year’s Eve, is literally the ball above a building. You can see zero percent of Times Square. 

We’re still here and I can’t wait to move on to Boston where we have an Air BNB reserved.

title: Excellent Location but Hotel needs some TLC
text:
We were booked into this Hotel for 5 nights at the end of our Canadian adventure. Its location is superb as it is just off Times Square where "all the action is" and surrounded by various theatres, restaurants, cafes and shops. There is even a supermarket close by.
We were warmly greeted by Simon C on Reception. Check-in was very quick and simple. When Simon heard that our trip was part of our wedding anniversary celebrations he upgraded us to a King and also gave us a complimentary box of chocolates. So kind and thoughtful.
Our room was on the 34th floor and it was on the quieter side of the building at the end of a corridor. The room itself was very large with plenty of storage. However it was very apparent that it needed some TLC. There apparently used to be a fridge which had been removed and the cupboard door was loose; the wardrobe doors did not close properly and were damaged; the safe did not work (when I reported this to Reception I was advised that there was a problem getting the necessary parts); there was no tea/coffee making facilities but after a call to Housekeeping they provided a kettle so that I could make our obligatory cups of tea in the morning; the curtains and nets were very worn and some of the fittings were broken; the bath had been patched several times and the paint was flaking off; the grouting needed replacing; when having a shower the water did not drain away properly so you ended up having a mixture of bath and shower (which was great for our feet which were weary from walking miles each day!). 
However, despite this, we were more than happy with the room! It was clean and tidy, more than adequate for our needs for our stay in New York. It was serviced every day which was nice.
The on-site restaurant was not open when we were there but there are so many different choices within a short walking distance it was no problem. 
The staff at the Hotel are all very helpful and friendly.
Tiffany dealt with us when we checked out, and we advised her of the various issues in our room in case they were able to deal with them prior to the next guest checking in. She advised us that the hotel is due for a refurbishment soon. It must be hard for the front-line staff as it is not their fault that the hotel is "tired".
Like everywhere else, the hospitality business has been hit the hardest by the Covid pandemic and there were many other hotels and restaurants that are still not open. 
I could not give this Hotel or its rooms an excellent rating due to my comments but still rated it as very good based on its location and particularly its staff.
Thanks to everyone for making the last hotel stop of our holiday so enjoyable.

title: Associate Educator of Teen Programs - Milwaukee Art Museum
text: Room was ok! But but bed was uncomfortable and pillows weren’t fluffy. There was stuff on the wall that looked like blood? It was kind disorienting when I saw that! However, house keeping was great and it was nice to come to my room again with it touched up!

title: This Hotel and the Staff Made Our Trip Amazing!
text:
Being first-time visitors to New York City (and driving there as well) we were quite nervous about our arrival and how it would go getting into the city. All of those nerves were relieved within 5 minutes of getting to the Millenium Hotel Broadway Times Square. As we pulled off into the loading zone on 44th Avenue, we were greeted by the doorman who I believe was named Lefton. He assured us that we were able to leave our vehicle there with him as we went to check-in and unload our bags. 

We were then checked in by Syeda. She asked if it was our first time visiting NYC and we of course told her yes. She then got all of our information together and handed us our room keys letting us know she tried to give us a great room within the category we booked. When we checked our key, we saw we were on the 51st floor (out of 52)! We had a corner room with an amazing view looking down onto the heart of Times Square. We were both beaming with joy and couldn't believe she went out of her way to make our first time there so special. 

When we went back down to move our car, we went to let her know how much we loved the room. She then even went and grabbed us a box of chocolates to enjoy that evening! Syeda was such a positive impact on our trip to NYC and made it so special for us. She is truly an exceptional employee. 

Lefton then helped us maneuver our vehicle across the busy 44th Ave. by stopping traffic to allow us to cross. He was such a major contribution as well to an easy check-in.

title: Excelente ubicación!
text: Excelente ubicación. Muy buena atención de todo el personal. Higiene en habitaciones. Lobby enorme. Baño con todos los servicios. Ropa de cama pulcra, y siempre con buen orden de parte de las/los mucamos. Con protocolo COVID durante toda nuestra estadía.

title: Highly disappointing - Avoid this hotel
text:
Dirty (some parts haven't been cleaned for years).
No WiFi in the room.
Old looking (items have not been replaced for years: worn out carpets and equipment).
Flickering lights,broken things, rust in shower, no fridge or coffee machine in the room.

Expensive for what you get.

title: Good for the value
text: It’s a good place to stay in midtown. Great for theatre district. Rooms are spacious and comfortable but old. Furniture needs to be replaced. On the other hand there’s value for the price. Needs a good restaurant! Starbucks is right next door.

title: Non mi sento di consigliarlo
text:
Nonostante la posizione eccezionale,praticamente a Times Square,non mi sento di consigliare questo hotel dopo avervi soggiornato per ben sei notti,viene venduto come un quattro stelle e per tale lo paghi.ma neanche lontanamente offre i servizi da quattro stelle,camere vecchissime,prese della corrente che si staccano dai muri,niente frigobar!!!!, La televisione non si accendeva in camera nostra e per ben tre giorni di seguito lo abbiamo segnalato,nessuno è venuto a controllare..poi ci siamo arresi!!
Si accede alle camere tramite ascensori che salgono ai piani previo utilizzo delle carte/ chiavi ma i sensori non funzionano bene quindi ogni volta è una guerra!! Una volta siamo rimasti chiusi dentro perché l' ascensore è schizzato al 40 esimo piano e non si muoveva né apriva più da allora per noi è stato scary elevatori
Un vero peccato visto le potenzialità!! Deve essere totalmente ristrutturato

title: ubicacion perfecta
text:
Muy bien ubicado, hotel viejo pero excelente ubicación. Limpio y prolijo
No tiene desayuno pero calculo que debe ser por la pandemia.
Tiene entrada a dos calles y estás cerca de todos los teatros, Time square, etc.

title: Prime Location and Great Staff!
text: We stayed at the Millennium Broadway Times Square in March 2022 and now in May 2021.  Its a great location and the staff was great!  I don't go to NYC to stay in my hotel and while it's a no frills hotel.  All of our rooms were great!  We had 7 people in our party and 3 rooms total.  The view was amazing on the 35th floor.  I was told renovations are coming soon, which will be nice, but again, I'm not there to stay in my room.  All I need to a safe location, clean room and bathroom and I'm out of my room.  I will be returning in January and can't wait!  Thanks!  We also traveled w/ my kids and my 84 year old mother.  All went well!

title: Millennium m Hotel is a must!
text: What a great place to stay.  This is a no frills place right now.  But sounds like there may be some renovations in the future.  It was clean and the staff were outstanding!  So helpful and friendly!  The true gem of this wonderful hotel is Thomas-concierge!  We just loved him so much!  We will truly miss him.  We will be back!  This hotel is conveniently located at Time Square.  Close to subways, shops and food!  It is right where the party is at if you like Times Square!  Broadway shows are plentiful right next to the hotel!  Highly recommend this place!

title: It was not great just fine
text: Our first room was dirty and poorly organized which lead to quite a few trips and bruises. Our second room was fine. The hotel isn’t the cleanest but most of the staff is kind and accommodating. Despite having the do not disturb sign on a person from house keeping banged on the door daily at 8-9am

title: The UGLY room
text: We renamed our room "the ugly room". Creepy carpets, old curtains, depressing decoration. And especially disgusting windows, blocking the shabby view despite the choice of a "ball drop view room". We asked for another room at the reception and by email, but no answer.

title: Dirty windows spoil the view
text: Close to Times Square. Location is fantastic. No room service. Got a room with a view but the windows are so dirty on outside I can’t see much during the day.  Hotel seems to be in need of updating. Very friendly staff go out of their way to assist. Parking garage across street is convenient. Bed is hard. Stay on a high floor away from noise.

title: It's close to a fraud
text: Hotel well placed but everything else is dishonest. Contrary to what was advertised, the room is neither modern, nor chic, nor comfortable. It is rather austere, ugly, old, the wallpapers and carpets are in a sorry state, the bedding is poor with flat pillows, dusty windows, the sockets are few, the decoration depressing. The "ball drop view" of Times Square on our floor is ridiculously partial and has nothing to do with the photos posted on the website. It does not deserve the extra paid compared to a standard room that I can not imagine worse than this one. This hotel has everything from a tourist hotel with a very poor quality-price ratio that fills up effortlessly without trying to do better or even well.

title: A Memorable 34th Anniversary Staycation!
text: Our very first time staying in the heart of Times Square! From the moment we arrived Millennium Broadway, we loved its vintage hotel atmosphere! We had expect the normal wear & tear but it was the warm hospitality & excellent service that impressed us the most! From the doorman, Adrian, who kindly greeted us & unloaded our luggage on the birdcage, the wonderful front desk service from Syedah, who was very kind in giving us a special box of delicious chocolate candies and a room upgrade on the 51st floor with fantastic views once she knew we were celebrating our 34th Wedding Anniversary! Then we had Mark, a friendly butler who proudly told us he worked at the hotel for 22 yrs, escorted us & our luggages to our room! Not a moment too long afterwards, we were visited by Juan, the hotel Manager and Hernan, the hotel maintenance in our room because they wanted to be sure we had accessible service to communication devices such as a TTY & a flashing door knocker since they learned we were both deaf! We definitely gave all the staff 5 - for their attentiveness & customer service! Our beautiful room was very clean in every aspects and the bed was very comfortable! We were also granted a mini refrigerator upon request and it was immediately brought up in mere minutes after our arrival! Talk about speedy service! So, like I said, it was a Memorable 34th Anniversary Staycation! Thank you, Millennium Broadway! ️

title: Great stay
text: Stayed.for.4 nights early.December for our visit. Hotel was great with great location for all attractions for New York.. Storage facility available on day od departure due to late flight. Hotel rooms very large and impressive for New York rooms.

title: A Mock Four Star Hotel?
text:
Having stayed at MTS many times over the past twenty years, due to its location and service quality, we thought that it was an obvious choice when friends asked to come with us to see NYC. 

Shortly before our arrival we checked the latest TA reviews, “concerned” would be an understatement after viewing them. We consequently emailed the hotel to seek some clarification/ reassurance. Two emails were sent, no response received to either.

Our concern lead us to check nearby alternatives, all of which were considerably more expensive compared with the rate that we secured with a booking late in 2021. We consequently decided to take our chances.

Having not visited for a few years we were shocked to see how far downhill the the interior of the hotel had gone. The hotel interior can only be described as shabby, definitely not shabby chic! While our room was kept clean by housekeeping the state of the furniture was terrible with drawers on the desk broken, woodwork chipped/marked and curtains/net linings hanging off. We reported the curtain problem due to light shinning in at night, but it was never fixed. Additionally, one of the reading lights on the bed headboard was not working. This too reported, but never fixed. A Four Star Hotel that cannot fix curtains or a light, not at all impressive, especially when the hotel never provided any feedback or an apology.

Our friends had a similar room which had glasses in the bathroom, we had none. Requested that they were provided, with two paper coffee cups subsequently supplied! 

The bathroom, although kept clean, had what we referred to as a novelty toilet. It was obviously a replacement unit but had been fitted offset with one side of the cistern close to the wall and the other side 2+ inches away from the wall! Began to speculate that housekeeping had replaced it as it was not something that would be expected from a maintenance professional.

Apart from the lady who checked us in, who had the personality of a wet fish, a number of the members of staff were instrumental in our decision to not check out early. Particular thanks to Syeeda (who we noted from an earlier review was the “go to lady” if you have a problem), Shelley who mitigated the situation to persuade us not to check out early, Pat (lobby) and the singing Doorman on 44th Street (sorry did not get his name). The good service that we received from these few staff members has resulted in an "average" rather than "poor" overall service rating in this review. 

From what we understand a refurbishment project is scheduled for next year with two floors being taken out at time to facilitate this. If we ever return we will be checking that our room has gone through the process and it is nowhere near those where work is still in progress!

We speculated that an executive decision has been made to cut all but essential maintenance expenditure pending commencement of any refurbishment project. Until then, after seeing recent management responses, the impression is that they just let the front line staff take the flak from guests, then just indicate that something will be done when responding to reviews.

On the website is a tab “Travel safe during Covid 19”, buried away in this is a generic statement “hotel amenities and services may be limited”. As of early May this includes no bar or restaurant. The absence of such would have at least caused a pre-arrival email apology or letter in the room at other 4 Star Hotels that we have stayed at. 

If you are considering staying at MTS, hope this helps with your decision-making process, do not believe all the glossy photos shown on their website. 

It is hoped that someone from the Millennium Copthorne Hotels Group reads this review and intervenes at a corporate level to undertake a review of the MTS management system, and maybe check to ascertain whether the maintenance staff were laid off at the peak of the Covid pandemic and someone had omitted to rehire them!

title: Non prenoterò un'altra volta!
text: Dico solo che ci sono voluti 5 mesi di mail, su mail, su mail e poi ho dovuto scomodare mio ciguno che abita a NYC per riavere indietro i soldi delle camere annullate nei tempi previsti dalla prenotazione.

title: So gross
text: Believe all the reviews about it being dirty. It is tired and dirty.  My room smells like fruity air freshener and old smoke from 20 years ago. No view can overcome this smell. The couch has a big stain on it, the carpet looks filthy. The bathroom is old looking.  The light does not work next to the bed. The wall paper is peeling from the wall The toiletries are basic motel level, nothing nice. I could go on. Im scared to check the bed!  And this is an “upgrade”. I am sooo sorry i did not check reviews ahead of time. If you are reading this, believe me, until this place has a major overhaul, stay away.

title: First time NYC trip
text: It’s a Very nice hotel and staff. Will come back and stay! The only thing is why do I have to write a 200 minimum letter  review on here. Why can’t it be sweet and short? But other than that the hotel was wonderful

title: Disgusting, Mediocre Service - But Great Location
text:
(07May2022) Right in the center of Times Square - absolutely loved that. Hotel itself was dirty and our room was gross. The maid service and doormen were really sweet! I wanted to buy one bubble tea but I wasn't sure if he'd want it since I forgot to ask! This gets 2 stars because of them! Otherwise it'd be 1 (wish there was a 0). 

It clearly hadn't been cleaned well, if at all honestly. I don't even know if the desk had been sanitized down. 

We found a long streak of dried blood on the sheets when we finally went to go to sleep that night (11:00PM). It was on the sheet under the top blanket. Took photos and brought it to the night manager who simply said "we couldn't verify it was blood, so we'll call it just a red stain". Offered me new sheets or new room - it was already 11:20PM by then and we were EXHAUSTED, so we said new sheets. She said a maid will be up right away. 30 minutes pass, no maid. So I call down. She apologize and said that "theres only 1 maid, so there was a delay." I said that we could make the bed ourselves and meet the maid anywhere. We were just exhausted and needed to sleep. She said that the maid was on her way up right now, so we waited. They said they'd take of the facility fee for a night (which is $30).

Now it's midnight, no maid. 5 past midnight now and fiance then goes down. He gets the same response, but from a different person this time. So we wait again. 15 minutes later a doorman finally comes and just hands us sheets so we can make the bed ourselves. And we also found a used condom and lots of trash behind the bed when we went to change the sheets finally. 

In the AM we talk to the day-time manager. Mind you, I have photo evidence of the stain AND time stamps. I show this manager everything and he tells us that he'll take off a second day of facility fees and dismisses us. Once we go to check out 2 days later they said that only 1 day worth of facility fees are taken off. When I explain 2 days should be, he just says nowhere says 2 in the notes, just 1 so he was only going to take off for 1. NYC was exhausting so we just said whatever and left at that. 

The way this was handled was awful and it was beyond disgusting (not to mention a biohazard - that stain could have a number of possible infectious diseases) having to deal with this situation.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Merci au personnel pour sa gentillesse et sa disponibilité que ce soit au lobby ou la personne qui nettoie les chambres tout le monde a été adorable et réactif.
Oui les chambres méritent une rénovation mais on s'en moque on ne fait qu'y dormir quelques heures. Notre chambre était au 48eme étage quel bonheur et quel dépaysement. 
Non il n'y a pas de service de restauration. Tant pis il y a tout à proximité pour prendre son petit déj et ses repas. 

Enfin conseils aux français arrêtez de chercher lors de vos voyages ce que vous avez chez vous ou alors ne bougez pas.

Je recommande cet hôtel pour son excellent rapport qualité prix et encore merci au personnel.
Hope to see you next time.

title: Hit or Miss
text: Actual Room was Great: quiet, clean, private, spacious (although couldn’t ever figure out the thermostat). Hotel was meh: not enough elevators (often has to wait for 4 cars to come by before I could fit in one), in-hotel restaurant was closed, so no ordering food to room, lobby & common areas are dated.

title: Super hotel
text: Super hôtel malgré le négatif des personne que j ai lu dans des avis à voir soi même j'ai était au 41 ème etage super chambre avec cafetière sur demande chambre fait tout les jours et propre tout le monde dit vieillot mais je pense un peu partout à new york c est des meuble en bois personnel sympa et merci particulier à Juan il parle français et compréhensible quand on comprend pas pour les taxe et la caution pas de mauvaise surprise c était écrit que les fee était a payer en fin de séjour emplacements parfois à 1 minute de time square quand on est fatiguer le sœur c super our le bruit c est normal on est à new york en plein milieu d un endroit très fréquenter mais si on ferme la fenêtre on entend pas beaucoup et vue les kilomètres que on a fait la journée on a rien entendu et pas déranger si je reviens je viendrai chez eux c était parfait pour moi et personnel sympa

title: Séjour New York
text:
Manque de convivialité car il n’y a pas de salle de restauration y compris pour le petit déjeuner
Déco vieillissante et défraîchie 
Salle de bain usagée
Pas de bouilloire dans la chambre
Bon accueil de la part du personnel
Nettoyage de la chambre effectué tous les jours 
Très bon emplacement dans Times Square

title: Déçu
text:
Hôtel bien situé et personnel agréable .
Cependant beaucoup de points négatifs : la chambre en elle même est à revoir totalement : propreté laisse clairement à désirer (traces de saleté au plafond et moquette tachée), papier se décolle du mur, miroir cassé … on a eu la malchance d’avoir une chambre juste au dessus des turbines de ventilations qui fonctionnent même la nuit d’où un bruit constant.
Le restaurant était fermé (cause covid ) donc pas de petit-déjeuner.
Et malgré le fait d’avoir payé tout le séjour en avance, des taxes journalières nous ont été prélevées sur notre carte 32€ par nuit

title: Millinium Broadway Hotel Time Square - Dirty Hotel
text:
The mattress had old urine stains on it, the carpet was dirty and the service was shocking.
There wasn't a bar fridge in the room.
The system was offline and it took over an hour to check in.
Furniture in a poor condition.

title: Great staff and location, but watch out with the “Deluxe” room
text:
The staff is great! People at the front desk couldn’t be more helpfull and attentive. They helped us to sort out the reason of giving 3 stars out of 5 to this hotel, which I will explain now:

Their website offers a “Deluxe” room which is either inexistent (which seems to be the case) or could not be honored for our reservation.

Other than that, the hotel is in the middle of everything at Broadway/Times Square

title: Unmatched Customer Service
text: Syeeeeeda (Syeda)!!!!! Upon entering the hotel I was greeted by the one and only Sydea. Her presence was welcoming, and she was very attentive and accommodating! I arrive at the hotel in the early morning and Syeda’s energy was very much needed. All staff member’s that I have encountered this far have been enjoyable, and very professional. Looking forward to my time in NY. Again, let me say Syeda def went out of her way in assisting me!

title: The only good thing is the location
text:
I recently visited this hotel, I usually book one hotel on 57th street but it was full.
Bad experience overall, the hotel is absolutely outdated and dirty.
Old carpet and stained wall. Old and damaged furniture.
No fridge, no coffe maker and not even a cheap water boiler.
Bathroom meet minimum standards either on amenities and cleanliness.
Old shower and old shower curtain.
Good location close to time square

title: HORRIFICALLY DISGUSTING!!!!
text:
Room 2502 - Queen bed

DO NOT LET THE PICTURES fool you!!! I have never in my life stayed in such filth! I booked a 5 night stay, and left after one night! 

The mattress was STAINED in SEVERAL places, ripped to shreds, exposing the mattress lining, with indentations of where guests slept over the YEARS! 

Filthy floor, clumps of hair everywhere. MOLD throughout the bathroom. Furniture old, torn. No towels upon arrival, when we finally received them they were stiff and smelled awful! 

The quality of the air flowing into the room must have been just as dusty and dirty as the room itself b/c myself & family's allergies went crazy. Had to turn it off!! 

The bed linens were so over washed/over used that the interior lining was all clumped up in the corners, and hardened, so thin/see through. 

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER - hotel staff was actually understanding and let me cancel the rest of my trip, hassle free, waived my facility fee for the night. 

However, I paid $180 to sleep in FILTH!! We lost a day of our vacation, dealing with this mess, scrambling trying to find a new hotel. So frustrating!

title: Millenium Times Square NYC
text:
Our last visit to NYC was 12 April 2019, my husband’s bday, and the tradition to come from Panama to celebrate in his fav city had to be stopped during 2 years due COVID, but now we are back in this vibrant city that he loves and for this opportunity  we decided to explore a new hotel, and definitely lucky us we booked at Millennium Times Square. Yes, location is everything, but great people is a gift.

We were warm welcomed by Syeda at the front desk, and when she said “I will be back “ we never imagined that she was arranging to surprise my husband by upgrading our stay, and she nailed it!

Hotel facilities are great, friendly staff that are eager to help and to be in the center of everything, that’s the Millennium Time Square promise.

Totally recommend.

title: Not bad at all friendly staff
text: The hotel was fine, the furniture decor / lights were little dated but we only wanted a base so didn’t need all the fancy stuff.    Would have appreciated more plugs for charging electrical items.   Beds were comfortable , shower always hot .  Brilliant location , staff were helpful and friendly.

title: Don’t stay here
text: Honestly I paid for 4 nights but left after 2 even though the reservation was non-refundable. I just couldn’t stay there another night. Too dirty, too outdated- everything scuffed or dusty or stained, Whoever owns this hotel is absolutely milking it for all they can and doesn’t want to put a dime back into the place. I feel bad for the very friendly staff that has to constantly apologize for this place.

title: Old, tired and dirty rooms
text: The rooms are old, dirty and in dire need of a complete overhaul. Light switches filthy, walls stained, unknown marks on the curtain, bathroom fittings falling apart and more. The only thing this hotel relies on is its location. Be warned. In any other city this wouldn’t meet two star standards.

title: Greatest service ever
text: Daniel was the most wonderful welcoming person, he made New Yorkers the highest level of attendance for the Hospitality Industry. Daniel made me feel right at home when reservation challenge came to bear. This person I am so greatful for. Please give him my best recommendation and rating!

title: The staff is AMAZING but the hotel is NOT!
text:
This was a last-minute booking as my original hotel was mistakenly canceled. 

My husband stayed in this hotel in the 90s and said it was really nice back then so we took a chance. My family (husband and toddler) checked into the hotel after a long day of travel. We were greeted by the front desk staffer who's name I'm forgetting was AMAZING! He upgraded our room to one with a view after hearing of our travel woes and seeing we had a toddler. 

Once we got checked in we made our way to the elevator.  I'm not sure if more than one elevator was out of service but there always seemed to be a line or a bit of wait to get an elevator. Again thanks to the AMAZING staff we ended up using the service elevator a few times because the regular elevators never came. 

Once we got into the room we knew we chose the wrong hotel. We did have a view of the times square ball but the room felt like you wanted to sleep with your clothes on and something to protect your head. We tried to find another hotel but availability was limited. The carpet was very dirty and the furniture was dated. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been cleaned in quite some time and the shower looked like there was mold. We went and bought cheap flip flops (good luck finding those in Dec) for all of us because we felt so uncomfortable. On our third day the faucet and shower water didn't work and once they did the water was brown. Needless to say, no one showered that day. My husband said it had gone downhill since he had stayed there. 

All of that said the most redeeming quality about this hotel was the staff. We will NEVER stay there again!!

title: Millennium times square New York
text: We had a wonderful stay at the millennium time square in New York. Daniel checked us in and was able to upgrade our room to the 50 the floor over looking time square. Our room was very clean with a beautiful view.  Very grateful for Daniel!

title: Not the worst hotel ever but definitely wouldn't recommend, check your bank during your stay!
text:
The best part of this hotel is definitely the location, you are steps from Times Square so close to everything and subways etc.

We had a corner room with a really good view. The cleanliness wasn't great and the bathroom walls had massive clumps of dust on. Considering dust takes a while to gather it's concerning how long that has been completely missed and not cleaned. The sheets had marks on them even when they were changed each day there would be a different mark somewhere else.

Just like other reviews suggest, the elevators were a nightmare. Really slow and always massive queues when you just want to come back and get to your room, one day we waited 10 minutes on our floor for the elevator (49th floor so not really a just take the stairs situation).

The above wouldn't have really made much of a difference the main reason this is an awful hotel and why I wouldn't stay again or recommend is money: they take $100 per night deposit (the rooms are falling apart as they are so not sure how we could even do $400 worth of damage but that was fine we get it back no issues) they also take $35 per night resort fees that you get absolutely nothing for. They try to say wifi is one of the things but it was down on two separate occasions for us.

I noticed when I checked out someone was checking in and was given a whole speech on what was available such as gym, wifi, shop etc - we had none of that when we checked in so weren't even aware of what the hotel had but the worst part was 2 American guests checked out while I was there and both of them said "I was told the resort fees would be waived" no questions asked the staff just agreed so makes me think resort fees are only payable if you're a foreign tourist.

When I checked out, I luckily looked at my bank and on top of the deposit they had taken a random amount of money from me, I queried it and NO ONE could explain what it was or why it was taken and that it would most likely go back. 

I've since been in touch with them and they've said "our system automatically authorized that amount while running the night audit in error" - so it's a bit concerning they keep your details and are able to take money from you during the night. I got this back in about 2 weeks and instead of a nice gesture of refunding the resort fees like they did for American guests they offered me a 50% refund of resort fees that I still haven't received and they're blaming my bank.

In summary, stay there if you want to be in Times Square and don't mind it a bit dirty but keep an eye on your bank as I imagine a lot of people don't even check and they're keeping random amounts of money from their guests. If this does happen, be prepared for the weeks of back and forth and having your emails ignored for ages for nothing to be offered for the inconvenience.

title: Great location, BUT...
text:
You can't beat the location of this hotel. One block away from Times Square with room view of the Empire state building!

Customer service was another story though.
We stayed for three days.

On the first day we asked 3x during the course of the day if somebody please could come and fix the lamp on the night stand. It was never fixed in three days! 

Day 2 - the maid only left half the towels and never came back for them.

Day 3 - the maid bought all the towels but never made the bed. She just left halfway through the job and never came back.

Front desk had a "I could not care less attitude" each time we called. The only one who was actually friendly was the concierge lady. 

So. If you look for a hotel centrally located, this is a great choice. If you care for customer service, look elsewhere.

title: ****DANIEL IS THE MAN FOR EVERYTHING YOU NEED****
text: we initially booked the standard room which put us in a room on the 16th floor -- which was still great. though, upon asking for a better room, one of the people at the concierge, Daniel, was able to give us a room on the 51th floor with amazing views of times square. we're both thankful and delighted with our experience here!

title: Thomas
text:
Your concierge  , Thomas is outstanding! He was never too.busy to help two non technically deprived woman get around  NYC. This help ranged from Uber rides to theater tickets. He is a prime representative of your hotel and a motivator to return.
Sincerely, Barbara Holbrook

title: Nice pictures but the room you pay for is not that room, what a slum.
text: We paid well in advance for a decent deal and then was appreciated with the window cleaners view which was a caged tower on the outside view even though we paid for a ball drop view room for new years eve. We paid over $2,000 dollars and struggled with literally bad neck pains for seeing the ball drop. They moved the room a couple of floors higher after 2 days but still a mile away... I have to mention that the manager was atrocious!! her attitude was horrific and nearly kicked us out of the hotel. As a young couple coming to New York for new years and paying a fortune to have a once in a life time memory ruined by this hotel... we was affected. The hotel was OK, we had so many more problems also that the stay was uncomfortable, more than wiling to provide more information if they want. We have pictures and notes of all the problems we incurred. Please make sure you know what you are booking as we would only stay at this hotel again if we see the room before we buy. As an ex hilton hotel what an overall let down!!!

title: First time in NYC
text:
We are currently staying in the hotel. Night 4/5  we are from the UK so some of the hotel facilities are foreign to us.

The room has peeling wallpaper, no coffee facility unless you ask for it. The carpets are stained, you have to ask for the room to be cleaned rather than refusing the service. I found a large knife in the room on top of the safe, the sink doesn't allow the water to drain we asked for the sink to be repaired on day one this still hasn't been done. 

On arrival we had to pay a $340 booking charge and a further $134 service charge on check out.

There is no restaurant or bar in the hotel, WiFi is poor so I have had to pay for Starbucks daily just so I could contact my children back home. 

The only positive is the locate of the hotel it is a stones throw from Time Square.

I would come back without hesitation,. Only if management improve the above.

title: David Josef
text:
Hello Trip Advisor, 
My name is David Josef. I am a fashion designer and work with several high profile clients who are on and off Broadway. I originally booked at the Millennium Hotel on 44th, because of it’s convenient location to most of my fabric sources that close by in the garment district and my clients appreciate the location for fittings. 

After several stays at this hotel,  I have come to know several of the staff members, Daniel, Kaela and Eleanor at check in for instance…and Tom who works the security desk in the lobby. Occasionally I may need something and these  folks bend over backwards meet our special requests….and always take amazing care when our VIP ladies arrive for their fittings. 

It’s always a pleasure to work with staff who make our visits so special since our first and then subsequent visits. They cater to our needs and special requests and honestly can’t do enough for us. 

And Tom at security would make a wonderful concierge with his extensive knowledge of every show on Broadway.   We spoke for 15 minutes last visit, about the shows we were seeing and shows to see!   

I highly recommend staying at the Millennium Hotel and do recommend staying there to all my friends.  

Thank you, David Josef.

title: かなり不満
text:
他の方々の口コミ通り、立地は最高です。しかし、設備・備品・サービスという点では日本のビジネスホテルの方がはるかに良かったです。

・風呂の排水が全くダメ。
・執務用のデスクはあるが、デスクチェアーがない。ティーテーブルをイス代わりにしました。
・ティッシュペーパーもない。
・メモ用紙やボールペンもない。
・エレベータ内でカードキーをかざしても反応しないので、エレベーターが動かない。
・2部屋予約していたが、チェックインの際に1部屋しか予約されていないと言われ、再度確認をしたら予約されていたことが判明。
・ランドリーサービスがない（これはコロナウィルス対策のためかもしれません）。

…これまでかなりいろいろなところに泊まっていますが、ここまでないないづくのしのホテルはなかったです。

title: Disappointed Returning Customer
text: I don't know if it's because of the pandemic or the hotel and its services are just degrading. We stayed here in June 2019 and it was a fantastic stay. This time, we arrived on a cold Winter night in February 2022 and found disappointments after disappointments. When we first got to our room (number 2917), the beds neither had a duvet nor a blanket, only a fitted sheet and 2 flat sheets. The bathroom had no towel floor mat, and the bathtub was clogged, couldn’t drain. The floor area around the base of the toilet was badly stained yellow, it looked as if that area has collected a lot of urine over time. The drawers under the TV wouldn't close, and the upper hinge on the door to where the small fridge used to be, was broken. The safe was already locked, meaning we would need it unlocked the next day for our use. Not feeling good about the room, we still decided to stay in it because it was already 2am after a long flight and we had already unpacked our suitcases. We called housekeeping that night for the blankets and towel mat as they were immediate needs. The housekeeping lady on the phone said they've always provided triple sheets only, no duvet or blanket ever needed to be provided. (We were here 2.5 years ago and there were duvets). However, she said she would have someone bring us the duvets and the towel mat. 10 minutes later someone came and brought us the duvets, but they forgot the towel mat. We didn’t want to bother them with another late night call, so we used one of the towels as a mat. The next morning we called housekeeping about the safe being locked, that we needed someone to unlock it for our use. A tall gentleman in a dark gray/black suit came to try and unlock it but it wouldn't lock again properly, aka the safe was malfunctioning. He apologized and recommended we either request for another room or to use the safe at the front desk. We called the front desk and explained the situation, the front desk gentleman said no one but a locksmith can be able to fix the safe, and the hotel had no locksmith; basically he implied that we lied about the gentleman who came to our room to attempt to fix the safe. Why would we lie about it? He then told us to use the safe at the front desk. We asked how big the safe was because we needed it for our work laptops. He said the safe was only for small items like money and jewelries, no laptops. So he said if we still wanted to switch the rooms, then come downstairs with our IDs and he would try to find another room, but he had to warn us that this hotel had a lot of rooms with a broken safe. When we came to the front desk, we asked that if the same category wasn’t available, we would like an upgrade because we didn't like size and amenities of the room we were in. Maybe he thought we wanted a free upgrade so he answered right away that he had no more room to upgrade. (We did a mock booking on the website prior to that, and found the next category was still available). We said we were willing to pay extra for the upgrade, he was reluctant for a second, and then he still said no, probably to save face? First he implied that we lied about the locksmith, then he assumed we were greedy asking for a free upgrade. Wrong! He then gave us the key cards to another room, same category, to check it out before switching to that room. So we did check it out. Although the safe in that room worked and there was no yellow stain at the base of the toilet (looked cleaner), the bathtub was still clogged, the hinge on the door to the fridge area was still broken, and we would lose the round table. Since we had already unpacked everything, it wouldn't be worth it to pack and unpack again for a room that is not any better, so we decided to stay in our current room, and tried to carry our laptops with us every time we went out since we couldn't use the safe. Someone did later come and unclog the bathtub, and brought us a fridge and coffee maker per our request. It was still an art to open and close the door to the fridge to make sure it wouldn't fall on our toes. Regarding housekeeping, we didn’t get our room cleaned everyday, we stayed 6 days and only got cleaned the first 3 days. Was it because we forgot to leave some tips on the 3rd day?

title: Great location, prompt service but dirty and outdated.
text: In cost saving measures the hotel has cut basic amenities such as coffee in room, etc.  They don’t even leave any cups, paper or glass, to use in the restroom when brushing teeth.  They were prompt to bring some when we asked for cups though.  The location is great!  The room was pretty dirty with smears on doors and walls.  There was trash behind the furniture and even a used condom under a chair.  We would not stay there again.  The rooms really need to be thoroughly cleaned, sanitized and updated.

title: Great management
text: We were here for 5 nights. After the second night we had a small issue with our room and the manager (Rockie I think), moved us to a different groom within an hour. He could not have handled it better. Just told us to pack our things  and a bellman would more them to the new room within the hour. I used the fitness room every day. Always clean and stocked with bottled water and towels. The elevators were well synchronized and fast. We never waited. We loved this location. Close to great restaurants and all the Broadway shows. We would walk to the theater box office of a show and get our tickets for that night or the next day. Always ended up with excellent seats at reasonable prices. My husbands jeans ripped and there was a Gap store on the corner! So convenient. Maybe one of the best things was that Juniors cheesecake was a block away…

title: Shabby rooms and service.
text: A really shabby Hotel. Room was not properly cleaned and prepared for our stay. Interior is old and in bad conditions. We noticed staff about lamp not working, but nothing happened. I had a package delivered to the Hotel. They did not notify me, and to pick it up I had to go to an office closed mist if the day. The area is full of good hotels, so pick another one.

title: Es un fraude
text: El hotel anuncia una tarifa en reales pero te cobrará otra al llegar 40 dlls extra por noche a lo que ya pagaste. Lo ofrecen con desayuno pero está “temporalmente cerrado” entonces pagas una tarifa que nada tiene que ver con patatas realmente por lo que lo recibirás. No se parecen las fotos al lugar al que claramente le hace falta mantenimiento y limpieza.  El único punto a favor es la ubicación

title: Best Concierge Ever!
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Millennium Hotel in Times Square.  It started out rough due to the fact that we had to switch rooms twice due to bathroom flooding in our first room, and graffiti and odor in the second room.   The manager was very apologetic and friendly so it made up for the inconvenience.
The hotel is in a perfect central location, near subway stations, restaurants and stores.  But the best part of our stay was the concierge, Thomas A.  He was extremely helpful and kind, assisted us with our daily routes, recommended places of interest, and was so thoughtful  by leaving us a map, directions and a farewell note on our last day.  
Thank you so much Thomas.  Because of you, we will definitely return.

title: Gone down hill
text:
Having been to this hotel twice before and loving it, we planned to go back In December last year. Unfortunately  due to covid we were unable to fly. Due to this I was unable to collect a parcel which I had delivered. 

I currently have friends in New York who offered to collect it for me, who were informed they didn’t have it and were unhelpful and rude.

I have sent numerous emails and not have a response. This is very poor customer service and it’s such a shame as we currently have a booking for December but are now looking to go elsewhere.

title: Definitely NOT a 4-Star Hotel!
text:
I booked here because price-wise, seemed like a great deal for a 4-star hotel and would expect the amenities of a 4-star hotel.  NO RESTAURANT, NO in-room fridge, the telephone did not work, no in-room alarm clock or any clock for that matter, the thermostat barely worked.  We had to push it really hard to get the temperature adjusted.

When we left for breakfast, I asked the doorman who was there at the time about getting us a taxi and he said he would absolutely help us.  When we arrived back from breakfast, it was a different doorman, I asked him to help with a taxi and he looked at me like I had two heads and told me he'd "see what he can do."  Fortunately, as we walked out the door, a taxi had just pulled up.

On Saturday evening, there was a room with a party going on - screaming, laughing, howling and loud talking well after midnight.  And, of course, with a phone that was not operational, there was little we could do without getting dressed and going down to the front desk!

I emailed the GM following our stay, and he won't respond.  I stay in hotels several times a year, and this was by far the worst.

The website should not include restaurant or other services if they do not exist.  I realize C-19 has taken a toll on the hospitality industry, but standard room features were completely missing.

title: Right in the middle of the action
text: In the center of broadway theater district and a few steps from times Square BUT. just to get TV to work had to call the drone desk, there was an ice bucket in the room but no cups (had to call housekeeping to get them).  The rate was cheap and the rooms are very basic.  when I checked in they said I was upgraded but the room I was "upgraded to" was nothing special

title: was supposed to be great
text: I booked this hotel through the recommendation of a friend that was staying there as well. My views are that the front desk personnel does not review charges before credit is charged or billed. There was no assistance to bring up your luggage to your room. The room was cold as cold was blowing in from somewhere. I could hardly sleep. I advised the front desk manager and he said he would have the engineer check it out. I came back into my room to cold air coming in and a stained stale smell blanket on my bed. The room was very cold to walk around in. Not to mention to bathtub had hair from previous guests. I enjoyed my time in NY but would not recommend or stay here again,

title: THE VIEW IS SPECTACULAR BUT THE EMPLOYEES ARE RUDE!! AND THE ROOM DIDNT HAVE PHONE AND THE FRIDGE WAS NOT WORKING..
text: This hotel is beautiful and in a really good place of New York from my room I could see the memorial. Really beautiful view but the staff was sooo rude. They  were NEVER nice and they must work in this cuz the hotel is just so beautiful!! Also, there was a damage fridge in my room and the phone was damage as well. Also when I called first time to confirmed reservation they told me one thing and whine I arrived they told me other. They charge me more for the deposit. Hope they’ll give me back the deposit. Even though it is a great hotel and loved the room it was fantastic the view.

title: Hotel never returned $200 deposit - after 6 phone calls & 2 emails!
text:
Upon arrival I was told I had to pay a $200 deposit, in addition to paying upfront for the room in full. When I checked out, I checked with the front desk that this money would be returned to me in full. I was told that it might take up to two weeks to show up in my bank - but that it would absolutely be returned in full. The room was left in the exact condition it was found, so there is no chance the hotel would have had a reason to keep the money.

The next day, I was refunded $62.30 and then a further payment of 98 cents - then received nothing more. It has been over 5 weeks since my stay. I have made 6 phone calls and 2 emails. Neither email ever received a response, and every time I called, I was passed from department to department, with people saying they didn't know or couldn't help - and then eventually reaching a department that would just ring through to answerphone. Not one person out of the countless people I have spoken to has been able to offer any sort of explanation as to why I have not received this money back. I have wasted a ridiculous amount of time on the phone - on hold, being passed around different departments, repeating what has happened to each new person, and still don't have my money back.

The hotel itself was average - few issues like sockets falling out of the wall, dim lights, but was willing to overlook that due to the good location. However, the hotel keeping this money and the subsequent shocking customer service I have experienced trying to get it back has left a very bitter taste.

title: False Advertisement
text: The view is amazing but the hotel is outdated! Old hallways smell like the projects! Dusty and looked like it had not been deep cleaned since the pandemic! Who is writing these 4/5 star reviews?? 1 star for the view!

title: Love it there
text: I love your hotel but one of your employees was rude her was Rachel I still well come stay there I love it there I ask her a question over the phone And u answered it and then she called ma a dumb ass she thought she hung up she didn’t I heard her very rude

title: Outstanding service & great location
text: Our stay was comfortable and pleasant! Ms. Monique, the young lady working the front desk, was simply amazing!!!!! Very knowledgeable and patient!!!!! Our room was nice and clean and the view wasn’t bad either! From the bellman to the breakfast clerks to the cleaning ladies, service was A1!!!!! This hotel also sits in between Times Square and Broadway, PERFECT LOCATION!!!!!!!! My experience was a great one and I hope to see and work with Ms. Monique again when booking in the near future!!!!

title: BEWARE!!! Hotel took unapproved payment from my bank for no reason, ignores my contact and refuses to return my money!!!
text:
We arrived at this hotel on 23rd December for a much anticipated family holiday and were very excited to be having a Christmas family holiday. 

On checking in I was asked to pay a deposit, which they advised was returnable and which I paid 
 
Whilst in New York my bank card was cancelled because somebody had gotten hold of the card  details and was attempting to use it fraudulently, which was odd given that the only place in the US that I had used it was at the hotel 

When we were checking out I was told I could use one of my other bank cards to get the deposit  refund. On returning home to Ireland and on speaking with my banks it was discovered that not only had this hotel failed to return my initial deposit, but they had in fact charged me a second unauthorised deposit amount under the guise of returning my initial deposit. The room was exactly the way it had been when we entered!! 

I have at this stage emailed the hotel SIX times. ALL emails they have chosen to ignore and have not repaid my money!! I would have to tell people to be extremely cautious of this hotel, which has taken unauthorised payment from my bank account and refuses to return my money which they should not have! If you have stayed there please check your bank account! 

It appears that I will need to instruct an attorney to act on my behalf in this matter

On going to room 1810 we were extremely disappointed by how extremely cramped it was & certainly not big enough for 3 adults, as we had booked
The decor is extremely outdated. The bathroom has turned yellow and cracked where it should be white on the bath. 
We had opted for one of the more expensive rooms, so wonder how dreadful the cheaper version would have been

On complaining about the room we were told nothing could be done. Given that we had come all the way from Ireland returning home was unfortunately not an option

The room was freezing during the night and we had to request additional blankets, for which they thought we would tip!! 

 In addition there was a wall vent which made a lot of noise throughout the night.

The hotel is one which the public use as a shortcut to get from one street to another, so it is always busy downstairs.

The restaurant was closed throughout our stay 

The only good things about this hotel is Tom the 
Concierge & the location

title: Go Back to the CITY!  Go NOW!  Be Safe and Enjoy!
text: We had a very good experience at this hotel this weekend... despite starting out with no heat!  The staff were very good - professional, quick to respond, and nice.  It was busy, but they kept people distanced and when we realized our room had no heat they were quick to fix the issue.  If you are headed to midtown, want to be close to Grand Central Station and Times Square, want to be in the thick of it all... you can't get a better location.  Rooms are BIG and spacious!  Water pressure is excellent.  Mattress and pillows comfortable.  Basically, anything that makes your stay a good one - it's all good.  There's definitely COVID precautions in place and we felt safe.  We saw little things - a worn spot on a carpet, a chipped floor tile... things that pre-COVID would probably have been fixed immediately... but right now hotels are staying clean and safe, staffing with superb people and letting cosmetic things go a little.  Nothing marred our stay.

title: Clogged shower and lacking amenities
text: The shower was clogged when we arrived and the water in the toilet was continuously running. I notified the front desk and they said they’d send someone up to fix it but never did. The room itself was lacking a fridge, microwave and other amenities I’d expect of a hotel room. There were also many stains in the carpet and handprints all over the windows. There was however a nice view from the room.

title: HORRIBLE experience at this hotel!
text:
Millennium Hotels & Resorts
Attn: Mr. Clarence Tan
Chief Executive Officer Millennium and Copthorne Hotels
Victoria House, Victoria Road
Horley, Surrey  RH6 7AF
United Kingdom

Good morning Mr. Tan.

My apologies for reaching out to you directly but I could not find who is the CEO of the US Operations due to the changes taken place in the last couple years. 
My name is Rodrigo Aranda and recently stayed at the Millennium Broadway Times Square Hotel in Ney York City. My booking reference was 4TZ62QWD2 and my Loyalty Member ID is 2021121400000167. The reservation was from December 18th thru the 22 of December 2021. The total cost of the reservation for those 4 days was $1,387.44, almost $350 per night.
I decided to write to you this letter more than anything else out of frustration, since the stayed at the hotel was incredible disappointing and to a point it created health issues to us. I wanted to express our disappointment to your organization and see what you can do to fix this situation.
I would like to be able to let you know why I chose your hotel in lieu of other hotels we usually stay at since we are members of loyalty programs at the Marriott Hotels (Marriott Bonvoy), Intercontinental (IHG Rewards), Hilton Hotels (Hilton Honors), Hyatt Hotels (World of Hyat), Mandarin Oriental (just to mention some). 
This supposed to be a very special weekend for us, it was our 18th year anniversary and during my reservation I mentioned this to one of your employees which was answering some of my questions. It supposed to be a very special weekend as well due to a long-awaited trip that my daughter wanted to New York (after all the issues there and the pandemic). Therefore, you can say that it was a double special reason. Asides from these two main reasons, it is all over the internet that you are part of the Hilton Hotels system, which is something that we appreciate as well, since we are a member of their loyalty program. All these was mentioned to the person I was talking to during my reservation and at no time she contradicted or told me otherwise.
I am not sure how to best describe our terrible experience, but perhaps doing it topic by topic might be the best and easiest approach. Let’s start from the beginning. 
1.	Reservation: There were two deciding factors in making the reservation at your hotel. First of them, it was that I stayed at your hotel several years back and at that time it was a delightful experience. The second one is the fact that I was under the impression you were part of the Hilton Hotels, which gave me some “comfort” level per say. I like the location of your hotel, but not even the location superseded the entire experience this time around. We could have stayed at the Marriott Marquis or the Grand Hyatt, or any other hotel in the area. Little I knew that the hotel it was before it is not today. Anyway, after I made the reservations, I called your reservation team to see if they could match an offer I found in the internet which it made a difference in the total amount of over $300 in the entire reservation. The person that I talked (I think her name was Jennifer) told me that there was nothing that she could do for me and told me that I could cancel my reservation and booked with the other place if I wanted to. Now, I was taken by surprise how she was so cold about, but I should have listened to her and do it.  To be honest, that it is not a customer service approach that I was not expecting, but I understood much better when I got to the hotel why they are take such an abrupt and rude approach to the customers, since most of them at the counter were like that. To be honest, the hotel was a complete chaos. I even asked her about the tower next to the hotel, called the Millennium Premier New York Times Square. She proceeded to tell me that the rooms were much smaller, with limited services, and that it was more business-like atmosphere and more simple as a hotel. Little I knew that perhaps that would have been much better than the location we stayed at. During my call, I also mentioned that this was a special weekend since it was my 18th anniversary and I choose the hotel, which usually I am not the one making the reservation or picking the hotels, this time I did. But I went by my previous experience several years past. I even sent an email with the rates I found to see if they could do anything about it and to see if they could adjust the rate; but my emails were never answered. I was going to talk to a manager over there, but there was none available all the time. Good way to deal with the issues at the hotel, by not facing them.  
2.	Check In: Usually at the check in stage, you can gage and realize how your stay it is going to be, by seeing how well trained and hospitable the staff members are. The gentlemen that started our check-in was a complete character (I said “started” because we arrived early, and he told me that there was nothing he could do for us). I have to say that he was rude, as like he was doing us a favor attending us. I wish I got his name but unfortunately, he did not wear a name tag. All I can tell you is that he was wearing a grey suit and he sounded like somebody from India or Pakistan (or the countries of that area which I am able to identify since I have a large clientele in that part of the world). He had the same facial characteristics as well. I always saw him on the first window to the left at the check-in counter (hopefully that will help you to identify him). Anyway, every question I asked, it was answered like I bothered him.  It got to a point that he told me that the check in was at 4PM and not to return before then… hugh? After leaving my house at 4AM to go to the airport to take a 3-hour flight and waiting on a cab for over 1 hour in traffic, that was not what I was expecting or needed to hear, he is not by far anything remotely to be a person customer oriented. Perhaps a more amicable tone or service would have made a lot of things easier, and I wouldn’t be writing this letter now. At the end of the day, we are paying for the service you supposed to provide, or not?  
3.	Room and bathroom: I cannot tell you when the last time was, I stayed in a room like the one they gave us. It is very far from the pictures in the internet. Forget about the fact that we asked for a possible view of the Empire State, or a view at all. The view was horrible. The beds were extremely uncomfortable and hard as a rock and my wife has back problems. As a matter of fact, upon coming back to Miami, she had to go to a specialist for her back, compliments of that bed. The furniture was old, stained, burnt in some places and broken…. BROKEN! The light fixtures worked when they wanted to work. The bathroom light fixture was not working correctly, it worked when it wanted, and it looked like a horror movie flicking as it did sometimes. The bathtub had mold on it. Wallpaper was coming out of the walls. The shower curtain was ripped. It was a nightmare really. I do not remember when the last time was, I stayed in a room like this one, perhaps never. I went downstairs to complain and get another room and they told me that they could not move us because they were completely booked. My wife and daughter realizing my frustration were supportive, but they should not have to go thru what we did. This was a special occasion and I truly feel bad about the entire room experience. The room was far below from what you advertise, and I would not recommend it to anyone, honestly.
4.	Air conditioner at the room: after the first night, we tried to get the A/C going. I suffer from a condition where my body is hot most of the time, a sort of hyperthyroidism (we have the A/C low at the house all the time where we stay). It didn’t seem to work, so I went to the front lobby to talk to somebody to assist us (since they don’t answer the phone when you call them). I was told by the person at the counter (a person with a beard which he was wearing Christmas decorations on it) that the A/C is off until June at the hotel. They proceeded to tell me that the hotel system they have it can only work as a heater or the A/C. What?? I have NEVER stayed in a hotel that this took place. What sort of hotel uses a system like that? Then the attendant proceeded to tell me to open the windows that the cool breeze should take care of the air circulation… hugh? And that it should be better the following night since it was going to be colder outside. Now, do you think I paid the amount I paid to stay at this hotel for somebody to tell me to open a window and be sweating in the room? Is this for real? What hotel has a system so backwards like this one? In what century are we?  
5.	Elevator: There are many elevators at the hotel, and they work divided by top and bottom of the tower. Since we were staying at the 37th floor, we had to use the elevators going to the top floors. I remember we had like 5 or 6 assigned to our part of the tower, which seemed to be great! On the second day of our stayed, in the morning; no elevator will come to the 37th floor. We waited for over 35 minutes (yes 35 minutes) and there was only one coming, fully packed the 3 times it opened in our floor. The day of the incident, we had a reservation; therefore, after waiting for so long, my wife said to take the stairs…. from the 37th floor??…. crazy idea since she and my daughter were wearing boots, with heels. But out of frustration and her insistence we did since we could not be late to the reservation we had. Once we reached the “lobby” floor (but not at the lobby yet), there were some people waiting there as well since there was no signs to tell us how to get to the lobby of the hotel. After a while of opening doors, an employee looked at us weird and directed us to the lobby. Little I have to say about how infuriated I was at that point. 37 floors down and my wife and daughter wearing boots and exhausted (nevertheless to say sweating). That was not going to end up well and it did not for them (they had cramps in the legs, were not feeling well).  But when I went to the front desk after the incident, unfortunately the same gentleman of the time we did check-in was there. When I told him about the fact that we waited for 35 minutes and needed to take the stairs down, in a very daring, uncaring voice he said; “well everybody is doing that”…. I am sorry, but what?? . I told him that not all the elevators were working, and he started arguing with me (obviously he is not the one going down the stairs). He picked up the phone on a very daring way and call somebody who told him something that he did not want to repeat (but his face said it all) and looked very cynically to me and said that they were all working… not going to tell you what I was thinking at that point; but I was not happy. Then he proceeded to tell me if there was something else that I wanted to say, I should talk to the manager; which I immediately requested; however, he said that the manager was on a meeting, without even checking. Now it seems very off to me that you offer me to talk to a manager, when I cannot!
6.	Manager at the hotel: after all the issues we had, and even telling the front desk about them; we didn’t even get to talk to a manager, not even a call. I even went down to ask for the “ghost” manager on 3 occasions. Every time the manager was not available, neither got a call back, or a message, nothing! This is how the hotel treats their guests? My reviews are not going to be kind, but I will give you the chance to make this entire situation right. I did not pay over $1300 for 4 days for this!
7.	Restaurant: you advertise that you have a restaurant (Bugis Street Brasserie and Bar), but you don’t advertise that it is not open; as a matter of fact, you don’t even mention it when you arrive at the hotel. You should mention to the future guests that it is not the case and that you are not able to provide breakfast at that location either. Curious enough, the person that I talked to at the reservation line told me that the Millennium Tower did in fact provided a continental breakfast to their guests. How is that possible? A cheaper hotel doing that? Your reservation staff discourages people like me to go to the other hotel, praising this one is a much better place; but you don’t even provide breakfast, or make it available for purchase for the guests…. And your rates are much higher… what is the reason?  
8.	Hilton Hotels: you advertise that you are part of or are an affiliated hotel to the Hilton Hotels and you are not. As a Hilton member, I called them, and they were not able to link your hotel with their chain. The only thing I could think of was the fact that Mr. Clarence Tan held or hold a Senior Vice President Development position with the Hilton Worldwide organization and somehow that transpired (incorrectly) to your hotel, since he is part of your Board of Directors. However, as per Hilton itself, they have no records of having this hotel as a member of their organization. Perhaps there is a mistake on their part, or it is being advertised incorrectly by your organization (false advertising?). I guess my question to you is if you are, or not an affiliated member of the Hilton family of hotels. And if in fact you are not, why is it being advertised as being one?   
9.	Wi-Fi: Is there really wi-fi at the hotel rooms? Because if there is, it was definitively not working on the room. Only at the lobby. It would be good if you don’t advertise wi-fi if you really only have it at the lobby of the hotel.  
10.	Hotel rating: Your rating as a 4 star hotel should be reviewed since after reading several articles for the classification, I don’t feel that this hotel qualifies for the rating for all the reasons I mentioned for starters. This hotel does not deserve that rating…. they are far from it. I read in an article about the classification of hotels, and they said the following about 4-star hotels: “4 star hotels will have more room options than 3 star hotels since they also offer suites. All rooms and public areas will have Wi-Fi or another internet connection. They will also have superior bedding, linen, and extensive amenities and have 24-hour room service. The staff will provide an excellent service and have careful attention to detail. Comfort and convenience of the guests are the main concerns of the guest.” Also, they offered the following chart:
 

After looking at this in detail, I am not quite sure how our hotels qualify as a 4 star hotel. If you could let me know, for sure I will take the time to try to understand it. But you do not have wi-fi in all areas of the hotel, or room service, or superior linens, or bar or spa or 24-hour room service… or well, A/C or working elevators. 

On one of my “visits” to the front desk, I was looking into cancelling the reservation and I was told that I would be penalized with an additional night to do so. At that point and considering that I was leaving early the last day, I desisted to cancel the reservation and decided to stay. I want to thank you for making our 18th anniversary memories and unforgettable one. It was by far, probably one of the worst experiences I had in a hotel in a very long time, perhaps since I was in college, and I am already 52 years old. 

So, after all what I wrote I ask your organization to make this right and fix this situation and provide us with the experience we should have gotten for the amount we paid. Please read my letter in detail. This is not something that it was an oversight. This is a way the hotel is being run. I picked this hotel for my family and to celebrate this special occasion and regret every day I did. Please consider all that and make this situation right. 

Thank you for your time and consideration on this matter. Hope to hear from you soon with a positive outcome.

title: Poor hygiene and unhelpful staff
text: After coming from an ultra long haul flight, I was eager to step in my cozy bed and have a good sleep after a 16hrs duty. After removing the blanket to dig inside the bed, I found this bug inside. I searched for the phone to inform reception and housekeeping. I kept searching for the phone and thought I was too tired and could not see the phone in my room. I disregard what happened and killed the bug as I was too tired. After four hours of sleep, I came down to the reception to highlight that I do not have the phone installed in my room. The staff told me that the phone was ringing and better to check it again. I told them about the bug I found inside the bed and informed me that next time inform them immediately to take action on the incident immediately. I went back to the room and took photos/ videos of the room to prove to the hotel staff that there was no phone installed. Apparently, when I came down to show the proof, hotel staff seemed to be unhelpful and informed me that someone would come to install the phone. I waited for three hours and nobody came. I got upset and went to sleep. Next day, hotel staff came early in the morning banging my door to check on me for my wake- up call as I was not answering the call. I informed him that staff last night was very unhelpful since nobody assisted me on my concerns. Worst experience as a first timer in this hotel. I did not expect this experience from a four star hotel. First, cleanliness was poor specially this time of pandemic. How can I assure that hygiene is maintained during Covid time. Second, staff was very unhelpful. If you cannot solve the problem, at least, say the truth that you cannot fix the problem. Third, no phone was installed in the room. How impossible is that?? Staff looked like I was lying or making some joke about the phone. Nobody assisted me when I told them that no phone was installed. No service recovery was done. If guests liked this hotel, not for me. I had a very inconvenient stay in this hotel. Never going back.

title: Mother daughters trip
text: This hotel was booked with great expectations….The Millennium Hilton.  Service was mediocre as far as housekeeping and amenities.  $270-380 per night with the accommodations of a Motel 6.  No refrigerator, no microwave. Restaurant was $27 for a sparse continental style breakfast.  Would not use this hotel in the future under the Hilton moniker.  Very much a disappointment.

title: Average hotel in a great location
text:
We stayed here for three nights. There was some kind of mix up when we checked in. We had booked two standard king rooms, but Tiffany said that they weren’t available so we were upgraded to city view rooms. Tiffany was very pleasant and accommodating. Our rooms were fine. Beds are comfortable. Things that are problematic: The rooms are hot. The thermostat is set on 65, but it is closer to 75. We have to keep windows open, which is noisy. There is only one mirror, which is in the bathroom. Makes it difficult for everyone to get ready at the same time. There is no fan in the bathroom, which makes it very steamy. No coffeemaker or refrigerator. No coffee or restaurant. 
   Pros:  It is clean and the location can’t be beat. The elevators aren’t busy and the staff are pleasant. Just  understand that this is a no frills hotel. At all. Starbucks is next door, so that helps. 
 This is our last night. We probably wouldn’t stay here again, but wouldn’t rule it out either.

title: Please avoir this hotel
text:
I booked 4 nights as a millenium rewards members , 
I got inside my room and it was smelling so bad , the bathroom was dirty and everything part of the room was old , I asked front desk for a another room , they gave me a upgrade bedsize but the mess was the same , I did not want to complain again and be like a bad customer. It was not possible to adjust the ac and heat as you want , only heat is working during winter so concierge told me to
open the windows If I was to hot .
Please be aware that there is no mini fridge and no microwave in the room and there is no lounge open so you can not have a leftover after eating out

title: Horrible stay
text:
We are Millenium rewards members and have been staying at Millennium properties for at least six years. To say that this stay was not up to our standards would be the understatement of the year. 
Even to say that the hotel needs some updating is an understatement. The bathroom was in terrible shape. Broken towel rack, light above the sink out, grout in the shower looked dingy, wallpaper peeling and a rusty access panel in the ceiling.
Moving on to the room, the wallpaper was also peeling there, the furniture was worn out or downright broken and the leather chair was peeling onto the floor. The windows were all dirty, and somehow, incredibly, someone had written some initials in the dirt on the outside of the window and we were on the 52nd floor!
Here’s the kicker: check out time is 11:00 AM. At 10:54, My wife was frightened out of her wits while she was in the bathroom because some staff member was banging on the door loudly and asking if we were checking out or if we were going to stay another day. They did this despite there being a do not disturb sign on the door.
We’ve never had anything like that happen to us before in our many years of travel, and we found it incredibly rude that this happened before official check out time.
Please refer to my pictures to corroborate the state of the room. I rarely blast hotels in my reviews like this, and to my knowledge I’ve only done it one other time, but this really deserves it. The beautiful views of the New York skyline are not worth the other disappointments of the room

title: Me cobraron doble
text: Me cobraron doble mi estadía, cuando regresé a mi país de origen, me percato que me habían cobrado doble mi estadía en mi tarjeta de crédito, al querer hacer la aclaración, nade responde llamadas, correos, mensajes o buzón de voz, pésimo servicio, abuso y robo.

title: Time Square stay
text: My husband and I were lucky to get a room for a December show that wasn’t canceled. Stayed on a Sunday night-room was on a high floor on the corner looking down on Broadway. King sized bed, nicely appointed bathroom and great service from Daniel at checkin and Edward, who recommend a breakfast place and stored our luggage so we could go explore before leaving town Monday. Just two blocks from Sony Hall, plenty of overnight parking garages nearby, right  in the very heart of the Big Apple. While it would have been less expensive on a Monday night, if your show is on a weekend and you want to be in Times Square, it’s worth it! And friendly, helpful staff just enhance the experience! I love NY!

title: Most horrible experience EVER
text:
Most HORRIBLE experience in a hotel EVER! ‘The nightmare of Time Square’. 

We do not even know where to start. But we will give it a try. 

We arrived at the hotel and after already having to wait a bit we were helped by a staff member. We got room number 4616. After having travelled about 20 hours from Europe to the US we were absolutely ready to take a shower and a nap. We came to the room, opened the door and the whole room was a mess. It was not cleaned yet. Disappointed we walked down to ask for a cleaned room and not a used room, and they understood the problem and we got a new room. Not only is this very unsatisfactory but also unsafe because of Covid contaminations. We got a new room, and that is where the real problems arose. The room was on a constant temperature of 85F and all we could do was sweat through the night without using blankets. We filed a complaint and they told us the problem was going to be fixed with the airconditioning not working. Nobody ever came. Then at night when my girlfriend wanted to take a shower, the door from the badroom could not open anymore.
