I was outside to get some groceries and she completely panicked as she couldn’t open the bathroom door anymore. What if a fire broke out? We wouldn’t want to think about these consequences! Then after having another night in our sauna-room we went out completely tired to try to enjoy the day outside. When we came back, the room wasn’t cleaned, the door wasn’t fixed and the airconditioning wasn’t fixed either and the new problem arrived. The whole room smelled like marihuana! We are no smokers and the smell was so strong we could almost get high from it. Imagine having kids? Other problems were leakage in the bathroom, and a sink that was constantly dripping throughout the night.  

Having problems with the room is one thing, not having staff solving issues is another thing. We paid nearly $800,- for 3 nights, and we were sick and tired of the problems, the smell, the heat, the defects and we did not feel safe in the room. Staff did not even help out one time, and did not take us serious. 

The last time we went to talk to a self reclaimed manager called Juan. In our opinion he should be reviewed as he came up to us from behind his desk and he showed us a very aggressive and intimidating attitude. We almost felt the problems in the room were our fault. No solutions whatsoever. Juan was extremely rude and did not provide any solution. 

You really wonder how businesses like these can still exist and I would never ever recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. I come from a hotel family and my grandparents would turn around in their grave if they would know that hotels like this are still up and running. It is worth $25,- a night and not $250,-. This hotel is a money making machine at the expense of the unknowing guest. 

IF YOU WANT TO HAVE A GOOD STAY  IN NEW YORK CITY, STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE

title: Worst Hotel in NYC
text:
We chose this hotel (The Millennium times square) because of their incredible reviews online. When we reached the hotel, We were provided a double bed room, when checking in we noticed hair on the bed and dirty room. We asked for another similar room but they moved us to another room with only 1 bed saying everything else was booked. 
When trying to go to the next room on the way the elevator stopped operating and we were stuck in the elevator for 20 mins. We rang the emergency bell and tried calling but no response. My cousin was not in the elevator with us and was coming back from parking the car. We only got a response when he inquired about the help at guest services. The lady at the guest services was ignoring the phone calls from the elevator and watching videos. They took us out after 20 mins. No apologies or anything! My mom almost had a panic attack. God forbid anything had happened.
When we confronted them at the front desk, Manager Geroge Jacob said it was our problem and we did not know how to use the elevator. But still, what's the reason for no immediate help in such dire situations? He was unapologetic and was very dismissive. When asked for someone above him I finally got your email.
On top of everything the new room was very dirty as well and we had mosquitoes all night. We did not have much time in New York hence, decided to deal with it later.

title: pay extra go elsewhere
text:
the bad: 
a/c not available to anyone when weather is cool. hotel removes access to a/c from thermostat. called downstairs, they said open window. great advice when streets are super loud.
beds/pillows/bedding are third rate.
front desk does not answer phones. you have to go downstairs for everything.
building is old. rooms are nowhere near sound proof. old cheap metal doors slam, get stuck. you can hear every door open and shut on the floor.
the good:
location is great.
cleaning crew and doormen are great.
elevators are super-fast.

title: Worst Experience In New York
text: Worst experience I’ve had to date in New York. Manager is absolutely incompetent to handle any situation you could present. Didn’t even end up sleeping here due to the screaming/fighting/banging on the walls of the adjoining room to ours and we called down to front desk and security 7 times and they were “unable” to get us a new room, offer any type of refund or discount, or remove the neighbors to us. Had to physically walk down two different times and they had my mother and I waiting in the lobby forever not resolving anything. DO NOT COME HERE.

title: This hotel is very tired
text: This hotel is tired. It needs upgrading. Nothing quite works. And like a lot of NY hotels they need to try harder. They rely on location and high demand to get away with poor quality rooms. I won’t be back.  To be fair their people try hard but they are fighting losing battle with an old tired hotel

title: Love the Millennium!
text: Great location close to Times Square!  We have stayed here at least 3 times. A room with a view is an added plus.  Hotel is clean with good housekeeping service, and friendly and helpful staff.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great place for a 1st visit
text: Our stay was so great! Great location, great price, great view! We were welcomed to the city for our first time by the sweetest host and even received an upgrade to a room with a wonderful view! We had no idea what to expect. The room was wonderful and spacious. We would recommend this hotel 100 percent. Only negative we have is the pillows were pretty flat and the shop downstairs was quite a bit over priced. Can’t wait to return!

title: NOT a 4 star hotel
text: The hotel is dirty, rooms not properly cleaned. My room window was caked with dust. Paint in peeling and the faucet in the bathroom is cracked. Carpets are not only worn out, they have major stains. They charged over $600 for this room. This hotel is not 4-star hotel by any stretch of imagination. I would call it a 2 and a half star at best. Facilities are perhaps 3 star (granite floors in lobby etc),  but upkeep is bad and is in a state of disrepair.

title: Location is the only upside
text: Stayed here for one night recently and was incredibly unimpressed. First, they told me my reservation booked through AMEX Gold came through as an "Expedia reservation." Hmmm. I think if that were true, Expedia would have given me better than a $275 room. But let's get to the actual rooms: dated. Ugly. Almost shabby, and not "shabby chic." Chipped and scratched furniture throughout, a tub I wouldn't set foot in because it was so stained and badly in need of reglazing...and there were two little silverfish having the time of their lives in the bathroom. So much for all that "COVID" cleanliness. The customer service leaves a lot to be desired as well. They put me in a bad cab that apparently works with the hotel. I'll leave it at that because  I'm still traumatized by the experience. Oh--it's also noisy. In sum: the only thing this hotel has going for it is location, because it's in the heart of the theater district. That said--there are a LOT better hotels in the Theater District. Save your money and choose more wisely than I did.

title: Run down and noisy - best to find somewhere else
text:
Not a good hotel. It’s run down and unloved. Also noisy, especially as the windows didn’t seem properly fitted to the building, letting in a draft and noise around the frame. 

Also, no food in the building - so no breakfast or in room dining. 

Had more a feel of a youth hostel.

title: 60th Birthday on Broadway
text:
My husband booked an amazing suite on the 21st floor of this fabulous hotel for my 60th birthday.

Monique and her staff were courteous, efficient, friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and the location of the hotel was perfect for our Broadway extravaganza.

We loved the grab and go breakfast and the snacks and drinks that are available during the day.

They surprised me with roses and wine for my 60th birthday.  The roses were absolutely beautiful.

We will definitely stay here on future trips to the city and highly recommend it!!!

Thanks for making my 60th birthday super special!!!!!!!!!

title: DON'T FALL FOR THE UPGRADE SCAM
text:
1st off hotel is in a brilliant location on times square.
PAUL the baggage man is the most friendly person in the whole hotel & so helpful  ;) thank you 👍.

Now for the negatives Extortionate resort fees.
A conman on the front check in desk will tell you he's upgraded your room for free ( wait till u see the room, they are dirty and shocking bad) .

The conman basically wants you to give him $20 for a charity bear ,where only 17% goes goes the charity.

When you refuse he will become very sarcastic saying '' enjoy your upgrade ''  Yeah cheers mate we will 👍 we didn't ask for it and it wasn't a upgrade. 

The room was filthy rotten, especially behind the tv cabinet, where pens, covid masks, cup etc etc from previous guests has not been taken and put in bin.

Will not return due to this and the sarcastic man on the front desk.

Charity scams are not be taken on tourists

title: Not good at all…
text:
Oh no, this place is really not great. Location might be good if you want to be in Times Square, but the room is outdated and feels unclean. When I got inside, I had to clean the chair because there were crumbs on them. There’s also stuff on the floor that hasn’t been cleaned up yet. The walls feel like they are breaking apart. The light flickers. The place is dusty. The bathroom sink doesn’t drain well and leaks onto the floor…

I’m really surprised that this hotel isn’t what it seems and the red flags in a lot of people’s reviews feel more real than ever. It’s just not what I was expected as presented on their website.

I’m super disappointed.

title: BEST Hotel in Broadway Times Square!!!
text:
I cannot say enough great things about the Millennium Hotel Broadway Times Square. The staff was courteous, professional and were always happy to assist us. We were just there for Thanksgiving; we loved it so much that we just booked the same room for New Year's Eve weekend!  Save your time the time and hassle. Don't look anywhere else.                      
                                                                                                                                                                    The Millennium Hotel Broadway Times Square is THE PLACE to stay while in NYC!!

title: We arrived at the hotel from the airport WITH OUR LUGGAGE we were advised they were overbooked: No room til 4am next day
text: When we arrived at the hotel from the airport WITH OUR LUGGAGE we were advised they were “overbooked” we were directed to their sister hotel, the Manhattan at Timesquare. How the hotel over booked and I already paid - is beyond me. We walked into the room- at the Manhattans——it was completely dirty. So dirty, there was even a ladder in the tub and spots on the wall. I have pictures for proof. We booked through Priceline and they did nothing. We did not want to stay at this hotel. We paid for a 4 star and this other hotel was closer to a one star. We were pretty much in the cold streets of NYC, freezing, wondering if our issue would be resolved by Priceline and/or the hotel from 7:30pm-4AM with our luggage because we were told numerous times that someone would follow up!!!!! They never called me. I continued to follow up. I never needed to use Priceline Customer service until now and I have been booking with them since 2005 but when I did need them I was given absolutely no assistance, I was even hung up on. Since Priceline was NO assistance-I relied again on the hotel. A manager at the Millennium Hotel- Rachel, was there. She eventually got us a single bed that “magically” was in a way nicer hotel than the previous one offered. The room was tiny but tolerable. We were soooo tired and stressed out but hey- we finally got the room at 4am the next day!! Although we got a single bed, we needed a double bed, so I had to sleep on a rollaway bed. Since Rachel got us the room, she saw our stress she told me repeatedly I would receive a refund for a night’s stay. I still have not received it. Every time I called and spoke with Rachel, I was given the run around and never called back. It was a nightmare of an experience and I truly will never come back to this hotel. I will post a negative review on every outlet to let people know this is how they treat people. Absolutely No thanks to Priceline. And a partial thanks to Millennium-Im completely disappointed in the whole experience. My friend and I are from VA and this is how we were treated.

title: Ótima localização
text:
Bar no lounge, rooftop com vista pra times square.
Entre o central park e a times square, o hotel possui excelente localização.
Há sempre festas fechadas no bar. Mas se pode usar a parte externa que posssui uma vista livre pra times square. 
O quarto do hotel é espaçoso, mas o ar condicionado desarmava de madrugada a todo momento, deixando a temperatura do quarto oscilando bastante. Eles cobram 4 dolares por pacote de encomenda. E a taxa de resort é bem cara.

title: Avoid like COVID
text: We had booked the Millennium Premier. We were checked into our room and realized that the thermostat was not working. On calling maintenance, it turned out the room was missing the whole air conditioning unit and nobody knew! The front desk guy was helpful and referred the matter to the Manager. The Manager took a little while and when he finally came around, we were presented with only 2 options - take a similar room in the older, more run down, lower class Broadway hotel or cancel - at 5.00 p.m. in NY with no other hotel booked. It seemed like we did not have an option. To his credit, we were upgraded to a Suite but the condition of the hotel as a whole and the Suite made it feel like a downgrade. I am not sure how many stars this hotel claims to have but 2 would be generous. The living room had 1 half of the day curtain completely missing. The dark curtains had holes in them. The curtains in the bedroom had holes in them. The cushions of the sofa were so old that if you sat on them, you felt the base of the sofa and the cushions never sprung back up after one stood up. The jacuzzi did not work. The shower in the bathtub did not work. We were left with only the small shower stall. The throw cushions looked like they had been around since 1970 and we weren't sure if they had ever been washed. The carpets were dirty. Light fixtures were missing bulbs. It was a complete rubbish room passed off as a suite. Housekeeping was random. Some days we would get 2 bottles of water, some days 1 and some days, none. Replenishing of towels and floor mats was also a daily surprise with no consistency at all. The corridors of the hotel were dark and dreary with peeling paint on the doors. I was reminded of the Shining and had to actually ask the bell boy if the floor was haunted or even let out to anyone else. All in all, it was a horrible experience. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Perhaps a Motel 6 would be better.

title: Millennium Broadway
text: We stated at this hotel for four nights. Hotel was described as a 4 star hotel and Travelocity also described it as one of the best hotels in New York. The hotel was dirty, all the furniture was broken, Old and dirty. No service in the hotel. No coffee, no restaurant no nothing. The bed sheets were not changed. To use the elevator you had to wait 20 minutes. No WiFi. The safe did not work. Additional charges for using the hotel which you already paid for. They call it Facility Fee, which is passing the corridor to the Elevator!!!! It was the worst experience. The only good thing that I can say, is thank you to Tom with the Concierge service who made our stay pleasant. Thank you Tom!!!

title: Comfortable, Inviting
text: The room was spacious and comfortable, with attractive furnishings and meticulously clean linens and towels. Check-in and check-out were very simple, and the concierge could not have been more helpful when I asked for restaurant recommendations in the vicinity. The price was right, also. A fine experience, and I assure you I'll be returning and recommending this hotel far and wide.

title: Big room but run down and poor facilities
text:
Our hotel room was spacious but the safe didn’t work, the room had no maid service, there was a drugs smell, the air con is rather non existent and general cleanliness not great. The shower is powerful but very cold so again disappointed. 
The beds are comfortable but it’s not good enough to overlook all the other issues.

title: Excellent views of Time Square / value for money
text: Excelent value for money, great location and impeccable service. We feel very safe and well treated. We stayed at the 3502 room, above the Time Square. I would like to leave a special thank you to Syed from the reception who was extremely polite and determitaded to give us the best experiece at the hotel.

title: Good location
text:
Great location. Checked in early as our room was ready. Room 2313. This was a standard room. There were no coffee or tea facilities in the room, which you don't always expect in the USA, however, there was nowhere in the hotel to get a hot drink either. No room service and the restaurant was still closed, so to get a hot drink, you had to leave the hotel. Starbucks next door must have made a few $$. Back to our room. The bathroom door didn't close properly, not a problem as we are a married couple. The socket in the bathroom was very loose and didn't work. There wasn't a glass or cup at all to rinse your mouth after brushing teeth. We had no hot water on one day, this was soon rectified. There was plenty of storage space and a safe. Our room was serviced every day and the bed very comfortable. 
A very good location on Times Square.

title: Excellent
text: Our first trip to New York and this was the hotel we stayed at ... 26th floor overlooking Times Square and as the window was on a full corner we could see the Empire State Building as well. The room was a really good size and the bed was huge, the place was spotlessly clean and they brought our breakfast in the room on our last morning .. highly recommended

title: Declining Property
text:
The hotel was accommodating to take my reservation request when I called and the process was efficient. 

I had stayed there multiple times for business prior to COVID and thought it was a nice property. 

Unfortunately things have definitely gone downhill. The front desk personnel were very welcoming but the room itself was shockingly shabby. Worn bathroom fixtures. Worn desk, night tables & credenza. Stingy quantities of bath towels, no wash cloths despite multiple requests to housekeeping. Toilet barely powerful enough to operate. 

Definitely not worth paying top dollar for this room.

title: Good location, med quality
text:
Very strange, the huge loby has no chairs at all. It's either you stand or drop like homeless on the floor.
Checkin - they don't take cash, can't devide payment for few cards, need to pay all upfront.
Rooms are medium level where windows are not soundproof, and it just over times Square...
Shower steam was surprisingly strong for 35th floor.
The location is very good if you look for mid Town location and transportation.

title: Excellent!
text: Perfect view, very clean, the staff is very nice and helpfull! Specially SHARLENE,her service  since the booking during the stay and untill the check out was EXCELLENT! Very kind,nice and helpull!txs!!

title: Great value, convenient location!
text: We chose a “ball drop view” room for a 3-day girls trip to see the sights and catch a show on Broadway. While this hotel isn’t the absolute fanciest place I’ve stayed, it was worth every penny for the following reasons - you can’t beat the location. At a 1/2 block off Times Square, we walked everywhere we wanted to go and it’s an easy Uber ride to LaGuardia. Also, the staff at this hotel are friendly and helpful and we really enjoyed all our interactions with them.  You won’t regret staying at this Millennium location!

title: Limpieza
text:
El lugar necesita remodelación,las habitaciones son costosas,pero no cuentan con refrigerador ni cafetera en las habitaciones.No tienen restaurante,ni ofrecen servicio de alimento a la habitación,aunque en la página de reserva si indica que tienen disponibilidad de área para gastronomía. Entendemos los cambios son por el Covid,pero lo idóneo sería ajustar la data en la página web.
Las alfombras requieren reemplazo.Las habitaciones necesitan mayor atención a los detalles de limpieza. Elevadores requieren arreglos cosméticos. EL hotel se ve anticuado para ser de una cadena Hilton,esperamos más de su infraestructura.

 Las ventajas que posee es la cercanía a los eventos de Broadway,farmacia 24 horas justo al lado,tienda de refrigerios y souvenirs en el lobby.

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: The day before our arrival I received an email saying due to burst pipes we were being relocated to the Row hotel.  I called to ask to remain at Millenium because we already had our off-site parking reservation paid for etc.  I told them I didn’t care what category room as long as they kept us there.  I also told them where they moved us to wasn’t even comparable. The response I received was “We cannot accommodate you.  The city is sold out this weekend so you either stay where we placed you or cancel.”  Wow.  Just wow.  Of course since we already had numerous tickets purchased for shows we sucked it up and went.  Since we had to park right next door to Millenium of course we saw tons of folks checking in.   We had a reservation for a room with a king size bed and was instead placed at the Row hotel in a super small room.  I suppose they don’t care about their customer service because they will never hurt for business, but I can’t help but wonder if they moved us since we went through a third party discount site in order to take full price bookings over ours.  Horrible!!!!

title: Pleasantly surprised!
text: The check in was easy and efficient. Staff courteous and professional. Room clean, smelled good, high quality bedding, coffee machine and basic toiletries. Good value and excellent location. Would stay there again. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: SYEDA was Amazing!

title: 2021 new york vacay!

title: Beware of HIDDEN FEES!
text:
Beware of HIDDEN FEES!

I stayed 2 nights in the past October, and paid beforehand. 2 weeks later, I noticed my credit card was charged an extra $68.87. They explained it was a mandatory facility fee, $30 a night, plus tax. But it was NOT highlighted at their website at all. If it's mandatory, it should have been included when I paid for the booking.

The room was fine. Not terrible, but definitely old. I stayed at a room with Times Square view on the 44th floor. The windows look like they haven't been cleaned for years. Shower water pressure was so strong it hurt a little, and no matter how you close the curtain, the dry area always flood a little afterwards. Don't pay close attention to the furnitures, carpet, wall corners, there are stains and cracks and god knows what. Luckily it wasn't so bad that I can't ignore them.

title: 1 Star Hotel
text: Buyer beware!!! Do not believe the stars. We booked two rooms: one room with 2 double beds and one with one queen bed. The rooms and hallways are tired, worn and dirty (so much staining on the carpets). I could clorox every surface but had to stop at the walls! It's dark and dingy inside. The bathroom had mold and mildew as well as old caulking. One of our double beds had stained sheets. The bedding left something to be desired.....flat pillows and an old "quilt" that looked more like a mattress pad. Thankfully the front desk staff was nice and let us out of our four night stay after just one night! I believe the reason this property still has so many stars is because it was a former Hilton property, but maintenance clearly stopped once Hilton dropped it. I do not recommend!

title: Great price even better views!
text:

The check in process was smooth. I booked directly through the hotel's website. Upon arrival I asked the front desk clerk for a room above 40th and I was given a room on the 50th floor. The view from my room was amazing. The room itself is simple and outdated. There aren't any perks or razzle dazzle, but of course I knew I would be getting what I paid for. The material of the wallpaper is starting to show signs of aging thus making it look like there's spiderwebs when there's not. I imagine there's a simple enough fix for that. There were some rips on the sheets and a hair on the blanket, but I just called and I asked for another set. I laid the new set on the bed. I wouldn't take a bath in the tub though. Be warned that the tub takes a while to drain initially, but after like 10 minutes or so it'll drain just fine.

If you are looking for 5 star views in a 3 star room, this is it. Book this place. For reference, my photos are from room 5013.

title: Seagull Rescue
text:
I wanted to share this here because my partner and I were so impressed by the hotel staff, maintenance and all who stepped up to help during this very unusual but disturbing incident that involved a seagull trapped on a balcony outside our window. 

IF YOU NEED A LIFT…. Read this story! 

New York City…always an adventure.
First let me say we have stayed at this hotel many times a LOVE it. The location is perfect for our needs, and the  staff throughout the building is incredibly friendly and attentive. 
We always feel the Millennium Hotel staff treat us like family. Truly!!

During our July visit, we were in a beautiful suite on the 50th floor. We had 2 appointments to meet with clients there one morning. However, at about 5 am that morning, we heard what sounded like tapping  on our windows.  Impossible right?  Who could be tapping on a 50th floor window?

A seagull could.  

Outside of our windows is a shallow deck, then AC units.  So it’s basically a runway with a wall on both sides … 50’ by 3’ wide

A seagull flew down into this area and got trapped.  He couldn’t fly out because his wing span was too wide and kept hitting our windows. Thus the window knocking at about 5 am.  

We listened and watched as this poor gull paced back and forth, unable to make flight from that small area. Finally, 

The windows in this hotel are low to the floor and only open about 6 inches outward. We couldn’t climb out to help this pacing bird in distress. 
It was KILLING us that we couldn’t help. I was able to put a cup of water out for him…but that was all we could do.
During this time, I took a video of the frantic gull pacing back and forth and some still shots. 

Finally, at 8AM, I went down to the lobby and explained this dilemma to the security guards at the desk, while showing the video and photos I had taken. 

They contacted the Millennium Hotel maintenance team and within a half hour, three wonderful maintenance men joined us and crafted a plan on how to free (our now) friend…who we named Johnathan) aka ‘Livingston Seagull’
They decided do get a piece of wood and slip it out the window creating a ramp up and out of the space to the ledge, where hopefully our Johnathan would take flight.
And it worked! He’s FREE!!
Thanks again to all the Millenium staff who answered the call to help.

title: Ball Drop View!
text:
I want to fall asleep to the Ball in Times Square; and I DID!!! 

Dream come true...

Wish there were room service; but nice deli across the street with a great breakfast sandwcih.

I'll be back; I loved the location and the quiite and the high floor!

title: Great service
text: Erin at the front desk was super nice great service this not the first time I had the pleasure to speak to her and she remembered my face for the second time which was months apart gave a homey type feel and was just amazing.

title: Looking for good customer service, don't bother with this place!
text: I would not recommend this hotel, unless you are looking for a prime location and that's it. The room was mediocre for the price and the staff was very inattentive and unhelpful. We stayed there for 5 days and 4 nights and we did not get anyone to answer the phone at the front desk until day 3. After someone did answer the phone, they told me that they would send someone up to the room and they never showed up. There was glitter on the bathroom counter top that never got removed. The faucet was rusted on the sink and the light between the bed that would normally be used for reading didn't work. No one in the entire hotel, but Antonio knew how to even turn the light on. The entertainment center that housed the refrigerator was on it's last leg!

title: Scratched and Dented, but convenient
text:
In all honestly, I had a free 1-night stay about to expire so we used it for a quick visit to NYC. We chose the Millennium for its location, and it looked very nice. It's fine. 

The location is great, check in was speedy, the elevators (lots of them ) zoom up and down at lighting speed. But the place has a worn look to it. I could tell at check in the front desk was messy, stains, chipped glass, etc. The room was the same. The furniture was scratched, dented. Our bedspread had a 7 inch rip in the center--it just look like it needs a make over. We probably won't go back as there are newer, more well kept hotels in the area at the same price point.

title: Last minute hotel
text: After a bad experience with airbnb we had to book millenium hotel. We absolutely loved it, Erin at the front desk was the best helping us out with booking and everything else. Hotel is just steps from times squares

title: Great stay
text:
We stayed 2 nights here after our boys Cooperstown baseball tournament. The hotel is right at the center of the Times Square so walking distance to many sites which was very convenient for our family.
We enjoyed our stay here with clean room, friendly staff (especially the doorman Lefon) and great service!

title: Great for family
text: 1st time traveling to NYC with a baby (4 mo) and was pleased with how accommodating the hotel and staff were for us and our baby. The hotel is in a perfect location for the multiple naps/changes we came back to the hotel for! Thx Daniel, Erika, Kayla, Shelley !

title: great position but also good quality
text: Clean, perfect location, nice space, big rooms. I found a great lobby that surprises me thinking about the price of the rooms. I got upgrated in king size room at no price. Great and clean, you have the gym 24/7

title: Excellent City View
text: The view it’s awesome and the cleaning at the room hotel it’s excellent.The customer service it’s excellent and the security in hotel it’s very good. The only concert it’s they don’t have any parking.

title: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!
text: HORRIBLE SERVICE: I am trying to reach the corporate office to file a complaint about our AWFUL experience. We are staying at the millennium hotel in New York and the service desk representatives were very rude. I called the front desk to extend my stay past the 2pm checkout. I asked for the price and it was higher than the previous night and they said we had to change rooms. I kindly asked if I could speak to the manager, and the rep said “What do you need to speak to a manager for? They can’t help you with any.” I responded can I please talk to one and the representative hung up on me. We went downstairs to talk to the manager and he did nothing to solve our issue. Besides the bad customer service, there are stains on the sheets and brown circles in the bathtub. The pictures online are VERY deceiving. Facebook will only let me upload that one picture. We were only trying to extend because we had to drive to New York from Maryland because of an emergency. I wish zero stars was an option!

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
I love this place, great staff and a beautiful view of the city.
Every time I am in New York City, this is my favorite place to stay. Good Parking garage across street. 
Great restaurant on the property. 
Millennium is the best hotel Times Square has to offer.
Daniel checked me in at the front desk, very kind and friendly.

title: The Worst!
text: With all these extra fees. I was told to freeze. The jacuzzi was broken. COVID-19 regulations aren't being followed. The staff are rude!! The guest hang out blocking the door to entrance of the hotel.

title: Disrespectful staff and Management
text: I overlooked all the negative reviews and booked a room here, due to the convenient location, to celebrate my daughter's 10 birthday.  I called the hotel the day before I left to confirm all the fees and deposits and I was told the deposit was $50 per day. I booked this room using a virtual credit card like I always do to keep my personal card info separate.  Upon arriving the first guest services guy told me I needed a physical card and he could not charge the card on file for the room.  (I'm still confused by that) He also told me the deposit was $100 per day. (Not what I had been told just the previous day) I politely asked to speak with the manager and it got worse. This lady began to tell me that none of the hotels in the area accept virtual cards and I was out of luck.  She then said they could do a credit card authorization form. I agreed however she took 3 steps and turned back and said "on second thought" they couldn't do that neither. I asked her specifically what I was suppose to do with my family.  Her response...."That's not my problem".  Luckily I was able to get online and found the Westin Hotel in Times Square, which did accept virtual cards by the way, and allowed me to book, did not charge a "resort fee" and the location was better.  The staff was amazing accommodating for my daughter's first time in NYC.  I would really reconsider booking with this hotel.  There are way better options in the same area.

title: Minimal Millennial
text: Ok this place looks good on the website and other online travel sites but this place really needs to be renovated in the worst way. It’s just old and dingy. It is close to time square so it does have that going for it and  the staff is nice. The walls are beat up, fixtures and furniture are really old.  The furniture will remind you of something you see at a garage sale.  When you walk into this hotel the lobby is kind of impressive but it is just lacking in serious upgrades. My family and I stayed in a suite and the lady at the front desk bragged how great the room was because we left one hotel to come to this one because our previous room was so bad. NYC needs to step up its game on hotels.

title: Nice Stay in Times Square!
text: First trip since covid and its safe to say it was amazing. Our host Syeda was very sweet and attentive. She gave us high floor as we requested. Hotel could definitely use renovation but our stay was amazing. Thank you syeda for your hospitality.

title: Don’t ignore the red flags
text:
Why it is important not to ignore the red flags. 

I read a lot of negative comments about this hotel, yet I chose to ignore them and decide for myself! Dumb me… Please don’t do my mistake. Consider all red flags…make informed decisions accordingly… Choose any other hotel other than this one! …I mean it Any! 

If you are planning a visit to NY and all what you care about is location and accessibility then ignore the above point and consider this hotel as an option l. If you have any sort of expectation… huge or minor ones, I would recommend getting anything else! 

The place is filthy, old and so outdated. No refrigerator (although I have requested for one 5 times), no coffee machine all accompanied by rude staff ( maybe it was my luck) but even their duty manager Nick is so unprofessional.

title: Great Staying with Amazing Staff !!!
text:
A charming 52-story hotel with a wonderful view. Clean and tidy, courteous and special service around the clock. the hotel facilities are slowly opening according to the city's regulations regarding Corona.
It will not hurt to renovate the rooms in the future... But in Bottom line, location, location, location! Times Square, Metro station and all the great shops right under your nose, with a very fair budget!  highly recommend!

title: A wonderful vacation in New York while staying at Millennium Times Square.
text:
The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and takes care of all your needs during your stay. Our room was spacious clean and a great view of Broadway. It is very close to everything around and the subway station and grand central are close by if you want to visit different places in New York. 
I would definitely come back to millennium for my next vacation in New York and will recommend it to my friends and family.

title: Get away weekend
text:
I traveled with my boyfriend and from the moment we arrived for the check-in the service from the staff was excellent specially from the front desk. The attention from Erin at the front desk was really good, and she was really patient and help us with directions every time. 
I would definitely recommend to stay at this hotel.

title: Amazing Stafff
text: Hotel itself was clean but the service was impeccable. Thanks to Syeda for answering all our questions. Everyone at the front desk was amazing and very accommodating. Thank you Millennium Team, we will definitely be back soon.

title: An amazing experience
text: This was my first time coming  here and it was such an amazing experience.   I advised them my daughter was turning 16 and they in return gave me gifts to surprise her with in her room.   My view of time square was everything.

title: Disappointed
text: The hotel is listed as a 4 star property, however many of its characteristics belong in the 3 star common USA motel category. The staff while not rude is not very helpful (I requested an internet revision for it not working and baggage storage at the checkout and both were ignored. There is no service whatsoever entering and exiting the hotel: anyone simply comes in or out as a stranger in a public space). The rooms are quite neglected: stains everywhere in the carpet and toilet, minor disrepairs everywhere (ceiling, faucets, furniture, etc). The area itself is noisy, dirty and messy, but that’s Times Square. During my 5 nights stay, 3 nights were without internet and they simply told me to wait and they didn’t know about the failure. For touristic purposes, the central location is good but any other hotel in the area has the same benefit. Because of the busy area and several elevators out of service, many times I had to wait in line for several minutes to go to my floor. For this price I’d suggest to go somewhere else.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Decided to take a trip to NY for our anniversary with the kids. Arrived at the hotel before check in time. There was a line but it moved quickly. Syeda helped us get a room 2 hours before check in time and gave us a upgrade for our anniversary, along with some chocolates and coloring books for the kids. She was very helpful and detailed with everything. Room was a bit old but had amazing views. Overall I loved the hotel and the service. Will definitely come back.

title: Daughters 16th birthday in NY!
text: This hotel is amazing and their service is even better. Syeda checked us in, she was amazing. Gave my daughter chocolate for her birthday and also gave us a room with view on the higher floor. She also made sure i was satisfied with my room. Thank you Millenium and Syeda for making my daughter’s birthday memorable.

title: Daniel was awesome !!
text: Daniel provided me and my fiancée the best quality of service. He was funny, cheerful and professional. We’ve been coming to this hotel quite often lately, and I can comfortably say that meeting Daniel was delightful! Thank you so much, Happy Pride !!!

title: Good for location only
text: I took my son for a trip to DC and NYC after visiting family. The lobby of this hotel is very nice and in a great location if you want to be in the mix of NYC. I was shocked when I walked into the room though. Everything seemed very old and dated. Furniture was broken. The sheets were scratchy. The comforter was so thin that I ended up using 2 towels as extra blankets. There was mold all over the ceiling in the bathroom. Rust on the door frame. Water damage on the ceiling. Bubbled and peeling wallpaper. A ridiculous amount of dust on the vent in the bathroom. Stale smell. Everyone who worked there was very nice though. Also, just a note for awareness, there is an entrance to this hotel on BOTH 44th and 45th streets, and the public is allowed to use the entrances to go from one street to the other. At night a hotel employee checks for key cards by the elevators to make sure no guests aren’t going up. I gave this hotel 2 stars only because of the location and service.

title: The hotel is not prepared for guest.
text: Checked in last night, room 5201 , 1 bedroom suite, great view of times square and the empire state building. That is where the amenities stop. This morning only decaf in the room, no water. I called down to front desk, 30 minutes later still nothing. I then tried to order room service, nothing. We should have been told this before we arrived. A 52 story hotel with no room service? then I tried to call down to the restaurant, again no answer, so you can not order food I guess. I will try and contact the manager Mark Irgang later today. Again, when you pay almost $400 a night for a room you expect good service.

title: First family trip to NY
text: We stayed 6 days in the hotel, to start our flight was delayed and we made it after midnight for our check-in. Our room was saved no issues during the process. The area is great right in time Square within 2 blocks there is a Subway station, no issues with our room A/C work, TV, and we had hot showers every morning. When it was time for our check-out Syed gave us an extra hour that helped us to do our last minute souvenirs shopping. Overall we had a great time and the hotel made it easy to move around and have a nice sleep.

title: top location next on times square
text: There were no fridge ,mini bar,cattle ,glasses and enough towel in the room,also no breakfast option,staff was not very kind.They refused to order taxi for us and suggested we go on the street and to find by our self.Otherwise top location next to times square,the room was fine

title: First Time in NYC!
text: Beautiful Lobby, we were checked in by syeda. she is amazing. She checked us in right away and also gave us a upgrade. Awesome service. Room is a bit old so 3 out of 5 but service 7 out of 5! Thank you again Syeda!

title: This hotel met all of my needs and exceeded my expectations
text:
My room was large and very comfortable.  The view on the 39th floor was great.  I saw the entire area.  It was very close to the 42nd st subway which got me everywhere and there was a wonderful diner a block down 44th Street.  The Red Flame Diner and coffee House.  I went every day.  Best breakfast ever and the staff was wonderful.
The city was just opening up and many Covid restrictions were still in effect but they worked very hard to meet all your needs.  
Check in and check out was a breeze.  I will go there again.

title: Raquel w/Millennium Times Square New York
text: Our first time to New York couldn’t have went better. Most of that was because of Raquel. She gave us great tips and advice on how to get around and when to go. She was amazing and really took her time to make sure we had the best experience. She was so nice and really cared. She went above and beyond her job. Thank you Raquel!

title: Eva's 9th bday trip
text: Daniel was awesome at the front desk, the hotel itself was clean, the room was missing some lights and a fridge, but other than that I would give service 6 out of 5 stars, the hotel itself 4 out of 5.

title: 20th Wedding Anniversary Family Vaca
text:
Our stay was originally supposed to be at Row NYC but 20 minutes from arriving we received an email stating our reservation had been canceled. Apparently, the hotel was closed. With the Lincoln tunnel quickly approaching I grabbed my phone and opened google maps to find another hotel, the Millennium Hotel was my first choice due to its location. 

While on the phone with reservations I explained to her that we needed room to accommodate 3 people with 1 in a wheelchair. I wanted to book a room with 2 queen beds for the 3 of us. She said they couldn't guarantee the room would be accessible but we could get 2 rooms with king beds or a suite with 1 king bed and a couch. 2 rooms were out of the question so we reluctantly booked the suite on the 51st floor. 

Pros:
LOCATION!
This hotel is located steps from Times Square and 15 - 20 minutes walking distance from Rockefeller Center, The Empire State Building, and The Edge all the places we wanted to visit. The hotel lobby was very clean and the staff was very nice. Our bed was very comfortable even though 3 people had to sleep in it. The suite was big enough that our daughter could navigate in the room. The views from the 51st floor looking down on the city below were nice. We could see Times Square where the ball drops. We heard no noise from our neighbors. The linens were clean. Discounted parking was offered. Bottled water left in the room daily.

Con's:
They wouldn't let us get a room with 2 queen-size beds because our daughter was in a wheelchair. The toilets were far too low for an average person. Occasional sirens sounds from streets below. The mini-fridge is super small. The second bathroom could use a shelf to hold toiletries. Bathrooms not wheelchair accessible however this didn't matter to us since we transfer our daughter from her wheelchair to bed or toilet. The cost of our stay was a bit more than what we had budgeted for so we only stayed 2 nights.

All in all, we had a pleasant stay and would stay here again. Thank you Millennium for making our stay memorable.

title: Family vacay in the Big Apple
text:
Daniel helped us at check in. He was super nice and made us feel welcomed. We arrived at 11pm and we had two rooms. They were clean and we slept comfy after hours on our flight. 
It is located at the heart of times of Times Square. Will definitely come again! Thanks Daniel for helping us check in!

Family vacay

title: lobby looked amazing, room looked like a dive room
text: Kristen in reservations has no clue about the hotel, she's at the central location. no parking associate with the hotel. my room was very dirty. pounds and pounds of dust bunnies.  The A/C system in the room was luke cold at best. i left it on the lowest setting for 2 days and was so so cold. the bed had a nasty stain, they did offer me a new room at 930pm when i told them of my issues but i was so exhausted i just wanted to go to bed. so we agreed on a late checkout which turned into a total crap shoot.  checkout went from 11 to 230pm. i was happy. at 206pm they called asking me if i was leaving at 220pm i house keeper came to my room and asked if i was leaving.  we left at 230 as agreed.  this is a 4 star hotel maybe for location, but accommodations and how your treated is a zero star.  im currently sitting at a super 8 in CT. and my room is sooo clean. makes the Millennium room look filthy.   I emailed corporate, lets see how they fix this issue.  more to come.......

title: Tanbir
text: Very friendly and helpful . Pleased with how easy check in was.  Will definitely be back. He was the best and well spoken when we walked in and very attentive to help us get checked in accordingly and efficiently.

title: Bravo!!
text: We have nothing but good to say about our time. Syed (at the front desk) went above and beyond, then even further yet to make sure we were taken well care of. All around exceeded our expectations, especially given the pandemic. We will absolutely return.

title: Exceptional Customer Service!
text: Lobby is beautiful. Arrived few hours before check in time expecting to wait for hours but this lovely front desk lady name syeda was able to find a room for us right away. She was very helpful and answered all our questions. She also checked up on us after few minutes of check in to see if we needed anything and if we were satisfied with our room. We will definitely come back.

title: Definitely Stay
text: My stay was very enjoyable!  The staff was very accommodating especially Syed. Syed was very nice.  He made sure we were able to check in early. He gave us good recommendations on dining. Syed had a good attitude even with the Memorial Day weekend crowd. Also, an employee by the name of Angel was also very helpful with instructing us with navigating through Time Square. Overall, excellent stay and I will definitely stay again.

title: Visit at millennium times square
text:
Everything good, but the attention of Syed at reception was exceptional. 
Good housecleaning and services very good. 

Beds a little old, as well as pillows and carpet. Bathroom was also broken. 

Good a/c. Good tv.

title: Filthy hotel
text: I have stayed at this hotel in previous years when it was owned by Hilton. We've always had a great stay here. Knowing this, I booked an overnight stay w/ my family 2 nights ago. It is listed on Expedia as a 4-star hotel and was still called Millenium Premier a Hilton Hotel on their website. As soon as I paid, I received a confirmation email that stated "We are no longer owned by Hilton, but we strive to their same standards of service." This couldn't be more of a case of false advertising if they tried. We checked in around 7 pm and went up to our room. I could NOT believe how gross the room was (pictures provided below). 4-star hotels are supposed to have nicer than usual furnishing. The dresser and nightstand looked like someone found it in the trash. The door was falling off the dresser, and they removed the mini fridge from all rooms. I had bought milk for my son, and had to keep getting ice so it didn't go bad overnight. Not one plastic cup to use, or any glasses that hotels usually have. The carpet was so filthy I wouldn't let my children walk around w/out their shoes on. There were no wash cloths provided in the bathrooms. The A/C didn't work well at all. The mold & mildew in the shower was out of control. The faucet in bathroom sink moved every time you turned it on. We wanted to check our bags in the morning and were told they don't provide that service. I have never had this happen at any hotel I've stayed in in NYC. I would NEVER stay here again and advise anyone looking for comfort, cleanliness at a 4-star hotel to look elsewhere. I also complained about the situation and was told they would address my concerns. I never heard from anyone about my complaints.

title: Corrupted hotel more interested in making a quick dollar than the safety of their guests.
text: Everything went well u til the check out. Worse experience ever. Our flight is tonight and we needed a place to store our bags. The hotel sent us to the dirtiest, unsafe creepiest luggage storage we have experience. OEG storage should be called OMG!!! The bags are not kept in lockers, the place is dark and dirty. To that ,you will have the most unprofessional service from some random lady who doesn't even give you the courtesy to look at you when you talk to her. Millennium hotel shouldn't send its customers to such unsafe place who doesn't even respect the  covid 19 hygiene protocol. My mom felt so uncomfortable we left the place. Outside in the heat, we look for another storage company and lucky enough we found CBH storage which is recommended by grand central. The place was literally accross the street from the filthy storage Millennium agent sent us to.. The check in was seamless.and bags are kept in lockers. It sucks that at the end of our trip we had to deal with such poor recommendation.

title: Terrible room
text:
Rooms smelled very bad, carpet dirty, bathroom walls paint peeling out from walls, not worthy for that type of money.
Door room didn’t work, back and for to lobby, rooms looks like back 70’, windows no sound proof

title: Best upscale short stay in Time Square
text:
This hotel used to be a jewel in time square.  Checked in only to find out it is no longer affiliated with Hilton. (Red flag).   Checked in around 11:30pm took 40 min to check in after a long days work.

Most in line without reservations/ looking for a late night place to romp.  The room is outdated.  My room smelled like weed.  No face towels.  I could not get a good rest beds and pillows suck.  I checked out at 5am. 

Avoid this hotel it is not what it used to be. Need upgrades and renovation. It caters to the late night revelers now and a few unsuspecting tourist.

There are alot of better places to stay in Time Square.

title: Great hotel.
text: Great hotel. Would recommend. Perfect location lots of stores and restaurants around the area. Probably would be returning. Best New York experience. Beautiful hotel. Rooms great size and comfortable beds.

title: Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at.
text: Found at least 6 different food items on the floor. Wet paper towel on bathroom floor, blood on wall. Called desk prior to stay and no answer. Called when found the food and no answer. There were no keys for the room either until next day.

title: Only location is good
text: My stay was not enjoyable. Very basic room with no coffee machine or tea bags to make tea coffee. Check out is att 11 and not possible to add a single hour or keep the bags unless paying extra and moving to another location.

title: Stay away!
text: As a longtime Hilton Rewards member, I have always loved the comfort that you all provided until this most recent trip to NYC. This hotel shouldn’t even be considered apart of the Hilton brand honestly, and was by far my worst Hilton experience ever. Traveling with my kids, I was greeted with a pungent odor of marijuana throughout the hotel, especially on our floor and surrounds rooms. The smell was so loud that it gave my kids a headache and I was honestly afraid we would get second hand high. Throughout our stay, it seemed as though the walls were paper thin as we couldn’t sleep due to yelling and screaming from neighboring guest in their rooms or hallways. When that wasn’t keeping us up the loud vents would take over making it difficult to sleep. The interior was extremely outdated but the bathroom drain was coming out and looked molded and gross. No hairdryer and lack of basic amenities that took over an hour to finally get delivered to the room, after calling 4 or more times. We also would have to wait 10 minutes or longer in the mornings to get down from our rooms as the elevator seemed to be working on 2 functioning elevators which with covid was a problem since it was encouraged to limit the amount of people in an elevator at a time. Overall, not a very great experience. Hopefully, there will be something done to help compensate for this experience.

title: Sooo dated!
text: When on a staycation, you would want to escape your reality... this is not the place to stay.  Stains on furnitures, cramped, linens doesn't smell fresh at all.  The location is great...but the hotel itself is not the staycation or vacation spot that you want to be in.

title: Spacious & accommodating.
text:
My room was quiet with a 27 floor city view. If you politely ask, they can bring to your room a mini fridge and coffee maker. My stay was long term and keeping some snacks/beverages nearby was a delite. They surprised you with room service efficiency. I wasn’t gone for long and came back to a clean room and made bed. With the mess in my room , I made sure to give a thank you card to house keeping. I had minor discrepancy with a lost item but the hotel has been fully transparent in communication. I appreciate their efforts. Thought I was going to have a longer stay, but didn’t . So the process of canceling reservation  and refunding money was a breeze.  Thank you for the free coffee I stay well caffeinated.

-Tyler

title: DIRTY ONE
text: I dunno. Maybe because they are located in timed square and there a lot of drug addicts and homeless people coming in and out of the hotel lobby. Had a bad experience there. My first night I showered in an ice cold water coz warm ones doesn’t work. I moved to the other room the next day and the pillow has blood in it.

title: Beware of this Hilton
text: I am a Hilton Diamond member and have never written a Hilton review.  The lobby looks great in the photo.  Our room was outdated with chipped paint, stained carpet and an old bath.  It was very clean, except the window was very dirty.  Hilton should be embarrassed.  Bring you sleep machine because 33 floors up was very noisy due to the Times Square location.

title: Great location but everything else was not up to standard. Not again!
text:
The hotel is located basically directly on Times Square so in terms of location there is nothing to complain. Perfect!
Check in experience was overall very fast…but difficult. They have added a screen for COVID which is normally but that was done in such a way that completely seals the staff off from the guest. That makes it absolutely impossible to hear. Only the little opening on the bottom allowed me to hear the staff on the other side. Sorry but that’s not done well!
The lobby is really not that big and there is enough security everywhere. And yet I saw a lot of people without a mask on. There is no excuse for this!!
They have a limited number of elevators causing a bit of an “elevator traffic jam” every now and then. Only 2 people or 1 family allowed. This was violated all the time! Again nobody from hotel security checking this.
After they finish cleaning the room they seal it. Nice touch but honestly a bit too much if you ask me personally The room is really old. Should have been renovated a few years ago. In terms of room size it’s small but that’s NYC standard. Just renovate please!

title: Better off somewhere else
text: No fridge that we were promised. One blanket for 2 beds and every time we tried to get some one to fix it we would get transferred and no one would answer the phone. If given the opportunity I wouldn’t stay here. I wouldn’t stay here again. You would think with all the regulations due to covid ppl would actually pay more attention. Don’t stay here it’s not worth it.

title: Nada que ver con las fotos
text: Fotos engañosas, hotel con olores muy fuertes a marihuana, humedad y viejo. No había servicio de comida. Si está muy bien ubicado pero en general no regresaría. Tres noches y nunca sacaron la basura, tienes que avisar en el Lobby si quieres que te limpien el cuarto. No recomendado para personas que viajan en familia

title: Will definitely be my new spot
text: The place was very clean, safe, comfy, calm although it’s located in a very popular plot. My room was beyond my expectations but it  just missing a microwave and fridge that’s why I took them some points off. However I have finally found somewhere that’ll be like a home to me.

title: Time Square New York City
text: Visited NYC for 2 nights and stayed at the Millennium Times Square New York. We stayed on the 41 floor with a New York Sky line room which was extremely enjoyable, however a backdrop room would of been better for first visitors. Our stay was really great. Showers were nice and had plenty of hot water for 3 of us. Hotel was very accommodating when we asked for blow dryer and cups. Check in was smooth and parking for a fee wasn't bad at all and a block away. Check out was smooth as well And front desk gal was very nice...thank you Syeda. We used subway with ease and local deli across street was awesome. Great experience and will definitely come again!! Lu-Anne from Boston...

title: My worst staycation ever
text:
It qwas a very bad experience staycation while pandemic. And for me, it was my worst 2 nights stay upon arrival in nyc.

Suppoused to be it was my surprise honeymoon for my husband. But it didnt succesful at all, because he said how come a service of hotel become like this. 

How come!!!
I paid for usd 377, feels like We stay at 2 star hotel.

Really bad service.
I work in tourism industry in indonesia. 
I’ve been stayed in a lot of hotel, especially hilton group. 

But this is the worst hilton group.

title: Look somewhere else!
text: I had a very poor experience here last week. The rooms are old and dirty. Obviously it wasn’t vacuumed , because the floor was dirty and the coffee table had sticky stains on it. The bathrooms don’t have a fan. The windows were dirty ( and I was paying for a Times Square view , mind this). They didn’t let us store the luggage after check out and they couldn’t do a late check out for us either, which caused a lot of trouble for us and paying extra 50$ to leave a carry-on and a backpack. This was a simple bracelet which had mostly emotional value for me. Yet was never found. title: A stay you wished never happened
text:
My wife and I travel to New York City every few months as my wife doctors at Mount Sinai Hospital in NYC. 
We normally drive into the city at least a day or so prior to her tests and doctor appointments in hopes of exploring different areas of the city we usually don’t stay in the same hotel On each travel. We usually base our stay on a particular area that we want to see or visit usually we don’t have much time to do so but at least you get a little taste of a different area every time. So far is our Stegos at the hotel we checked in around 5:00 PM give or take. We had dinner reservations that night to meet with friends so we took our bags up to the room and left rather quickly to meet with our friends.
We had a great dinner at Gallagher's!! 
After dinner we hung out with our friends and explored the Times Square area. When we returned back to our hotel it was really the first time where we could start checking out our room, I probably should’ve called and complained what we’re really not the type of people looking for discounts or freebies.
When getting off the elevator the hallways on the 40th floor reeked of marijuana so strong you would’ve sworn they used it as an air freshener😬 so getting back to the room there were cigarette burns just about on every piece of furniture with varnish and paint chips missing off of every piece of furniture in the room also there were cigarette burns on the carpeting on the toilet seat and stains on the carpet. Needless to say about hair clung to the shower walls. In hindsight we should’ve really complained but I was afraid of getting A room impossibly less satisfactory conditions and with it being so late my wife’s appointments at the hospital the next morning start at 7o’clock so we did not want to go through any of that.

Senator Amadou Thiam

title: NYC
text:

title: Best location/ middle of time square
text: This is the best location for time square, you are literally right is the center. Price is extremely good for this location. Given its Covid the city was not very busy at all so might justify the price.

title: Stay was alright.
text: Alright to stay at the most, the location of this hotel is its only saving grace. The hotel is in the heart of time square, so the ease of access to most of the entertainment was incredible. But the hotel itself is nothing to brag about.

title: Terrible 🤮
text:

If someone wants to ignore hygiene than only , they can go ahead . The location is great no doubt but the ambience & the rooms are pathetic . The amnesties were also not complete, no microwave, no coffee maker , no breakfast.

title: Great Experience!
text: We decided to stay an extra night in NYC after staying two nights at another hotel.  Our front desk agent, Syeela (I'm sorry if that is spelled incorrectly) was super friendly and she went out of her way to make our check in and stay above our expectations.  The location was pretty great and our room on the 41st floor facing Times Square was perfect for my girlfriends first trip to NYC.  We will stay at this property again and having staff like Syeela is a smart way to keep your guests happy.

title: Fair Hotel/Was Okay
text:
I have visited this hotel with my family during our trip to NY. I was with high hopes that the hotel would be very high end due to the cost of the rooms. There are some pros and cons. 
Pros: 
- The staff was very friendly and attentive towards allowing us check in and check out. 
- They have staff that are there to check and see if people have a key to their room for safety reasons during late night time. 
- It is super close to Times Square and is super convenient for shoppers and visitors. 
- Over all the hotel was family friendly and was okay but not perfect. 
- They ensure to have the rooms sanitary for each guest. (Some what okay)  
Cons: 
- The rooms are furnished with old furniture that are a bit run down. 
- Some lamps did not work and very little outlets were available. 
- The washroom was clean but the air vents were full of dust and not wiped down. 
- No extra toilet rolls were offered or water were left daily in the room. ( two water bottles are given daily, however you need to go get them at the gift store. They are just regular nestle water bottles) 
- Over all the rooms were fair but still could be more new and functional as advertised in their photos.

The review is lengthy but I wanted to kinda share over all the hotel was not super bad or super good. It was a 3/5 with some room for improvement. It’s NY and you get what you pay for. But it is a good place to stay if you are only looking for a bed to sleep in.

title: Roach on bed! Staff was inappropriate regarding what to do next.

title: Wonderful Customer Service
text: Booked hotel last minute.   price was very reasonable. She really went above and beyond and did not for one second act like we were a bother with so many questions.   It was delightful to see someone genuinely care for her customers!!! title: Do NOT stay here!
text: If you look in my past reviews you can see that I gave this hotel a great review just a year and a half ago.  All I can say is that things can change very quickly! We booked a ball drop room, as you can see from the photo of our view, the only ball you can see is the reflection of it from another building a few blocks over.  But honestly that was the VERY LEAST of the problems.  We arrived late in to the hotel, the halls to the room smelled horrid. Once we entered the room we felt we had just walked in to a motel 6 on the bad side of town.  Everything was sticky, cracked, scratched, or just beaten up.  There was only one surge protector for plugging in phones, no lamp on the night stand, no clock, and the desk phone was static filled.  Trash strewn behind the furniture and under the beds.  Our smoke detector started beeping in the middle of the night and we were told they could dismantle it or we would just have to hear it because they couldn't do anything in the middle of the night?!?! WHAT?!?!  We were also told that housekeeping would not be entering our room due to Covid but if we wanted them they would come.  We had preferred not to have them enter while we were staying however we came back from being away and our room was made up. Tub and toilet were disgusting, drawers and cabinets wouldn't close because they were broken.  I really cannot say anything positive about this hotel.

title: Terrible
text: I am absolutely shocked and appalled that this is a Hilton establishment. I booked through Hilton’s website using my member points and reserved a deluxe king room with a Manhattan skyline view for 2 nights. Upon arrival, there was a beer spill in the lobby that didn’t have a caution sign up. At check-in I was told I had been “upgraded” to a ball drop view. I arrived after 10pm and I was tired so I thought, “fine. No biggie.” The elevators are shaky and the hall smells stale and musty. Upon entering the room (3710) I thought I was in a roach motel! The carpet is so badly stained, the tub is disgusting and the walls are filthy!!! There is no mini fridge (the place where the fridge should be is just dusty). The “ball drop view” is covered in film from an uncleaned window. The pillows are so overused they are literally flat. My room is attached to another with a screaming baby on the other end. Even the TV didn’t work! I quickly went back down to the front desk to ask for another room and was told they had nothing else available. I ended up staying the night because it was late but I woke up early the next morning and immediately booked another hotel. I would rather forfeit the cost of my second night then to remain in this absolute dump!!!

title: This is a BATES MOTEL not a Hilton
text: If there was a zero option for rating that’s what this hotel would receive. To start off I booked my stay through the Hilton website because I am a Hilton employee myself and I know Hilton standards are very high and I thought I could trust any Hilton hotel, until I arrived here. We had a red eye flight into the city so we arrived at 6am at the hotel exhausted and ready to hit the bed. Upon walking into the hotel it was a ghost town there was nobody inside to greet you and it was super out dated. After yelling hello and few times someone from the back came out to help. I had booked 2 rooms in one reservation thinking they would be conjoining rooms. I was wrong they gave me two separate rooms not conjoining. So when I finally got the key and we headed up the elevator to our floor it sounded like the elevators were going to break any second. After arriving inside of our hotel room we felt like we were inside of a horror movie. The room was nothing like the pictures, the beds were hard as a rock, and on top of it all, the were dirty and definitely not cleaned. There was a dirty q-tip on the floor there was confetti all along the floor and it looked like stains of blood on the wall. We lasted 1 hour before one of us got bit by something laying down and then saw a cockroach run across the room. We booked a different hotel because as tired as we were we couldn’t even stand one more second of this room. Forgot to mention that I had went downstairs to request if they had conjoining rooms since that’s what we thought they would be when you book two rooms together, they ignored our request after I had also mentioned to them that the second room did not have the clean stay sticker on the door as if it was not sanitized prior to our arrival and seeing our first room the way it was we didn’t even enter the second room. I will never book this hotel due to the sketchiness, hotel staff, and dirtiness.

title: Okay a little disappointing
text: Out of all the Hilton hotels available if you have better expectations skip this hotel. No outlets available for charging if the bathroom counts.  Alarm clock did not work. Older property. Room was dark. No sufficient lighting.

title: Syeda at the front desk was super helpful!
text:
On initial entry of our room, my boyfriend and I were quite disappointed. The room did not meet expectations from photos- and given, it was listed as a "4-star" hotel. It was worn down w/ peeling wallpaper, things falling off the wall, no additional amenities like a mini fridge.

However, we spoke to Syeda at the front desk and she was able to accommodate us and make us as comfortable as she could. She moved us to a bigger room and was super friendly and helpful throughout our trip. Go to her if you need some assistance! 

Overall, location and service (from Syeda in particular) were the only highlights of this stay.

title: A great place to stay
text: I’ve stayed there 5 ethos past year. It gets better each time. The staff is personable cordial friendly and takes care of your every need.  Particularly Tiffany H and Antonio! The room are nice size and the views are to die for. Location location location is by far the best every. I will stay nowhere else but there when I return in a couple of months!!!! title: My first trip to New York
text: I was nervous because not only was it my first trip to New York I was also getting lipo from a plastic surgeon near this hotel. Room was nice and comfortable . Monique was very helpful and nice. She made me feel at ease. Always greeted my son and I on our way in or out the hotel. Great price to be steps away fromGood Morning America studio. title: terrible management and customer service.. BEWARE!!!!
text: took almost an hour to check in, only 1 front desk clerk with a line of 60+ people tightly lined up in front of check in window (not sure how this is covid friendly) Sue was the front desk clerk who assisted us and was understandably overwhelmed while her manager Erhald Sula quickly stepped out front but didnt offer her any help. Erhald Sula (the overnight manager) wouldnt even give me his name or card, the NYPD officer present was the one who had to enforce Erhald to give me his info, the officers also couldnt believe what was going on and suggested I contact the Better Business Bureau, so that should give you an idea of the crap show theyre running at Millennium Times Square New York (not to be confused with the Millennium Premier hotel) Its a shame because its a beautiful hotel with a great location.. BEWARE

title: Service lacking
text:
Location of this hotel is excellent. It is a bit worn down, but that is expected for such a busy area. The views, while not quite was is promised, they are OK because it's in the heart of Time Square so there really isn't a bad view, I just wish they would be transparent about the fact that views are from the back of the main time square and obstructed by another building. 

My biggest issue is that they NEVER answer the phone. I tried calling several times prior to trip with questions, nothing. We had issues during stay like broke AC, broke remote, not enough towels and you have to go to front desk and wait in line EVERY time. Also, they wont' hold luggage, so don't arrive before check in unless you have a place to store your luggage. They told us they would call us when our room was ready, but no one ever called. We went back around 4:00 and our room was ready. I asked if they tried to call us when room was ready and they said no.  Also, we told them the air was broken and they said "I know, just open the window." 

I would not recommend staying here. I am going to answer no to the telephone question since it is useless when they will NEVER answer the phone.

title: Location great, would have been better if you slept in a box on curb.
text: Literally the entire stay was horrible. The only thing this hotel has going for itself is the location. You truly are in Times Square. Cleanliness was not held to an acceptable standard. Over crowed and loud!

title: Dirty, old, disappointing,  overpriced
text:
i was honestly disappointed in this hotel. i was expecting an amazing hotel that was super clean and updated. 

unfortunately that was not the case. the bathroom was cleaned mediocre, the tiles in the shower seemed dirty. 

there was dirt along the base board in the bathroom and the lighting decorations were covered in thick dust. there was yellow stuff on the corner of the wall in the bathroom. 
the rooms were not updated. the phone looked like it was from the 90's. there was no mini fridge. 

the room was quite small. i am very disappointed in this stay.

title: Excellent customer service - Syed at front desk
text: Syed was an excellent help. He was eager to make our stay as comfortable as possible. He responded to my requests and when I requested an early check-in he accommodated me kindly. For those whose reviews are really low really need to accept that you get what you pay for. Is this the best hotel in all of NYC? Nope. But do you get what you pay for? Absolutely. Also, the price / night included FREE parking, which is uncalled for at other hotels (you're looking at an additional $50-65/night parking). Also, the location is amazing: you walk out and are immediate in Times Square. The amenities at the hotel are pretty much non-existent (no fridge/microwave/pool - you get an iron/iron board). Our room was clean with a nice view. So yes, it's not the 'best' and most 'luxurious' hotel there is, but honestly for what I PAID for/NIGHT, I wasn't expecting much and frankly I got my money's worth.

title: Went Downhill.......now a 2 star hotel
text: We went this past weekend and not good. We have stayed here many times before including during the pandemic.  If you buy the hotel from a third party they give you the old rooms. Then at 9pm , a large line formed in lobby of people checking in and no bus around. Not sure what was up (Gov housing for night?) but from 10pm-5AM nothing but teen kids running the halls with out supervision in their rooms, yelling , and smoking pot. The whole floor was was one smoked up mess with the kids going from floor to floor. I guess people either used their stimulas check on spring break in city hotel or some sort of housing for the night. The staff downstairs didnt know what to say or how to control this. When you put rooms at $65 a night, you get a different type of hotel. The owners need to do something fast about this or you will loose the regular customers that have used the hotel multiple times. We will not be back until things improve in NYC. PS- many restaurants and hotels still closed so nothing for people to do except drink/smoke at night. We were offered multiple times to buy drugs. The homelessness and garbage in streets is upsetting to see. I would suggest downtown by Freedom tower, did not see any of this last month down there.

title: The most subpar Hilton property I have ever stayed at
text:
Avoid this hotel. Their advertisement is the epitome of misleading. I booked a one night stay to celebrate St. Patrick’s Day and was immediately disappointed upon arrival to the room. It is nothing like the photos shown online. Basic amenities like a refrigerator and coffee machine were nowhere to be found. Housekeeping and the front desk do not answer the phone. The bathroom was very poorly maintained and is in dire need of renovation. The rug was stained and very torn up, almost as if someone had driven a lawnmower across it. 
As someone who has been a Hilton customer for many years, I was very let down by this hotel. I do not recommend this hotel and have no plans to stay at it again.

title: Terrible
text: I arrived and they had given my reserved room to someone else and did not want to give me refund not ever coming back!!! Then they had my bank card blocked. Also the line was super long and they had no parking very gross people don’t follow distance rules.

title: I’m coming back
text: I had wonderful stay here at the Millennium New York due to the wonderful employee syeda front desk was great. Wow we had some issues and she was so helpful and  accommodating which made this stay  so much more enjoyable . It was my moms birthday and we was to have two double beds but when we got here it was one queen and my sister and I could not sleep confortable  with all three in the bed  and this employee syeda stepped in and made us feel welcomed and special .  anything else that has happened is minor because the customer service was excellent. Thank you syeda you rock

title: Mini Getaway at Millennium
text:
Cons:- Room is old, furniture is scratched.
Pros:- Service, location, amazing views, decent size room.
I was given complimentary upgrade to king with a view which was amazing. Shout out to syeada for making our stay memorable.

title: Terrible
text:
We stayed at The Millennium Times Square for a nearby conference. The rooms were not great. No shower fan.  The linen must have been a decade old. When we called the front desk or concierge no one EVER answered. They didn’t even leave water bottles in the room. No refridgerator. There was a domestc fight next to our room.
