Someone finally answered from Hilton customer service Michael. He put us on hold and tried to reach The Millennium. After 10 minutes he told us that no one picked up and there was basically nothing he could do. After 5 hours we got through to another customer service rep who just transferred us back to The Millennium even though we explained what was going on. Of course the phone just kept ringing. Still no resolution. AWEFUL customer service. Very unexpected experience from the Hilton. Do not stay here. And I question Hilton’s ability to off 
ER any customer service at all. So frustrated!!!

title: stay away from this hotel - it should not be labeled as Hilton

picture looks deceiving. dated room. bathroom ceiling and floor leaking stains. 
I stayed there last night. I pick millennium times square for its location and good price. But it turned out to be a nightmare because no front desk response to call to stop noise from next door.

title: HORRIBLE HOTEL
text: Hotel didn’t look anything like photos. The rooms were very outdated and extremely dirty . We didn’t feel comfortable sleeping in the bed. Service was terrible. I also received extra charges on my credit card for no reason . I would not visit this hotel again!

title: Horrible customer service. Rip off/ charged for a room that was never used
text:
I used my credit card for a family member on February 23rd. I had to do this online as no one answered the phone even after several times calling. I booked a queen room for this family member. This family member was traveling from Texas, missed their connection and had no cash or credit or debit card on them. Customer service does not answer. 
Accounting voicemail is full. 
DO NOT STAY HERE. Scam artist.

title: Terrible hotel
text:
We booked a city view king deluxe room for a few days of meetings in town. The photos are entirely misleading, and it's been a very frustrating stay.

Our room is old. Our headboard is severely broken, and there are nails and staples on our king-size bed. We checked into an "enhanced cleaned room", yet we found a red balloon on the floor, a stained rug and walls, and semi-used bottles for bathroom amenities. 

There is NO COFFEE or water in the room or ANYWHERE in the hotel's common areas, and the restaurant is closed. There were no hospitality umbrellas to borrow nor any bellhops in the lobby. The wifi does not work, and there is no one to help with anything at all!

title: Once premier is now disappointing.
text:
I chose this since it was close to my favorite bagel place and the Lincoln tunnel so I could make a quick exit out of NYC in the morning on the way home, plus I had never stayed here on my many other trips to the city so I thought I would give it a try.  My bad for not reading the reviews before booking..  The first thing I noticed was how dated the hotel was, especially my room.  The carpet is old as was the room furniture.  The room was a good size for NYC and the windows did a decent job of restricting city noise.  While the bed was comfortable the pillows were the most uncomfortable pillows I have ever encountered at a Hilton property and I have been traveling for work for over 8 years.  The toilet set mounting bracket was broken and several of the window curtain mounting points were also broken.  There was also no alarm clock in the room.

Unlike most other Hilton properties there was no Covid clean tag on the door nor was the TV remote control wrapped indicating it had been cleaned.  I don't even recall the standard Hilton Covid stickers on the bathroom mirror.

A family member told me that this was once a premier hotel in NYC but clearly those days have long since gone.

title: Great Location. Terrible hotel
text: When I booked a room here from 2/12/2021 to 2/14/2021 on Expedia I was under the impression I was booking for the Double Tree by Hilton a few minutes away from this hotel, maybe I misread where that was followed by The Millennium. Anyway, when we arrived to check in as I waited in line 4 guests came downstairs to complain about complications with their rooms. I was immediately concerned. "low water pressure, brown water coming from the sink, no heat/ac, dirty sheets". One guest even demanded a refund and left a few minutes after checking in because her thermistat didn't work and they wouldn't send maintence to help her or answer her calls at the front desk. Upon checking in the lady at the front desk informed me that although I booked and paid in advance for a Queen suite they were all sold out of those rooms and proceeded to change my reservation to a double bed suite.. whatever at this point I'm already here so I accepted it. I get up to the room the windows have smeared hand marks allover them, the remote for the tv had dried sauce or food stuck to it, the shower had hair leftover from the previous guest, the water pressure was very low and the drain stopper was broken and coming out from the tub, I was very skeeved out, plus.. we're in a pandemic, things should have been spotless. Luckily the bed was comfortable and the tv had netflix. When we were getting ready to go check out on Sunday we waited 30 minutes, possibly longer for an elevator. We were on the 29th floor. There were signs on the wall that stated only 2 people per elevator due to covid. Each elevator that did come had at least 6 people in it. Not worth the money, if you pay for parking with the hotel you're better off parking on the street or paying a parking garage directly. The hotel gives you one parking voucher, if you decide to take your car out at any point you then have to pay full price to re park, they also send you to a parking garage 4 blocks away. Needless to say, we won't be going back.

title: Romantic Valentine’s Day Weekend
text:
We stayed in room 3410. The window had numerous forehead prints on the window in different sizes and height, which can only mean that the room was not thoroughly cleaned and must have been overlooked numerous times. 
The smell of marijuana in our room was overwhelming, even with the attempt to  mask the smell with some sort of odor eliminator. 
Our room had no hot water 2 days in a row after 11:00am. I also had a friend in a different room on the 31st floor who said the same. 
Our room was very dated. I’m really surprised that Hilton put their name on this property without renovating beforehand. The carpet was so old and dirty that it looked sticky. The mattress feels like something purchased at a Walmart. SMH 
The room did not have blankets nor comforter at all. I called the front desk for a blanket and it was impossible to reach anyone. The front desk and concierge lines were not being answered. I tried reaching the front desk for about 20 minutes before calling from an outside line (my cellphone) and asking for reservations in order to contact the front desk which was answered by a female staff member at 11:30pm on 2/12/2021. I then asked for a blanket and she assured me that it will be right up. That did not happen. I waited 1 hour and 8 minutes before I called on the in-house line for the manager. He apologized and said he would send the blankets up immediately. Not even 10 minutes later the blankets arrived. I want to thank this manager. We appreciate him. Thank you, sir. We also overheard numerous other guests say they could not reach the front desk. This was also the center of our conversation at dinner with our friends from the 31st floor who also had issues calling the front desk for assistance. 
Security was a major concern to us. I wear a Rolex and my wife wears expensive jewelry which is clearly visible. There were no security measures in place to make sure only guests were entering the hotel. Not once did security stop anyone or ask to show any proof of their stay. This is amazing to me. I could not believe that this was happening. Yes there was security by the elevator in a booth, but not once did they ask anyone for proof. Your video surveillance system will attest to that. We stay in many hotels and resorts across the globe and here in the United States that you have to show your key or use it in order to operate the elevator. 
Overall this place was definitely not worth the inconvenience which we endured or the security concerns which did not make us feel comfortable. I had a large amount of cash on me and did not even feel safe to put money in the safe. That’s how seedy this place was. Please do not offer us anything to come back to this hotel. My wife would kill me if I told her that we would be returning. The only time we enjoyed our stay was when we were not in the hotel room. Mind you... this is my wife’s Valentine’s Day weekend. It’s definitely one to remember, but not as a good memory.

title: Great location average room
text: The location of hotel was perfect for our post New Years visit. We had a partial view of the NYE ball. I wish description would have clarified views of time square are not available from double rooms —only single. So not the best view from their doubles rooms even though you pay for a city view. Walking distance to Rockefeller center- which was closed to pedestrians traffic unfortunately. Libby was beautiful and inviting but Rooms could use a little updating. Disappointed that ice machine on floor was broken and no cups in rooms. But overall nice hotel due to location. Staff was also friendly. Felt relatively safe (pandemic wise at this establishment) but definitely felt other hotels have done better job addressing.

title: DIRTY!  RUN DOWN WITH BUGS!  DIDN'T FOLLOW COVID RESTRICTIONS!
text: We just checked into this hotel on Dec 31st.  First, the so called "sanitation sticker" was not on the door but on the floor (picture).  When we walked in, it appeared that someone had already been in the room.  Also, when got in the room, there were bugs (picture), coffee splattered on the wall (picture), food remnants in the refrigerator and, finally, the furniture appeared was so dirty and worn down (picture) it appeared as if we were in a. "hourly hotel".  To add insult to injury, when I told the manager, there was no apology or an attempt to find another room.  She simple pushed us away and said she would just send someone up to clean it.  I would avoid this hotel if you can.

title: Terrible customer service.
text:
I checked in online with digital key. They didn’t have my room available until 3:20 I was waiting the entire time. I did select city view room which was completely at the other side. I didn’t see any city. Horrible view. 
The worst part was when we checked in I told them if they can store my luggage they said they don’t have that service. I was super shocked. I have emailed them and told them I will never go back there. I love Hilton hotels but this was completely out of order.

title: Never again.
text:
Very disappointing experience. 
My friend booked this hotel for me as a Christmas present, using her Hilton points card, and listed me as a guest. She had no intention of staying there. That's why prior to traveling, I called customer service, gave them a reservation number to check if they can see me in the system, and asked if I will have any issues checking in, considering the reservation is not in my name and I am only listed as a guest. I was assured that it's a no problem, that they see my name in the system and everything will be ok.
When arrived at the hotel, the front desk clerk was very rude, she said she doesn't see my name anywhere in the reservation and I had to call my friend who was already traveling to another country, the employee almost yelled at her trying to confirm information, then I was given the keys and very rudely told the checkout time. 
The room is not equipped with a coffee maker, fridge, or microwave, there was no water or even paper cups, I had to drink tap water from the tap. No laundry for guests either. The mattress and pillows were terribly uncomfortable. The door was making noises all night because of the draught (I had a corner room). 
The whole hotel looks outdated, they only charge so much because of the location.  
If I had to pay my own money for this, I would be very upset. And I still feel bad for my friend who wasted her points on this joke of a place. There are much better hotels in NYC that charge much less.

title: Times Square and  Quarantine
text:

Michelle

title: HORRIBLE stay! AND Bed bugs!
text: I checked in on Friday, DEC 11 & my first thoughts were it seemed nice. I'll be back!!

title: Great for the cost
text: We stayed here in the midst of this incredibly tough time in the city, and this hotel met all of our needs. Our room had some blemishes, but the rooms were clean, it had a great view of Times Square, and it was a convenient location.

title: Not clean

The room also smelled liked cigarette and the rugs were dirty. The location is great. I just wish the room would have been clean.

title: Worst experience ever
text: If you like to get high with weed or enjoy that smell , then it’s the place to stay but do not plan on taking you children there. Called to ask if I could be transferred to another room on another floor. But was told they are unable to do anything about it. The hallway smelled like weed all night and morning. I woke up at least 3 times to place towels at the bottom of the door so smell would not come in. I was in 17 floor room 1705 to be exact. My family and I was very disappointed. title: Listen to the bad reviews.
text: This hotel was horrible!!! It’s outdated and has no closet doors, no microwave or refrigerator. You have to pay $35 extra for a fridge. The rooms have a lot of places with rust and the front desk workers have nasty attitudes. I stayed here for my birthday and i regret it. This hotel messed up my birthday weekend. Please spend your money elsewhere. The room is stale and reminds you of a cheap motel you see on tv.

title: Amazing Hotel in Times Square with Attentive Staff and Spacious Rooms!
text: The Millenium Hotel Times Square is a fantastic location located in the center of it all.  I came for work purposes and was pleased to see the lobby being cleaned up and down after every customer or guest. The elevators were also being cleaned throughout my stay.  Hotel cleanliness is important to me during this time and the hotel went above and beyond to ensure guests found a super clean place to call it a night.  When I arrived at the hotel in the afternoon, the hotel front desk staff greeted me and acknowledged my reservation.  It was a quick and efficient process.  The rooms are quite large compared to other NYC hotel rooms.  The staff are generous with offering service with a smile.  As other reviewers have stated, the hotel is older and due for a renovation, but it is super clean, warm and offers all the amenities you need for a good stay.  I loved the location, the beds, and more importantly, a sense of security.

title: Media election coverage work
text: It was such a pleasure to be greeted by Monique at the front desk of the Millennium Premium Hotel on 44th Street NYC. She checked me in promptly asked if I needed anything and was very courteous to me about any request that I had. (Directions, restaurants etc) My first day was such a pleasure that I came back the following day and stayed at the hotel again with Monique in mind because of her promptness and great customer service attitude. People in hotel hospitality need to bring a high standard like she does every day. Thank you for the great experience. A++++++++

title: Dirty and outdated
text: Great location for someone looking to experience NY time square for the first time. However, this hotel is dirty and outdated. Remote control or clicker was NOT cleaned (see picture below). We arrived to the room with the remote/clicker just as seen below. Nasty carpet and baseboard.

title: Front Desk
text: One of the lady’s at the front desk (not the pregnant one) was extremely rude at the beginning of check in. I booked my reservation online through priceline approximately 20 mins prior to getting to the hotel. The lady asked to see a photo ID, so I showed her my driver’s licenses and then i pulled down my mask so she could match my face to my ID. She immediately told me to pull my mask back up (raising her voice as she said it). The rude *ss lady informed me that she could not see my reservation yet; that it takes approximately 30 mins for it to show up in their system. Now keep in mind, i booked approximately 20 mins prior to going inside the hotel. She told me that i would have to come back later to check in. So, i politely asked her if she could point me in the direction to where the restrooms are, and she did. She gave me a card key to access the restroom on the main floor. I went back to the front desk to return the key card and a different lady ( the pregnant one) was standing up there, so i handed her the key card. As i was fixing to walk away i heard my phone getting an email. As i opened up the email, it was from priceline letting me know that my room was booked with my conformation number provided. So, i turned around and the nice lady was still there, so i asked her if she would check once again. She did, and informed me that my reservation still hasn’t come through yet. As she was telling me that, the rude *ss lady walk up behind her and immediately said: “Is that the same one that i was looking up?”, and i told her that i had just received an email stating that my room had been booked. She immediately began yelling at me, stating that she had already told me that it would take approximately 30 mins before it would transfer into our system! The nice lady stepped back as the rude lady was yelling at me (at customer), and i told the rude lady she didn’t have to be rude, and i walked away. I came back approximately 40 mins later and this time i got a male to help me and he informed me that the reservation still hadn’t come through yet, but that give him a min and he would fix it. It just goes to show you that some people do not need to be working with the public.

title: Fantastic Experience
text: I stayed at the Millennium Times Square for two nights in September...was fantastic....service provided by all associates was friendly, efficient and courteous...the hotel is taking all covid related precautions seriously and security is always available to ensure guest safety.  Room was super clean and spacious with fantastic view.  Looking forward to my next visit.  Special shout out to manager Nick Vashista who greeted me during my check in and made me feel like a VIP

title: Friend Bday Trip
text: It’s during the pandemic so I’m not sure if that’s their excuse for having horrible service. They have no microwave or refrigerator. The ice machine was broke I had to go to another floor. Ran out of toilet paper called front desk housekeeping room service no one never answers the phone. The water also stopped working for hours no one never informed us we had to call downstairs. To be located in Times Square this was a little less glamorous than expected

title: Mr
text: The view is nothing  like on the pictures Very disappointed Also when asked for a coffee machine it was very dirty windows were also very dirty Also on website says there is valet parking but that was incorrect

title: Great views but dated rooms..
text: Three day getaway with my boyfriend to the city. Hotel was very clean in a great location in the heart of Times Square. Sadly almost everything is and was closed because of covid 19. The  lobby was pretty a little dark with all the black marble floors. We were lucky enough to get a conner room on the 44th floor with amazing views of the city. Sadly the room was dated and the bathroom seemed old. The mattress was great and comfy but I noticed the bed sheets were all ripped up at the Conners and when I checked closer I noticed the mattress had no zipper protective cover. That kinda shocked me. Being a native New yorker knowing the issues here in the city I was really surprised. The blanket and pillows also seemed in bad shape and after two days nobody from housekeeping ever showed up to clean the room so I cleaned the room myself. The bathroom only had two towels it was okay but I think for the price they shouldn’t have torn bed sheets on the beds. All and all we still had a good time and the the place was quiet but I dont think we stayed here again because for the same price you can stay in a more modern hotel near by..

title: Up To Our Standards
text: Our family very much enjoyed staying at the Millennium! The location was ideal right next to time square! They had plenty of elevators, little shops and places to eat connected to the hotel, the room was well kept and clean, it even had a bottle opener in the bathroom. The view was also very nice, we really enjoyed the room and the view. The hotel common areas were clean as well and everyone was wearing a mask. No complaints. Would definitely try and stay here again.

title: centralissimo

title: Terrible!!
text:
My god, the photos on the website are MISLEADING! Whoever they hired to Photoshop those photos must be a magician. 
BEFORE YOU BOOK, know there are no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms. 
No coffee makers. No cups!! 
Okay, continuing: I walked in, just one employee at the counter and a long line, so there was a wait. No refreshments anywhere. No carts to help transport your luggage to your room. I get to the room, it’s hot as hell, the thermostat needed new batteries. New batteries didn’t help the temperature, but worsened it?? How, right? It was blowing HOT AIR after new batteries were installed! Thankfully, I was moved to a different room, though sadly, still hot as hell. Since I was ready to explore Times Square by then, I had to just suck it up and sleep in underwear with my friend in the same room (awkward) for the 3 nights I was there, in the hard ass beds. 
The hall ways were stained and smelled strongly of smoke, cigs and marijuana. I could hear my neighbors clearly having sex. I could hear the skin slapping, so the walls are nonexistent. 
I was highly embarrassed when my friend asked, “are you sure this is 4 star? I want to stay at a 2 star and see the difference,” since it was me who picked out the hotel. Everything was falling apart in our room. Missing handles from the drawers, broken class closets, phones from 1990, which were dirty. Trash in the ice room. Stains on the floor in our room. Garbage from the previous occupants in our room. No vending machines that I could locate. So bring water with you!!! 
In summation, this hotel needs a SERIOUS face lift! However, it was ridiculously close to Times Square, so if loud and rambunctious young adults and crack heads prowling all night by your window is what you’re looking for, you’re in luck! In hindsight, I would have been better off at a Motel 6. At least they allow you to lower the temperature in your room, I might have had a softer bed and paid less.

title: Birthday to HELL
text: No clear communication, James the worker was rude and if u ask him any questions  about charges or what is being  charged he was very condescending.  My American Express was overcharged and manager had to apologize and adjust. Manager was called due to my room smelling like a smoke box and having mildew in the vents.. i reported it to James who was very condescending while making the phone call stating yes it’s the customer again who had a complaint earlier .... manager nick came back out and stated he can deodorize  the room and leave the door open ... what kind of hotel is this u sell a room that clearly smells like smoke n mold ... all rooms were sold out besides 824 which also smelled like smoke (complaint from another customer) later that night asked for ice which had to be brought up from the basement ...... from a worker in a bag .... right weird don’t worry about it that never came ether ... i will never stay here again And so much for a birthday night ...stay away pls someone needs to see what’s going on here

title: Didn’t have Times Square View Rooms Available
text:
I had read a previous review that said they paid for a Times Square View room but weren’t offered it due to the hotel supposedly not using those rooms because of COVID-19. Despite that review, I was hoping that the hotel remedied this issue considering the fact that they were still letting people book Times Square View rooms.  Once I got there, I was given a Ball Drop View room, which, okay, technically has a piece of Times Square in view (specifically the ball) and would be pretty cool...on New Year’s Eve. It just wasn’t what I booked, and the fact that I was given a different type of room with no notification upon check in was what bothered me the most. When my boyfriend inquired about the situation at the lobby, the receptionist got defensive and said the room had a nice view so we shouldn’t be complaining, and my boyfriend reiterated that, sure, it may have been nice, but it literally wasn’t what I had paid for. The manager then came in and told him that the Times Square View rooms weren’t sanitized. All I wonder is..why? If someone books a room a couple weeks in advance, shouldn’t that be enough notice to have one of those rooms prepared? And if not, shouldn’t you do the courtesy of letting them at least know you couldn’t fulfill your promise? It just feels like bad customer service and like we were the ones in the wrong.
Overall, the hotel was pretty nice: they do have a coffee/tea maker in the room, the bathrooms were nice (they have a separate tub and shower!), the thermostat worked and was adjustable, and the robes and slippers were certainly a nice touch. So I guess the takeaway is...come to this hotel if you don’t care what view you’re gonna get!

title: Never Again
text: Upon arrival was not greeted as a Hilton Diamond member or told about services that are available.  When arrived in room could not understand why kept coughing.  Next morning real8zed there was black mold over the bathtub and also was painted over in shower.  Went to front desk to inform and request a room change because sensitive to mold spores.   When stated that I have never had this issue at Hilton’s before, was told this is not a Hilton hotel hut an affiliate.   Went out to walk around waiting for a new room and went into Marriott Renaissance hotel and booked a room for rest of stay.   Went back to Hilton and told them I was checking out.    Don’t stay in room 2122 until they remediate the mold and not just paint over.

title: Decent hotel with very poor service
text:
Imagine walking into a hotel after a tiresome 2 flight journey and immediately bombarded with rudeness by a front desk employee. That's what happened to me in this hotel. When i checked in on 07/24 A fat guy at the front desk bombarded me with rudeness like 1) there is no reservation in your name,  then he found my reservation and was like 2)  Do you have enough money in your card to pay or will it be declined 3) You will not able to come out of your room as you will be in quarantine.  

Am i a hotel guest or a felon in prison? Dear hotel management can you please teach some manners to your employees. checked out today and won't EVER BE COMING TO THIS HOTEL AGAIN

title: Accommodating
text: First I want to thank the gentleman Tim that works at the front desk for helping me. He really has a heart. The room was nice and comfortable for night that I stayed. I also enjoyed them having a Tv with app so i was able to watch Netflix.

title: UNBELIEVABLE
text: I have a room booked at this hotel for early September.  Because New York City is a global COVID epicenter, it would be very unwise to visit.  I approached the hotel for a refund and they said no.  They are obliging me to risk infection.  I would not be surprised if this is a chain-wide policy.  Do yourself a favor.  Do NOT book Millennium hotels anywhere!

title: Great hotel in Times Square
text: This hotel was a stone throw from Times Sq. Right in the heart of everything. It was quite reasonably priced as far as hotel goes in these areas. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were modern but in need of some remodelling. It was walking distance to the Rockerfeller centre and Fifth Avenue.

title: Holiday getaway.
text:
Nice location, friendly staff, room clean, towels changed daily.  There is a charge of 28 dollars daily,as well as feed for internet and concierge.175dollarsvwould be reimbursed into your credit/debit card, the one you have to hand over at checking on.
Arrived Friday night on the midst of corono virus. All was well until Monday when they closed the food had to be ordered in.No evidence of coffee as promised in read up.On the morning I was leaving, the hot water was turned off,I had to have a cold wash. Time there was Ok otherwise.I would go again ,but in better times.

title: La ubicación es lo mejor.
text:
El hotel está a unos minutos de Times Square, lo que hizo que lo eligiera, ya que iba pocos días. El hotel está un poco anticuado, muchas habitaciones y un trato impersonal. El desayuno muy caro para lo que ofrecen. La calefacción es de aire caliente y en el baño no hay.
El precio fueron 250€ por noche, en la linea de los que están por la misma zona.

title: Close to great
text: This place would be a gem if they would install some softer mattresses.  We had four rooms (5 beds) and everyone ages 19-72 said the beds were extremely hard.  The rest of our experience was great.  We checked in several hours early.  We stored our bags for several hours after check out.  We had no problems with either.

title: Great Location, not yet up to Hilton Standards
text: Great location, right on Times Square. Hotel is not yet up to Hilton standards, so if you’re a HH member please bare this in mind. Rooms are very dated- cheap and cheerful, was okay for us as we were only in there to sleep. We had hairs from previous guest in our bath tub which wasn’t pleasant.  Although it says it is a Double Tree- no cookies as of yet. Breakfast staff were very friendly, although breakfast itself was quite disappointing. Overall, I wouldn’t stay again I’d choose another Hilton on Times Sq, but we were only there for 2 nights this time.

title: No air conditioning
text: What hotel of this price point doesn’t offer air conditioning when it’s mid 70s outside? I expect to be able to have a comfortable temperature plus have an updated room for the price of the suite we had.

title: Feeling a little disappointed
text: Pros: The elevator was fast; the location was great, & the lobby was beautiful, but the room did not have the same luxurious appeal.  Cons: Old & tattered carpet.  We had major dark stains, there was grout in the bathtub which looked like a sloppy repair job, the drapes are in desperate need of upgrades - consider effective blackout drapes with clean sheer curtains, add the cookies that is well-known with the Doubletree brand, new wall paper- there was a dark smut stain on the wall next to the bed that was very noticeable.  The AC wall unit did not work so we were terribly uncomfortable the entire time.  We opened the window at night, but the night air was just too frigid.  No Microwave in a hotel of this size and magnitude is absurd.  I am a Hilton Honors member and I believe in giving credit where credit is due, but I also believe I should receive exceptional service at any Hilton Honors location where I choose to stay; If not, I will let the establishment know and make alternate arrangements in the future.

title: In Times Square
text: My family and I had a great time and the location of the hotel was perfect. Staff were excellent the only thing I wish we had was a microwave and or refrigerator. My children and I felt safe and we absolutely loved our view from our room windows.

title: No air conditioning and poor service
text: There is no air conditioning during the winter. You are told to turn off the heat and open the windows but it does nothing. The room was extremely hot the entire stay and no fans were provided. My other guest had asthma and began coughing so hard she got sick because the room was so hot. We contacted the front desk about 2 or 3 times and nothing was done to help us and we were given attitude each time. There also was no fridge in the room and we requested one because I had medicine that needed to be refrigerated. We were told no fridges were available at the time but that I could bring my meds down to the lobby and they would keep it for me. I was not comfortable with leaving my meds with strangers and where I could not access it when needed.  We also called the front desk asking for towels and none were ever brought to us.

title: Great location
text:
Just returned from a 5 night break staying at the Millenium Times Square , a,great location for all the attractions as pretty central to all , we walked to all of them .
The hotel is clean and tidy but the room we had was pretty dated , king bed was comfortable but be prepared for lots of street noise as being so close to Times Square this wadnt a surprise.
I've stayed at many Hiltons and was surprised to have no Coffee/tea machine ,this meant a trip to Starbucks every morning which was a shame .
Breakfast is a buffet at $20 per person,  I thought this was good quality and plenty to eat and set yourselves up for the day,  staff were all very courteous and helpful .
So all in all a good Hotel , especially the location,  just needs updating and coffee machines adding

title: Great Location but very dirty
text: Hotel was in a great location and customer service was excellent, however this is an older hotel. The bathroom was quite dirty. Toilet dirty and lots of mold in the shower. Our comforter had been flipped not washed, and the bottom tucked into the mattress had a lot of makeup on it.  We were very disappointed.

title: Muy bien ubicado
text: Hotel un poco costoso,  sin estacionamiento, sin refrigerador, hacen descuento a la 3a. edad ellos,  mas o menos US$ 58 diarios el estacionamiento, está frente al hotel, es mas barato que los de los alrededores,  tengan cuidado donde se estacionan que no sea para vehiculos comerciales, a 1 cuadra de time square, cerca de todas las tiendas que desees ver. Visitar la estatua de la libertad sale unos 50 o 60 dolares cada uno  igualmente el edificio Empire State es bastante costoso, comprar imanes para el refrigerador en la calle, comprar SIM card en lugares que vendan celulares sale US$55 dura 30 días el rooming sale 10 mil pesos diarios en Chile y con límites, ir al lugar donde estaban las torres gemelas, como a 800 mts está el toro para sobarle cierta parte y volver a esa magnífica ciudad, ir a central park, si van el Febrero hace muuuuchisimo frío (menos 9° a las 16 horas). Habitación cómoda con todo lo necesario para el baño, plancha, calefacción,  reservar con anticipación pues nosotros no teniamos reserva y nos cobraron 180 dolares la noche. Moverse en metro a todas partes y hacer combinación, ir a la Fao Schwart aunque no es la misma de hace 20 años aún tiene juguetes muy lindos y novedosos, ir a la tienda de Disney si pagas como US$30 sales en las pantallas gigantes de times square por 30 segundos.  Les recomiendo ir a Nueva York salir de noche es magnifico, la ubicación del hotel es excelente, la atención en mesón muy mala, displicente  total.

title: NYC Business
text: Took a chance .. 1st time stay at this hotel located just off Times Square .. working midtown eastside .. easy access parking garage directly across street .. city view with a touch of Times Square funk .. would/will stay again .. great staff ...

title: Comfort not a guarantee
text: I should have paid more attention to the reviews. I booked this room for my daughters 1st trip to New York. The website states air conditioning, which the room does not currently have!!! I was told by the Mgr they don't have a/c year round, to open a window(that barely opens and no air circulates or will be noisy ). Even though it's only March the room is very stuffy. It should be a guest choice when to use the air so they can be comfortable. The hotel should have fans if not going to provide a/c.  Also fyi- refrigerators are first come. If you are looking for guaranteed amenities-do not stay here . If you have asthma, are hot natured, or have hot flashes definitely do not stay here without confirming which heat or air cycle will be available.

title: Great location but the room was crap
text: The location neat Times Square was great, but the room didn't have any of the typical amenities like a fridge, coffee maker or even a clock.  And, the air conditioning didn't work at all.  Won't be going back to this one.

title: Location, Location
text: If you're going to NYC for Broadway, this hotel is an easy walk from most of the theaters and TKTS.  The elevators are new, the rooms are comfortable if not the most up to date (which to us is some of the charm).  Housekeeping was excellent - most days our rooms were cleaned when we got back from breakfast.  Staff was helpful and pleasant.

title: Excellent Stay
text: From the hotel location, to the staff, cleanliness of the room and overall experience - you can't get a better value in NYC.  Right off time square, discounted parking with partner down the street (yes - it was 40 dollars a night -but it's New York City - what do you want?) and exemplary hotel staff truly made our experience amazing.  WIll do it again the moment we have the time and money.

title: מיקום מרכזי ונוח
text: מיקום מרכזי ונוח מחיר הכי נוח שמצאתי בלב מנהטן. קרוב לכל מקום במנהטן . ממש במרכז טיימס סקוואר- 1 דקה הליכה. חדר נוח ומסודר נקי ושקט כדאי לבקש קומות עליונות יש רעש מהרחוב לא לשכוח במנהטן לא הולכים לישון ןהרחובות פעילים כל שעות היממה.ארוחת בוקר אמריקאית סבירה. לסיכום שווה את המחיר ששילמנו.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is great if you are visiting New York as a tourist. It’s close to everything you need.  It’s in the heart of Times Square.  Our room was on the 38th floor with great views.  BUT.  It has no creature comforts e,g no tea or coffee making facilities.  The room furnishings are very basic.  The staff are very friendly as are all of the people we encountered in New York.   We would go to this hotel again because of its location.

title: Outdated
text: Outdated and small rooms and the bed are not really meant for 2 people sharing like if you stay 4 people in the room. No linen on the blanket/douvet which we found very unhygienically. Bad smell in the hallway and even though we complained on the cleaning of the bathroom sink, nothing was being done. The only positive thing is the location at Times Square. We will never use this hotel again.

title: Pretty disappointed
text:
Stayed here over the weekend for a girls trip... highly disappointed. The location is great, the restaurant was good (Carlos is a great bartender), and that’s about it.
Our air was broken all weekend, the fridge had (seemingly) been removed (spot for it, no fridge..) and there was no coffee maker.

We called to the front desk our first morning to see if we could purchase some bottles of water (**not ONE vending machine there**) they said, and I quote “we don’t deliver water to the lower levels”
The morning of our departure, I went to the cafe downstairs and asked for to-go coffees  (again, no machine in the room), to which I was told they didn’t have to go cups. Fine. I then asked for a regular mug to take up to the room before we left- she said they didn’t have those either. 
This was at 8:30 in the morning on a SUNDAY. 
Bottom line is- aside from the great location, I likely would not return. Less than accommodating and rooms were lacking some essentials.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed here for a week with my sister the staff are so friendly can’t do enough for you . Hotel is in prime position to time square 1 min walk the rooms are cleaned everyday and are so comfy, I did have an issue with my card and Bryan the manager was so helpful would definitely stay here again .

title: Matig
text:
Afgelopen week verbleven in dit hotel. Matig bevallen. Geen vier sterren, met moeite drie. Lokatie en personeel zijn goed, maar kamer en schoonmaak zijn matig. 

Geen koelkast of koffiemachine op de kamer. De deur van de kast was stuk (zie de foto's). Kamer moet gerenoveerd worden. Volgende keer kijken we verder.

title: Times Square
text: Room clean but very dated, location excellent for Times Square, subway and getting about. Hotel needs a complete re-furb we did have coffee machine in room which other guests had said was not available so guess hotel have improved guest experience in response to reviews would use again due to location, good value hotel

title: Great Quick Getaway
text: Went to see the Jill Scott concert, I was looking for a great location not to far from Radio City Music Hall, also close enough Time Square for sightseeing, they had all the amenities I needed, and the rate at the time was affordable. This place was clean, close, friendly, and comfortable exactly what we were looking for.

title: 2 weeks of comfort and convenience
text:
Staff friendly and always helpful. Amenities were very pleasant and comfortable.
Cost is more than reasonable. Location is very convenient for all levels of tourism and the same for all aspects of regular neighborhoods.

title: Not Hilton quality
text: If this is Hilton quality in New York, you can have it.  Unbelievably shabby furniture, dirty and worn carpet, poor quality bed linens (had to request extra blanket 2 days in a row before receiving) no refrigerator, etc.   This "Hilton"  has no hint of quality and priced way above where it should be.   Would never recommend this or stay there again.  It needs a complete redo.  Location is ok if you want Times Square but that is the only good thing to say about it.   Hilton you definitely have explaining to do...based on this I would never stay at a Hilton again.

title: The worst hotel to be avoided at all costs!
text:
As a person who travels a lot, I often stay at a lot of hotels but prefer Hilton brands. They normally offer both savings and amenities most brands do, or are comparable. This usually includes free WIFI, coffee maker, refrigerator and sometimes either lounge access, complimentary breakfast or both if the property permits. 

 After looking online for a good location and available dates I booked the Times Square Millennium Hotel on W 44th Street in NYC as it looked nice enough in the pictures and the location was great, literally around the corner from Times Square. Hopefully they paid the photographer well as pictures can be very deceiving (the room was where pictures are most deceiving but we’ll get to that a bit later)

 The lobby was nice and clean, and check-in was quick and easy. The person at the front desk upgraded me to a room with a better view and I was very happy with the hotel and looked
forward to seeing my room. But once I got to the room, it took all of 2 steps to see the severely damaged furniture and tables with jagged laminate and moulding. Both reading lamps on the headboards were hanging off, the empty cabinet where the refrigerator and the coffee maker were taken out of the room. In the bathroom black mold was visible in the light fixture and vent above the sink. After I called the front desk and was transferred to housekeeping I was told the refrigerator was something that was in limited supply and I would be put on a waiting list to get one. The same was true for a coffee maker. When I asked to speak with a manager about the mold, furniture and electric, I was told he would be in tomorrow and there was nothing that could be done. 

 The next morning when I went down to the front desk I met the hotel manager and explained what condition my room was in. I asked him to go view the room but he declined and told that my room would be changed later in the day and that I would be notified when it would happen. It appears I waited for nothing, as I never received a call or at a minimum a serviceman to fix the electric that was hanging off the headboard. 

Eventually when I did check-out, I spoke with a different manager and was told the hotel was due to be renovated in 6 months and there was nothing to be done. That although they were part of the Hilton chain, they weren’t owned and therefore not subject to Hilton policies. My guess this is to include a bathroom free of mold, furniture you won’t have to worry about getting stitches, electrical lights that aren’t coming off the wall and appliances that are in short supply. But I have to say the biggest disappointments as the indifference by the staff. At no time did anyone come to even look at the problem let alone come to solve it. There are other hotels in the area that offer better deals for less money.

title: Poor Service At An Okay Hotel
text: Across the board the staff at this hotel is incredibly rude. Even for NYC standards, the staff is terrible. Everyone we came across that works there was snappy, inconsiderate and simply rude. It is a nice hotel in a good location but that is not hard to find in Times Square. Do not waste your money on this hotel. It seems that the staff is going out of their way to make their guests feel unwelcome. Will not be staying there again.

title: Guest
text: Had an EXCELLENT stay at the Millennium Premiere Hotel in Times Square!!!  Monique was so very helpful with any questions and made my stay there a great one.  It was my birthday weekend and she had great recommendations for places to visit and even left a birthday treat in my room!!!  The hotel is very clean and quiet!!  We were on trip with another couple and the hotel made arrangements so that our rooms were right next to each other.  This is my second time at this hotel and I have no complaints!!!  Will stay here again next time I visit NYC.

title: Great location, even better Staff
text:
The hotel is within walking distance from all midtown attractions, and the hotel staff treats their guests as family, especially the doormen (Adrian and Marcus).
Always a pleasure to come back to this hotel

title: Ignore bad reviews
text:
Just checked out of this lovely hotel. Myself and x2 teen sons. Excellent location right in the centre of everything.
I sas worried sick about the rooms after reading the reviews but neednt have been concerned. The room was lovely, x2 double beds, clean and tidy. We had a coffee machine in our room. The furniture was fine..people who are complaing that it is out dated...really i went to NY to see the sights not the bedside tables! Its fine, decor was nice and simple. We stayed in room 4405, lifts got a little busy but no more than 2 min wait. The reception staff are a little reserved but who carss, they were helpful when needed. Concierge staff are very friendly, will keep luggage for later flight/ call cabs. There is s starbucks right outside the entrance for quick breakfasts if not having breakfast in hotel.
We definitely need another trip to NY as tun out of time...will 100% book this hotel again.

title: Amazing holiday.
text: I personally cant understand why people have moaned about this hotel from the moment we arrived the man at reception had us in fits of laughter he cheaked us in very quickly our rooms where lovely clean and tidy it was a perfect location for time square nothing was to much trouble when we asked for things or help. I would definitely book here again maybe some people expected to much sometimes that's why they have to moan.

title: Disappointing to say the least!
text:
We have just returned from a family break in the Big Apple, so after having this hotel recommended by friends who had previously stayed there. We booked through a third party. When we arrived we were in excited to be in the Big Apple, you would expected the reception staff to be quite welcoming to you!!! This was not the case, the member of staff in question was rude in manners and arrogant too!!!! Argued with myself and husband over city tax and didn’t explain anything very well all due to us booking through another company and not direct!!! We eventually got to our rooms, they were extremely tired, furniture damaged, wardrobe doors missing!!! Not what we expected, we were informed they were fully booked, however at the time of checking in the man next to me was upgrading to another room!!!!! 
The bed/bedding was clean and decided to just get out of the hotel and explore! We did have various over issues while staying here, bathroom tap hanging off the wall, safe was jammed with a code, the toilet flooded in one of the rooms, when I phoned reception to sort they sent the maintenance man with a plunger. Let’s just say he didn’t he didn’t care about excess dirty water being dripped all over the carpet when leaving! 🤢 I was also left to use the clean towels to clean the bath floor myself!!! Thought I suppose to be on a holiday myself!!!! 🤨. We spent most of our time out as the hotel was such a disappointing experience. When checking out the same member of staff asked’ did you enjoy your stay?’ And I replied not really. He then didn’t ask why? He handed my checking out receipt for the room and said goodbye! Extremely surprised, they obviously know what the customers think already! 😳
The only person at this hotel worth mentioning was a man called Max who is on the theatre booking desk, we booked a helicopter flight over Manhattan with him and he was so helpful. That was a brilliant experience, well worth doing! 
We have stayed in many hotels and I have never had to write a review like this. Extremely disappointing and certainly will not be recommending this hotel to any of my friends even if it is Hilton affiliated. 😠

title: Super Hotel, tolle Lage
text: Ich liebe das Hotel und die Lage. Mitten drin und die Aussicht ist einfach grandios. Sehr empfehlenswert. Die Zimmer sind groß und einfach schön. Gegenüber ist das Times Deli mit leckerem Frühstück und alles was man so braucht.

title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is just perfect for vacations to New York. The rooms are spacious and clean and the location slap bang in Time Square is perfect. Above all Adrian the door man is not just welcoming but so very helpful. Nothing is to much bother. He is more a host than a Doorman. He will advise or arrange anything for you and his charming friendly personality is just wonderful. He is an asset to the Hotel. The rooms are basic with no tea or coffee making facilities unless you ask for them and even then it is not that functional what they provide. This though is the only negative as the Hotel it self is very nice inside.

title: Do not reserve at this hotel! Think twice!!!
text: i reserved a room with my wife for our honeymoon in here. However when we arrived to hotel they told us you cant stay bcs we booked different date by mistake. They didnt even help to give us room or change the date. They refused to give us refund even though we showed them we booked the room for a month later. They were so rude and didnt even help a bit. Please before reserving this jotel think twice!!!

title: Great location
text:
Great hotel in middle of it all. Hotel room was spacious, could do with a modernisation. Clean though. Wasn't noisy at all. We were on 23rd floor, looking out to H&M building.
On 45th st outside hotel was starbucks to get good caffeine fix. As no tea & coffee facilities in room, and restaurant downstairs doesn't provide.

Would recommend to others.

title: Very dirty for Hilton
text: I stay in a bunch of hotels for business and can say this one is not one I recommend. It’s very dirty outdated and has odors that many other of the New York hotels do not. This wasn’t just a you get what you paid for on price, there were stains on the bathtub in the bathtub to the point were you felt dirty getting out the shower.

title: Borg
text: Na maanden wachten op de borg die we op heden nog niet terug hebben ontvangen. Tijdens het uitchecken is ons medegedeeld dat de borg teruggestort wordt binnen 14 werkdagen. Wij adviseren niet te boeken bij hun. Waardeloze service. Locatie is prima alles goed te bereiken.

title: Great stay, friendly staff & reasonable rates.
text: Great stay, friendly staff & reasonable rates.  The location is great and the staff interacted well with my family!  Will definitely be coming back here again - nice view and good size rooms.  Quick check-in and check-out!

title: Great location but wow! does this place need work!
text: Perhaps Hilton will update this newly acquired property.  I sure hope so.  It certainly doesn't live up to their brand.  The location is great-not directly on Times Square but close to the action.  But the rooms are so outdated, and no coffee maker, no refrigerator, no room service.  The room was spacious, however, so if you're looking for space and close proximity to theaters and restaurants, and don't care about the lack of extra amenities, then this hotel is OK.

title: Cada año me hospedo aquí
text:
Esta es la 3a vez que elijo este hotel. Su ubicación me encanta pues está a menos de 100mts de Times Square!! Entre 6ª y 7ª av, con puertas en la 44 y en la 45 st, ósea cerca de muchas cosas!! La 5ª av, Sn Patricio, hell's kitchen, macy's, madison square, moma, relativamente cerca de central park, etc.
Las habitaciones son amplias y sobrias. Me gusta que todas las habitaciones tienen ventana. 1 vez me tocó escuchar el ruido de la ciudad, que no me molesta. 
Esta vez, no me pareció que el servicio de cuartos no me cambió el edredón que se me ensució. Pero en general, me gusta el hotel, volvería a escogerlo.

title: Great location - but that's about it
text: Good location. Decent price for NYC. But you do get what you pay for. Outdated rooms, dirty room carpet, rough towels. No hot water this morning for showers. No coffee in the room or really in the hotel unless you have a breakfast voucher. Fortunately, there is a Starbucks right next door. Ordered a drink in the bar after a show last night. One minute after getting the drink, we were told: "We are closed now, you have to leave." - very rudely. No "I'm sorry, you have a few minutes." Nothing. We stay in Hilton properties several times a month - this is not worthy of the brand.

title: 4 nights of bleh
text: Rooms are dirty and run down. Mattresses have permanent dips. Bathrooms are gross and need repair. Though I was staying at a hilton but this is about a two star hotel that costs much more than it should. Today we dont have hot water :(  location is good but would gladly move to any nearby Hilton that had been renovated in the last 29 years)  save yourself the frustration and skip this place. Super disappointed. We are loyal to Hilton but definitely questioning loyalty after this experience.

title: Recent stay at a relatively new addition to the Hilton family
text: Stayed 2 nights in the hotel. The room was more spacious than some you find in New York.  The first night I could not get the room cool.  The thermostats do not allow you to cool the room in the winter, you can only heat the room.  The second night, I called the front desk and they told me I could turn of the thermostat and open the window. Which I did.  This helped cool the room and make it more comfortable to sleep. The hotel is centrally located in Times Square to many theatres and restaurants.  This can be convenient when the weather is not good as it was during my stay when it rained both days.

title: Great location right in Times Square!!
text: If you want to be in/near Times Square, this hotel is hard to beat.  Reasonable price, even with the exorbitant NYC taxes, right in the thick of things.  Very nice accommodations, bathroom was renovated, spacious, would highly recommend this property for fun or business!!

title: Disappointing
text: The rooms are old and run down. I am writing this review right now sitting in our room because my husband had to go to the restaurant to open our wine. We called room service and found out that it closed six months ago. There aren’t glasses or a corkscrew in the room and both front desk and housekeeping couldn’t help. I wouldn’t mind as much if it was an overnight but we are here for three nights. Also, no valet parking. I’m a diamond member so Hilton is our brand but we won’t be back to the millennium Times Square.There are plenty of other great hotels in the area.

title: Great location, BUT Urban Destination Charge???
text: This hotel is in a fantastic location for Broadway, Times Square, Restaurants, Bars, etc. My room had a desk but no desk chair and the closet doors were missing. There were hinges where the doors used to be. Room 2213. Strange. What really made me mad was the added $25 "Urban Destination Fee". This was not disclosed when I booked it. It didn't include anything other that what should be included anyway, like Wi-Fi and the fitness center. It did not include breakfast. I showed them my booking through my corporate travel site which did not disclose this fee. They reluctantly removed it. Please don't add on these junk fees! It's just a new term for resort fee.

title: Great location and very comfortable
text: Located close to times square, on 44th street. Very comfortable and large rooms with nice views. A good New York experience. No lobby but nice small cafe and restaurant at ground floor. Great for business or couples looking for a great NY experiance.

title: Never again
text:
Dirty, run down, rude personnel
The whole facility is in need of deep refurbishing. My room was dirty: I found two dirty  pillowcases belonging to the previous client in the a drawer a q-bud and other papers (!) behind the side table. A sense of weariness everywhere. Breakfast was poor and the service rude.

title: New year stay
text:
We stayed here from 30th December until 4th January over the new year holiday. The location is excellent however the hotel rooms are very dated and in much need of repairs. Our room had holes in the carpet, wallpaper coming off the walls, mould around the bath, cracked light switches etc. 

There is no room service / no mini fridge in the room or tea/ coffee making facilities. I expected much more and was very disappointed with our stay.  There are plenty of other hotels in the same price range, I would not stay here again.

title: Tim Runs A Great Operation!
text: I recently stayed at your hotel and had an absolute blast, Tim arranged a great stay for me and made it so I did not have to move rooms with my split reservation. His team was prompt and friendly. Thank you Tim, you made our trip amazing!

title: Stained Carpet Hot Box
text:
The Millenium is now a "Hilton affiliate," but they are a long way from Hilton level quality. It was not a terrible place, but they just do not care about the details. The carpet looks decades old with stains everywhere. Crud in the corners of the bathtub do not inspire confidence, and even when you turn off the heat the room is still very hot. 

The breakfast experience is mediocre at best. Generic food and a staff with an attitude. The restaurant was 80% empty and they would not let me sit near the window as it was a "4 top." It was still almost empty at 8AM when I left! The good news is that the front desk was very good, the location is quiet even though it is near Times Square, and the rooms are a good size. Hopefully they can raise their standards a little. 

TIP: You can enter from either 45th or 44th street - look for the Millenium flag.

title: Perfect Hotel location in Times Square, New York
text:
Just completed a nice stay, with my wife at The Hilton Millennium Times Square.

The hotel is located on 44th st, between 7th and 8th Avenue. It's right in the heart of Times Square, within a short walking distance to all the shops, theatres, resturants and the general hustle and bustle. 

Our room on 50th floor, was spacious, with a comfortable bed and an amazing view facing the clock and all the bright lights of Time Square. 

The concierge, we're very helpful, providing information for our trips, tour buses and theatre shows.

As we were out sightseeing all day and everyday for 6 days, we are out for dinner, but had breakfast in their main resturant. The staff were nice, but on day 3,4 and 5 we had Nadia hosting, who provided a warm, welcoming and increased level of customer service. 

As we had a late flight, on our final day, Sharleen the front desk manager, was kind enough to grant us a late check out, which really helped to freshen up before our flight.

On check out, the door team loaded our luggage into a waiting taxi, providing a smooth departure. 

Thanks to all the Hilton Millennium Times Square staff, for a great stay.

title: 2 days in NYC, Frozen, M&M, Planet Hollywood, and Millennium Times Square Hilton
text:
Perfect Location- Not sure you can get ANY better as far as location.
Staff was 100% Perfect. Also, not sure I have had a better staff experience anywhere. From Doorman to concierge to front desk. 
Room was clean, spacious, (especially for NYC!)
Individual thermostat and windows that opened for extra fresh air- this hotel is an A.

title: Sound choice in Times Square
text: Although Times Sq is my least favorite part of NYC, I had to be there for business meetings. This hotel has good, quiet rooms—albeit with few amenities. Staff are helpful and friendly. A great place for the price.

title: In the Middle of EVERYTHING
text: I had been looking all over Manhattan for the best place to stay but my brother convinced us that a place near Times Square was the way to go and I gotta say I'm glad we listened to him. There was nothing like walking out of the hotel and being immersed in the essence of New York City. We were literally steps from Times Square, from Broadway, from an endless list of shops and restaurants - location was perfect. We splurged for a Times Square view and weren't disappointed. We were high enough (36th floor) that the noise and traffic from the street weren't too bad as well. The room was clean but slightly dated and smaller than other hotel rooms we've enjoyed before but nothing that was off-putting. Would definitely recommend and stay at again!

title: RECOMMENDED !
text: Excellent Service, definitely recommended. Clean, Friendly, helpful. We were a total of 8, 3 adults 5 children and we all had a great time in NYC. Erika the Concierge was amazingly helpful and nice, she helped us plan and get all we wanted to do done.

title: Great location
text:
Great location. Older
Room but clean. Could use a facelift. Walking distance to everything Times Square, Rdaio City etc. no fridge or coffeemaker. Very helpful concierge. Fast elevators. Stayed on 19th floor near elevator and ice machine. Surprisingly quiet.

title: A taste of NYC
text: This lovely Hotel is large yet intimate! It has class and charm. We stayed on the 32nd floor with a view of the Time Square Ball. It was fun to see it changing colors constantly. The rooms are quiet. The staff very helpful!

title: Average at best, rooms need a facelift
text:
We are in town for a mother/daughter weekend. Here are the PROS:

The hotel is in a great location to Times Square. While being close, it is not noisy. Beds are comfortable. The staff has been warm and helpful. 

Now for the CONS:

Our rooms are adjoining. The buildup of grime between the doors is gross. The hotel may have been nice 15 years ago. The rooms are tired and not that clean. There is grime on every corner and I won’t go barefoot on the carpet. However, the linens are all clean. There is a serious lack of modern amenities for plugs or USB ports for charging. We have an extension cord on the night stand that provides the only visible usable plugs. 

For the price, I’ve stayed in better and in worse. I’m giving this an average at best review. The location is terrific. Staff is great, but serious renovations are needed to freshen up the rooms.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
I was worried about the state of the rooms after seeing some reviews as some had referred to them as small and tired and dirty. This was absolutely not the case!
I had a standard room with two double beds, there was still plenty of space in the room and the bathroom was also spacious.

Check in was fast and easy and there wasn’t much of a queue. The resort fees were much less than we expected!

The beds were comfortable and clean.
The bathroom was spacious, clean and the shower was decent. There was little bottles of shampoo etc which I didn’t use but thought it was a nice touch.

The location is great, just off Times Square which surprisingly didn’t disturb our sleep! We were shocked it was quiet at night as we had heard that it could be busy.
There is also a Starbucks next door, if you use the back entrance which is great to get your morning tea/coffee quickly!

There was maid service everyday and the maid I spoke to was lovely.

I asked the day before we departed I asked concierge if they could help me with my taxi transfer confirmation. The gentleman on the desk called them and confirmed it for me! He was very helpful and also lovely.

The hotel can also hold your suitcases if you have a delay between checkout and you flight so no need to carry heavy bags around! This was free but tip the staff who look after your belongings!

The day before checkout I asked reception about a late checkout and they said it was no problem, it was $25 per hour and the first was complimentary.

title: Tired Rooms
text: Hotel is in a good location if you want Midtown/Times Square, and price was very reasonable. Staff was friendly and helpful. But the rooms are dated and worn. Not that they weren't clean, but cleaning couldn't help the appearance. Would not stay here again.

title: Birthday weekend
text: Great location,  friendly staff,  good sized rooms. Would definitely stay here again.  Arrival and departure were easy,  parking directly across the street.  Hotel was quiet and clean.  Only stayed one night and it was convenient and easy.  A great experience!

title: The staff made sure we had an amazing weekend!
text:
My wife and I had the most wonderful time at the Millennium. And it was all because of the staff. 

Kevin, our bellhop helped us find a suitable room. The first room had some kind of film all over the window. And the second room did not have as good as a view. Then he talked to Brian, the manager at the desk. Brian knew exactly the room we would like. It was 20 floors down and it was perfect! It was a perfect corner view of Times Square. 

Everyone on the staff was so friendly and helpful. We never had trouble getting a cab hailed for us. The Concierge showed us how to get to the subway. The front desk would take anything we dropped off as we would speed back out the door for more shopping.

They even got us a great driver. 

They made our stay so memorable. We don't want to stay anywhere else when we come back to New York.
